loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es: Zenaida de 65 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla donde se dedica  la venta de calzado, vestuario, perfumería, electrodomésticos menores y mercancía en general, la cual distribuye a crédito, entre su clientela, la que poco a poco ha construido.. Ella de estado civil separada, es madre de 3 hijos, que hoy están en la edad adulta y con los que sueña aun, ver exitosos y llenos de oportunidades. Su negocio lo inició para sustentar los gastos del hogar, en una época en la que su esposo, aportaba la mayor parte de los ingresos y ella necesitaba que el bienestar de su familia fuera mejor. Su primer ejercicio emprendedor, fue apoyado por una amiga que le aportó el capital de trabajo para iniciarlo y Zenaida  poco a poco ha ido fortaleciéndolo con mucha disciplina y trabajo. Sus clientes son vecinos y referidos por estos y sus proveedores son principalmente cadenas de almacenes especializados en cada producto, y multinacionales a las que les vende mediante guías especializadas de artículos; ella  permanece atenta a las oportunidades de encontrar buenos precios que beneficien a su clientela con el fin de fidelizarlas y lograr que regresen le paguen puntualmente. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa interior y exterior, además de productos de tocador, que traen  sus catálogos con promociones especiales, y que traslada a su clientela, siendo esta  estrategia, justamente la responsable del éxito de su inversión, pues encuentra en ellos una respuesta a su atención especial.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 65, lives in the city of Barranquilla where she makes a living selling footwear, clothing, perfume, small appliances, and general merchandise.  She distributes on credit to her clientele, which she has built little by little.  She's separated and the mother of three children who are adults and whom she still hopes to see successful and full of opportunity.

She started her business to pay for the household expenses during a time when her husband contributed the greater part of his income and she needed to improve the family well-being.  Her first entrepreneurial business was supported by a friend who contributed the working capital for her to begin.  Little by little Zenaida has been strengthening her business with a lot of discipline and work.

Her customers are neighbors and referrals, and her providers are mainly department store chains that specialize in each product and multinational companies who sell to her through specialized catalogues.  She remains alert for opportunities to find good prices that will benefit her customers, with the goal of cultivating their loyalty and getting them to pay her punctually.

Currently she's applying for a Kiva loan, her second loan request from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She'll buy clothing, underwear, and toiletries that come with special catalogue promotions that she passes on to her customers.  This strategy is precisely what's responsible for the success of her investment, because they respond to her special attention.

loans.use: to buy clothing as well as toiletries from catalogues

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La socia solicita se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de salchipapas que es un plato a base de salchichas con papas y ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado con limon,la socia el ceviche vende en las mañanas y en las noches vende las salchipapas,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita le credito para comprar pescado y limon y tambien para comprar salchichas y papas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: She continues working selling ‘salchipapas’ which is a dish based on sausages and potatoes and ‘ceviche’ which is a dish based on fish with lemon.  She sells the ceviche in the morning and the salchipapas in the evening.  She’s been in this business for five years and does very well.  Her dream is to open a restaurant.  She requests the loan to buy fish and lemon as well as to buy sausages and potatoes.  She’s happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy fish and lemons and also to buy sausages and potatoes.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: Cordiales saludos!!! Este es el grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” conformada por 09 socios trabajadores que  en el transcurso del tiempo han ido  mejorando sus negocios. Este es el caso de Elizabeth una de las integrantes, madre soltera con  01 niño y tiene 24 años de edad. Hace más de 01 año que se dedica a la venta de sábanas, frazadas y colchas, la cual los ofrece a pedidos. Con los trabajos que realizo y el buen uso que les dio a su ingreso pudo comprarse una mototaxi la cual lo alquila como servicio de transporte, generando un ingreso extra para su hogar. Su mayor deseo es de poner una tienda, pues así asegura ella tendrá mayores ganancias. Su último crédito lo destinara para la compra de sábanas, frazadas y colchas. Se siente feliz y agradece a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito. Elizabeth está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste casaca roja.
texts.en:
Cordial Greetings!

This is the “Mujeres Triunfadoras” (Victorious Women) group.  It has nine, hardworking members who have been improving their businesses over time.  This is Elizabeth’s case; she’s one of the members and is a single mother with one, 24-year-old son.  She’s been selling sheets, blankets and bedspreads for over a year based on prior order.  With the work she did and the good use she put her income to she was able to buy a mototaxi that she leases out to provide transportation services generating extra household income.  Her greatest wish is to open a store because she’d be sure to earn higher profits that way.  She will use her latest loan to buy sheets, blankets and bedspreads.  She feels happy and grateful to the people who make this loan possible.  Elizabeth is in the rear, third from the left and wearing a red jacket.

loans.use: to buy sheets, blankets and bedspreads.

loans.name: Adrian Gregorio

texts.es:
Adrian es un hombre de 28 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su esposa y su pequeña hija, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Adrian no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, ya que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para apoyar a su padres, quienes trabajan en el campo como agricultores y le enseñaron este negocio.
 Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Adrian se dedica a la agricultura, él cuenta con una péquela parcela en la cual siembra maíz, camote y papa, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y lo puede hacer por un aproximado de 8 horas, él cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Adrian se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de abono, fertilizantes y podrá cubrir los gastos de la mano de obra para el riego y curación de su cosecha; de esta manera Adrian podrá tener su cultivo en buenas condiciones y obtendrá una buena cosecha, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda y espera poder brindarle una buena educación a su pequeña.
texts.en:
Adrian, 28, lives in the city of Cañete in Imperial District with his wife and little girl who he loves and are his reason for living.  He’s a very kind, hardworking, enthusiastic man who together with his wife focus all their efforts into getting ahead with their family.  Unfortunately, Adrian was unable to study a professional career because he had to go to work very young to help out his parents who work in the fields as farmers; they taught him this business.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Adrian works in agriculture.  He has a small parcel he’s growing corn, sweet potatoes and potatoes on.  He works every day starting very early in the morning and works for about 8 hours.  He believes he does well because of his experience and the kind way he treats others.

Adrian is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to buy manure and fertilizer and pay labor costs to irrigate and medicate his crop.  In this way, Adrian will be able to maintain his crops in good condition and he’ll get a good crop yield so he can continue working and striving towards reaching his greatest dream: to finish building his house and provide a good education for his little girl.

loans.use: to buy manure, fertilizer and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a vehicle.

loans.name: Boris Cristian

texts.es:
Boris es un joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con sus padres y hermanos, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Boris no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas, ya que tuvo que empezar a trabajar para ayudar a sus padres que son muy humildes, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando un poco de música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos deliciosos Chicharrones de Pollo para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Boris trabaja como chofer en una empresa distribuidora de su ciudad, él trabaja desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 12 horas, Boris se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Boris se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que él desea poder hacer el tarrajeo y puesta de un piso de concreto en una de las habitación de su casa, con ello espera contar con una habitación en mejores condiciones, que brinde mayor seguridad y bienestar para él y su familia, así pues Boris seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional y ser un buen profesional.
texts.en:
Boris, 19, lives in the city of Nazca with his parents and siblings.  He’s a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic person who very much wants to improve.  Sadly, Boris has been unable to study business administration because he had to go to work to help out his parents who are very humble.  He enjoys listening to music in his free time and sometimes cooks a delicious “Chicharrones de Pollo” [deep-fried chicken] to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with much effort and dedication, Boris works as a driver for a delivery service firm in his city.  He works starting very early in the morning and works approximately 12 hours.  Boris feels good doing his work and believes he does well because of the good way he does his work and the kind way he treats others.

Boris is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the support provided he will be able to do some home improvements.  He wants to plaster the walls and install a concrete floor in one of the bedrooms at home.  With this, he’ll have a bedroom in better condition that will provide increased safety and wellbeing for him and his family and Boris will continue working and striving to reach his great dream of being able to study a professional career and become a good professional.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Gouton

texts.fr: Gouton est âgé de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Gouton est marié à une marchande du nom de Eugénie. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et trois restent à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins besoins du ménage. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Gouton mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d’année, l’agriculture dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Gouton fait la transformation des noix de palme et de l’huile de palme dans sa région. Gouton s’approvisionne dans sa région. Afin d’accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Gouton désire acquérir des produits pour satisfaire la demande de ses clients. Pour ce faire, Gouton sollicite pour la quatrième fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gouton is 52 years old and lives in Benin.  He is married to a seller named Eugénie with whom he has six children.  Some of the couple's children are in school and three are still in their care.  Gouton and Eugénie live with their children and jointly take care of the various needs of the household.

To provide for his family, Gouton has been working as a farmer in his region for the past thirty years or so.  In addition to his farming business, he also processes palm nuts and palm oil, locally.  He buys his supplies in his region.

In order to increase his turnover and income, Gouton would like to buy some goods to meet his customers' demand.  To do so, he is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé.  This loan will surely help him to increase the level of his activity and to make more profits.  His previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and palm oil.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de pupusas, tiene 48 años de edad, vive con su hija de 16 años de edad, ella administra el negocio desde hace 10 años, vendiendo pupusas y bebidas, trabaja de lunes a domingo, su hija le ayuda a atender la clientela.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de bebidas, carne, harina, queso, frijoles, leña, estas le ayudaran a mantener lo necesario en el negocio, incrementando sus inventarios y atendiendo mejor a sus clientes.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, ya que es a través del negocio que sustenta las necesidades.
texts.en:
Ana earns a living selling corn tortillas stuffed with cheese, meat or refried beans. She is 48 years old and she lives with her 16 year old daughter. She has managed this business for 10 years now, selling corn tortillas and drinks. She works Monday to Sunday and her daughter helps her take care of customers. 

She requests a loan to buy drinks, meat, flour, cheese, beans and firewood. These will help her to maintain the necessary items for her business, increase her inventory, and serve her customers better. 

She hopes to strengthen her business and offer a better quality of life to her daughter, since it is through this business that she provides for her needs.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, flour, cheese, beans and firewood.

loans.name: Jay Bajrangbali Group

texts.en:
Jay Bajrangbali is a Joint Liability Group formed in the year 2008 by five active women entrepreneurs of the weaving community of Tukla village under Nuapada district in Odisha, India, with a new venture to add some extra income through expansion of the existing business by accessing loans from Mahashakti Foundation. 

To date the group have already accessed three loans and have successfully repaid them. This will be their 4th loan. The featured member Satyabhama is the one who is standing in the front with raised hand in the photo. She is 46 years old, living in a small house with her husband, four sons aged 18,16,14, and 12 years, and her father-in-law who is suffering from paralysis. 

Satyabhama is a very shy-natured and hard-working lady. Her main source of income is cloth weaving and selling. This is her traditional business. Presently she is managing her business successfully with two hand looms where she mainly weaves sari. Satyabhama and her husband do all the work jointly. Her husband brings raw materials (yarn/thread) from a nearby town on credit basis and gives the finished products to the same merchant, which does not give expected returns. She is running in a continuous loss and facing a lot of trouble to maintain the household and cover educational and medical expenses of her family.  So she is planning to utilize the whole loan amount to purchase more stock of raw materials like yarn of her own. This will help her to arrest some unnecessary losses resulting from the credit delivery system and frequent movements to bring raw materials. 

Satyabhama dreams of constructing a house for her family because the present house is very congested for the family members. Jajnasini, Belmati,Sabitri and Purnami are the other four members doing cloth vending, cloth weaving, and footwear businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of yarn/thread to weave saris

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more food items like sacks of maize, grain, and many others.

loans.name: Elsa Edith

texts.es:
Elsa, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, uno de sus hijos es independiente económicamente, y otros dos si dependen de Elsa y su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de Tortillas, este negocio lo tiene en una calle muy transitada, su horario de venta es 6:00am a 2:00pm, tiene fácil acceso, su riesgo es por la zona, donde fácilmente puede ser impactada por algún automóvil.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de una plancha para hacer las pupusas y una mesa, este crédito ayudara a que Elsa, mejore su negocio, aumente su capacidad con una nueva plancha, será mas eficiente con sus clientes.
Su aspiración es fortalecer el negocio, desarrollándose con mas clientes.
texts.en:
Elsa lives with her three children and her husband. One of her children is economically independent, and the other two depend on Elsa and her husband. She sells tortillas. Her business is located on a very busy street. Her sales hours are from 6:00 am to 2:00 pm. Her business has easy access. Its risk is that in that area it is easy to be hit by an automobile.

She is applying for a loan to purchase a griddle to make pupusas [filled corn tortillas, a typical food of El Salvador] and a table. This loan will help Elsa improve her business. By increasing her capacity with a new griddle, she will serve her customers more efficiently.

Her goal is to strengthen her business by developing more customers.

loans.use: to buy a griddle to make pupusas and a table

loans.name: Radha Krushna Group

texts.en:
This Joint Liability Group named Radha Krushna consisting of five active, cheerful women entrepreneurs of Tukla village under Nuapada district in Odisha, India, came out with a new venture to contribute some extra income to their family by accessing credit by forming a group in the year 2009.  Mukula is one of them who is sitting in the middle raising her hand in the photo. She is 43 years old, living with her husband and two sons aged 32 and 30 years. 

Mukula is a very energetic and hard-working lady. Traditionally she is running a cloth weaving unit in her house. Presently she has three hand looms for weaving of saris. Mukula has engaged two skilled laborers to help her in weaving. Mukula pays Rs.100/- as labor charges to the weavers. Her husband also weaves saris in the first half of the day and in the second half moves to different villages by bike for selling. From this business Mukula earns a net income of 6,000 INR which is not sufficient to manage her family and plan for future. Her husband brings raw materials (yarn/thread) from a nearby town on both cash and credit basis and gives the finished products to the same merchant, which does not give fair returns. So she is planning to utilize the whole loan amount to purchase more stock of yarn. 

This will help her to arrest some unnecessary expenses resulting from frequent movements to bring in raw materials. The role of Mukula in the business is to do the work of processing yarn. Mukula wants to save some money for the marriages of her two sons in the near future and construct a house. The other four members of the group are Lalita, Anjali, Kshiramati and Dhanmati who are doing jewellery-making work, general store, tailoring and cloth weaving businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing more yarn

loans.name: Abagambakamu Kibogo Group

texts.en: Leonard is a 32-year-old married man with six children aged between 12 years old and 1 year old who reside in Kagadi, Uganda. Due to his passion for agriculture he started a produce business seven years ago. He has been able to build rental houses to supplement on his produce business and also has continued to do farming. He dreams of educating his children. Weather and bad roads affect his business. He is a member of Abagambakamu Kibogo, a group he joined to be able to access this loan. Leonard wants a loan to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary says that she benefited a lot from the first loan in these ways: her capital has increased, she paid part of her children's school fees, and she is now taking another loan to expand her business further.

loans.use: to purchase more items like cassava flour, maize, grain, sorghum and many others.

loans.name: Gisèle Prudence

texts.fr: Gisèle est une femme de 37 ans, mère de 3 enfants dont l'age du premier est de 15 ans et du dernier de 6 ans. Elle a ouvert un mini restaurant dans un quartier de la ville qu'elle gère depuis 1 ans dans lequel elle vend le tarot (mets camerounais). Grâce à ses mains de chef cuisinier et son accueil chaleureux, elle a pu acquérir une importante clientèle qui est de plus en plus grandissante. Le crédit qu'elle sollicite lui permettra d'augmenter son stock de matières premières (feuille de tarot, macabo, banane) et son stock de marchandises de boissons hygiéniques (jus, bière, eau minérale, etc) ce qui satisfera sa clientèle et augmentera ses bénéfices.Elle réinvestira une partie de ce bénéfice dans son activité et  le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gisèle is a 37-year-old woman and the mother of three children between the ages of 15 and 6.  She has opened a mini-restaurant in one of the neighborhoods of her city, and she has been running her business for one year, serving "taro" (a traditional Cameroonian dish).

Gisèle is a wonderful cook with a warm welcome, and she has managed to attract an increasingly large group of customers.  The loan that she is requesting will allow her to increase her stock of basic supplies: taro leaves, macabo (a tropical tuberous plant), bananas, as well as her inventory of sanitary drinks (juices, beer, mineral water).  These purchases will allow her to meet the needs of her customers and to increase her profits.

Part of her profits will be reinvested into her business, while the rest will be used to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy various goods (drinks etc.) and basic food supplies.

loans.name: Zoirsho

texts.en:
Zoirsho is a hard-working man. He is married and lives with his wife and three children. He has had his own business for two years, and it is his source of income. He sells fruit and vegetables at the local market. He decided to widen the assortment of his goods. He is asking a loan of 3000 Somoni. With it he is going to buy more fruit and vegetables, as he wishes to satisfy the demand from his customers, and always keep his store well-stocked. 

Zoirsho awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy fruits to widen the assortment of his goods

loans.name: Enebishdulam

texts.en:
Mr. Enebishdulam is 24 years old and lives with his wife in a 'ger' (traditional house) in Zavhan province of Mongolia. His wife Serchmaa, aged 21, is an assistant teacher at a local kindergarten. He has been working with his father since he was a little kid as a 'woodman'. His father was a 'woodman' and taught him all about Mongolian traditional 'ger' manufacturing. He married his wife this year and moved out of his parents' house. 

Mr. Enebishdulam is now planning to operate a Traditional Mongolian Ger manufacturing for a living. He needs 1,000,000 MNT to purchase inventory and other necessary items for starting a new business. He is hardworking, optimistic and an enthusiastic person.

loans.use: To purchase inventory and other necessary items for starting  a new business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items like maize.

loans.name: Jumber

texts.en:
Jumber is from the village of Martkopi of East Georgia. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife and three children. Her wife is unemployed and Jumber works as a driver locally to earn a monthly income. Besides his main job, Jumber runs a small dairy farm of one milk cow, whose milk is used in cheese products. The family sells the cheese at the local open market. Jumber works hard, but he still doesn’t have enough income to make some savings and improve the living conditions for his family.

Jumber requested credit for diversifying the family’s agricultural activities. He plans to purchase calves. He will feed them during winter months and sell them for a higher price in spring. The family will have more income. Jumber plans to make some savings from the earned profit, as he wants to improve the living conditions of his family

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
Fanta,   32, lives  together  with  her   friend at  Congo Town. She has two  children, 10 and 16 years old, who are attending  school. Fanta   has a table in the  market where  she has sold sugar, beans, cooking  oil, flour, luncheon meat,  milk, bath soap, slippers, washing soap, oats, and sardines for the past seventeen years.  She received the initial capital  from her  sister to  start  this  business and learned  to sell from her sister.  

With the profit generated from the business, she buys more goods for the business and attend to the needs of her children.   She is requesting a loan to purchase more beans, cooking  oil, bath soap, milk, and oats to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become an international   businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more beans, cooking  oil, bath soap, milk, and oats to increase her sales.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is 35 years old and has three children. She is a married mother and lives in a neighborhood in the town of Samburu, Coast Province, with her children and husband.


Mwanaisha has her own business by which she is able to support her family. One year ago, she established a grocery store where she sells everyday consumer products such as sugar, rice, soap, milk, flour, condiments, tissue papers, cleaning products, and other items.


This is her first loan and she is requesting 10,000 KES so that she can restock her store with more flour, sugar, rice, and snacks, among others. This will improve her sales and her earnings. Her goals are to grow her business so that she can help her children with their studies and to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to restock her store with more flour, sugar, rice, and snacks, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba is a careful mother of three children and a lovely wife. She started her business 10 years ago with cooking cakes, biscuits, pies, etc. She is hard working and works hard every day for nine or 10 hours. She has many customers and sells her products at the canteen. After the organization of the business, the quality of her family's living conditions became better. 

She provides her children with all the modern conveniences, but her income is not enough to pay for her son’s education at the university. Her elder son, Dilshod, is a clever student of Technical University of Tajikistan and tries to be one of the best specialists for the future. Nasiba is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to pay for her son’s education. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to pay for her son’s education.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a businesswoman in Juba. In previous loans, she achieved the following: her capital has increased and part of her children's school fees have been paid. She is taking another loan to continue with her business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items, such as sacks of maize.

loans.name: Iamze

texts.en:
Iamze is from the village of Vaziani. She is 47 years old and lives with her husband and two children. The family earns their living through an agricultural business. They run a small dairy farm of three milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. She sells the dairy from her house. Besides her agricultural activities, Iamze works as a cleaner at the private company and gets a monthly income. She works hard to make some savings and improve the living conditions for her family. 

Iamze requested a loan for purchasing a milking cow. She will be able to produce and sell more cheese. Thus, she wants to expand her business in order to earn a good profit. With increased profits, she will be able to reinvest in her agricultural business, as well as spend more on the family’s daily needs and the living conditions for the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Eleo Moises

texts.es:
Eleo es un hombre de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Santiago con su pareja y su pequeña hija de 2 años, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, él es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente Eleo no pudo estudiar una carrera militar para ser Policía, ya que por falta de recursos económicos tuvo que trabajar desde muy joven para apoyar a su madre y a sus hermanos mejores; en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con su amigos y en algunas ocasiones su pareja cocina unos deliciosos Tallarines Rojos para engreírlo, ya que este es su plato favorito.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Eleo trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola de su ciudad, él trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana, él se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Eleo se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de madera, fierros, alambres y otros materiales, ya que desea construir un pequeño corral donde criar cerdos, así pues é seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder convertirse en Policía y así salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Eleo is 22 years old and lives in the city of Ica, in the Santiago district, with his partner and their little 2-year-old daughter. He loves his family and they are his main motivation in life. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who does everything he can to support his family. Unfortunately, Eleo was not able to become a policeman as he would have liked, because he had to start working when he was very young due to financial problems which meant he had to support his mother and his younger siblings. In his free time, he likes to play football with his friends, and his partner sometimes spoils  him by making delicious Tallerines Rojos [a Peruvian spaghetti dish] because it is his favorite food. 

On his own initiative, and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Eleo works as an agricultural worker on an farm in his city. He works every day from early in the morning. He enjoys doing this work, and he is doing well; something which he believes is down to his hard work and his friendly attitude towards others.

Eleo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, because with their help he will be able to buy wood, iron, wire, and other materials as he would like to make a small pen to rear pigs in. In that way he will be able to continue working hard to achieve his dream of becoming a policeman and be able to move his family forward.

loans.use: to buy materials to make a pig pen.

loans.name: Salvador Antonio

texts.es:
Salvador, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 10 años, tambien vive junto a él su esposa, Salvador se dedica a realizar viajes escolares y al aeropuerto, esto surgió por la necesidad de tener una fuente de ingresos para su familia, su horario es de 7:00am a 7:00pm.
Actualmente necesita hacer algunas reparaciones al vehículo donde realiza los viajes, para esto solicita un préstamo con el que se comprara llantas y dará mantenimiento al vehículo. Este préstamo le ayudara a prestar un mejor servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de Salvador es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Salvador has two children, 12 and 10 years old. He also lives with his wife. Salvador earns a living driving to school and to the airport. This job developed out of the need to have a source of income for his family. His work schedule is from 7:00am until 7:00pm. 

He currently needs to make some repairs to the vehicle he uses to make the trips. In order to do so, he is requesting a loan with which he will pay for tires and general maintenance for the vehicle. This loan will help him offer better service to his customers.

He hopes to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to repair a vehicle used for school transportation.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia, age 49, is a widow with three children. Her children are between the ages of 10 and 28. Two of her children stay with her at congo town and are  currently in school, while her other child lives outside the home and is independent. For the past six years, she has been selling used shoes for children and women. A difficulty she faces is low sales during the raining season. She is proud of her business because with the profit generated from the business, she pays the educational expenses of her children and buys more goods to improve the business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for the business. Her future plan is to educate her children, and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes for her business.

loans.name: Navbahor

texts.en:
Navbahor is 26 years old, not married, and has no children. She works at a pharmacy as salesperson. She is very hard-working and clever. Her colleagues know her as a kind lady. She wants to live in a good living condition but her salary in not enough to buy furniture or technology. She is asking for a loan of 1000 somoni to buy furniture for her household.

She promises to make her payment on time. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her household.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a 45-year-old married woman from Maribojoc, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari store (variety store) for almost a year now. She sells various goods to the people in her community.

She is asking for a loan to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as canned goods, soda, snack foods and others. Through this, she will be able to enhance her sales and profit.

In the future, Lorna hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional merchandise to sell in her store such as canned goods, soda, snack foods and others.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clean her fields.

loans.name: Irène's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Irène la responsable est âgée de 42ans. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Les deux enfants ont respectivement 19ans et 7ans. Irène vend des produits cosmétiques, des mèches, des chemises et des chaussures depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à finadev en vue de maximiser son profit et de contribuer à l'éducation de ses enfants. Irène se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en: This is a group of two women who have taken out a joint loan.  Irene, the leader, is 42 years old.  She is married and the mother of two children who attend school.   The two children are 19 and 7 years of age.  Irene has been selling cosmetic products, hair extensions, shirts, and shoes for several years.  She gets her supplies at one of the markets in Benin.  In hopes of increasing her turnover and to meet the demands of her customers, she requested and got a loan through Finadev in order to maximize her profit and to contribute to the education of her children.  Irene is to the left in the photo.

loans.use: to buy one case of pommade, one dozen hair extensions, ten shirts and four pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Lorena Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lorena, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, vive con su madre y cuatro hijos de 20, 18, 16, 12, todos dependen de ella y tres de ellos están estudiando, Lorena se dedica a las actividades agropecuarias, como la crianza de cerdos, aves de corral, este trabajo lo heredo de sus padres quienes le enseñaron el oficio; lo realiza de 6:00am hasta las 5:00pm, su ventaja es que es su lugar de residencia vende los cerdos desde hace 7 años.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de 6 cerdos y tambien la compra de concentrado para el mantenimiento, esta compra le ayudara a ampliar la granja y tener muchos cerdos, su riesgo puede ser una enfermedad que le afecten directamente los cerdos.
Su aspiración es crear un negocio más rentable, que le permita generar más ingresos y darles a sus hijos las condiciones de vida adecuadas.
texts.en:
Lorena raises pigs. She lives with her mother and her four children, ages 20, 18, 16, and 12. All of them are dependent on her, and three of her children are in school. Lorena works in agricultural activities such as raising pigs and barnyard fowl. She inherited this work from her parents, who taught her this occupation. She does this work from 6:00 am to 5:00 pm. Her advantage is that pigs have been sold at the place where she lives for seven years.

She is applying for a loan to buy 6 pigs and also for the purchase of concentrated feed to maintain them. This purchase will help her to expand her farm and have many pigs. The risk in her work is the possibility of a sickness that directly affects pigs.

Her goal is to create a more profitable business that will allow her to generate more income and give her children adequate living conditions.

loans.use: to buy six pigs and concentrated food for them

loans.name: Nusrat's Group

texts.en:
Nusrat is 28 years old and married. She is an active lady who is living with her husband in the city of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband runs a garment shop. His income is insufficient to cover the household expenses, so since 2005, Nusrat has been trying to help him fulfill their needs by sewing clothing.

Nusrat is well aware of sewing techniques. She sews clothes for the people who live near her house. She serves her community well and has become famous for providing good-quality service. 

For the past few weeks, her sewing machine has stopped working. This was the only machine she has for her business. Due to the lack of money, she is unable to purchase a new sewing machine. 

As a member of a 7-person lending group, Nusrat has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase a new sewing machine.

Nusrat desires to expand her business and intends to spend part of the income on the improvement of her house. She wants to open a beauty salon in future with the profits as that's another hobby of hers. 

Note: In the picture, Nusrat holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Yessengeld

texts.en:
Yesengeld, a humble and hardworking 43-year-old who loves his job and family, lives with his family in a ger, a traditional Mongolian yurt, in Erdenet, Mongolia's third largest city. His family consists of his wife and three children who are 12, 7 and 5 years of age and in school. Yesengeld has been working as a carpenter at a local mining company for six years, while his wife looks after their youngest son.

As the children grow, their ger is becoming too small for the family, so Yesengeld is building a new spacious house that will incorporate energy-saving materials to ensure warmth. They have already built the walls and roof, and only the interior/exterior decorations and wall insulation await completion. The loan Yesengeld is requesting will be used to complete his house. His family is impatiently awaiting the day they can move into it.

loans.use: to complete his house by purchasing energy-saving materials

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 20-year-old married woman and a mother of a one-year-old child from Antequera, Bohol. She has been engaged in her basket weaving business for almost a year now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a carpenter.

Marilyn is asking for a loan to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as bamboo sticks and straw. Through this loan, she will be able to make more baskets to sell, thus increasing her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for basket weaving such as bamboo sticks and straw

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en: D. Ganbat is 53 years old and lives with his wife in a small house in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar. He has been operating a clothing trade business since 1998. He has been managing his current clothes retail at a rental counter at a local market since 2008. He has years of experience and gained a lot of customers' trust over the years. He is now requesting 2,000,000 MNT to import winter clothes to increase the variety of goods and boost seasonal sales. He is a loyal client of Xacbank's seven times with no delinquencies. Ganbat is a positive, responsible and hardworking person.

loans.use: to import winter clothes to increase the variety of goods and boost seasonal sales

loans.name: Nadzuwa

texts.en:
Nadzuwa, 38, lives in a suburban neighborhood in Samburu with her husband and four children. For the last two years she’s been working in her own fruit and vegetables sales business. She sells from her home, where she has a small stall in her compound. The business is profitable and she contributes her profits to cover family expenses. She sells papayas, mangoes, bananas, cabbages, onions, tomatoes, etc. All the fruit and vegetables are fresh, which is why customers prefer her.

The loan she’s requesting will be used to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to keep her business well-stocked always with variety so that sales will increase. Her goal is to always be growing in her business in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ahit

texts.en: Mr. Ahit is 46 yrs old and lives with his wife and son in a small house in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife has operated a grocery store for years but their income is not enough to cover their family expenses. Now they are expanding and starting a vegetable retail business in their grocery store. They will grow organic vegetables on their land, then harvest and sell them in their store. His son, Janarbek, is 23 yrs old and works at a private company. Ahit runs a taxi service business. He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase organic vegetable seeds and other equipment for his wife's new organic vegetable retailing business.

loans.use: to purchase organic vegetable seeds and other equipment for his wife's new organic vegetable retailing business

loans.name: Altan-Od

texts.en:
Altan-Od is a 52 year old woman who lives with her husband and 3 children in a ger in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband Battulga is retired and stays home. Her oldest daughter Altanzul, age 20, is a university student, and her son Gantig and daughter Horolmaa (aged 12 and 16) are secondary school students. 

Altan-Od is an extra-sensory person who foresees people's futures, destinies, etc. She also operates a small retail counter where she sells religious items and other related products. She is requesting 3,020,000 MNT to increase her working capital and pay her daughter's university tuition. She and her husband are hardworking and diligent people who say: "We are living for our kids and we want our kids to be grown up, educated and well behaved".

loans.use: to increase her working capital and pay her daughter's university tuition

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 30 year old mother of three children between the ages of 11 and 15, and all are currently in school.  Agnes ended her education in the fifth grade. She has a table at the market where she sells flour, beans, mayonnaise, sardines, butter, sugar, milk, and many other items. Agnes earns a good profit since her business is in a good location. With the profit, she improves the business by buying more goods.   Agnes has requested a loan to purchase more sugar, butter, milk, and beans for the business. Her plan for the future is to give her children a higher level of education and to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more mayonnaise, butter, flour and sardines for her business.

loans.name: Altantuya

texts.en:
Altantuya is a 42 year old woman who lives with her husband and 2 children in a ger in the Bulgan province of Mongolia. Her husband Tsend works in a private company. Her son Baasansuren, age 19, is a university student, and her daughter Uurintuya, age 16, is a secondary school student. 

Altantuya has been operating a retail clothes business for 13 years, and she is quite experienced within the industry. She is a hard-working, responsible and diligent woman. She and her husband work for their children's education and their bright future. She says that the only goal she needs to achieve is to see her children graduate from a good university with a higher education. Altantuya is now requesting 3,000,000 MNT to pay her son's university tuition and living expenses in the capital city.

loans.use: to pay her son's university tuition and living expenses in the capital city

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
Elvira tiene 65 años, está casada con Julio, con quien tiene 9 hijos. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Elvira es de carácter dócil y agradable es una mujer ejemplar. Lleva más de 50 años dedicándose a la agricultura. Empezó di niña, ayudando a sus padres, por esa razón aprendió con facilidad sobre esta actividad. Cuando se casó tuvo que intensificar sus labores, ya que venían en camino los hijos. Con la ayuda de su esposo cultiva café, limón y naranjas, en sus 3 lotes de terrenos de cultivos. “Ahora estoy cuidando el achiote, porque en un mes más lo cosecharé”, comenta. 
El café también es un producto que le da satisfacciones, pero también tiene que invertir dinero y tiempo. Ella está complacida con sus labores, por eso continuará con sus sembríos hasta que vea a sus hijos grandes e independientes.
Elvira necesita el capital necesario para adquirir abono orgánico. Solicita de su apoyo. Éste es su crédito número 4 con MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Le gusta el trabajo en equipo, por la solidaridad que practican en su banco comunal “Los Productores inchatingari”.
Invertirá los 1500 soles en la compra de bolsas de abono orgánico para mantener sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Elvira is 65 years old. She is married to Julio, with whom she has nine children. They live in their own house located in a native community of the central jungle. Elvira is of a calm and pleasant character. She is an exemplary woman. She has dedicated herself to agriculture for more than 50 years. She began as a child helping her parents. For that reason, she learned this activity easily. When she married, she had to step up her work, since children were on the way.

With her husband's help, she grows coffee, lemon and oranges in her three batches of cropland. "Now we are raising annatto, because in one more month, we will harvest it," she says. Coffee is also a product that gives her compensation, but she also has to invest money and time. She is pleased with her work, so she will continue with her fields until she sees her children become great and independent.

Elvira needs enough money to acquire organic fertilizer. She asks for your help. This is her fourth loan with MFP, so she is committed to being punctual in the payment of monthly installments. She likes the teamwork and solidarity that they practice in her communal bank "Los Productores Inchatingari." She will invest the 1,500 soles in the purchase of bags of organic fertilizer in order to maintain her crops.

loans.use: To buy bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Dúo Balles Del Sargento Group

texts.es: Dúo Balle del Sargento. este dúo está integrado por la señora Herminia de 61 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario de primera nececidad y como actividad secundaria se dedica a la elaboracion y venta quesos tiene su venta desde hace 10 años y gracias a Dios todo le a ido bien, esta solicitando este crédito para la compra de productos comestibles y compra de leche para la elaboracion de queso.
texts.en:
Balle del Sargento Duo. One of the members of this duo is Herminia, who is 61 years old and is dedicated to sell dairy consumer products and staples. As a secondary activity, she makes and sells cheese. She has done that for 10 years and thanks God everything has gone well.

She is requesting a loan to purchase food products and milk to make cheese.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Altangerel

texts.en: Mr. Altangerel is a 57-yr-old man who lives with his wife in a house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife helps him to breed cattle and other livestock and to produce dairy products that he sells three to four times per week to local retailers. He has his own small car to transport the dairy products which keeps transportation costs lower. Altangerel is now requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase cattle used to increase production of his organic dairy products. He is a welcoming and hardworking person.

loans.use: to purchase cattle used to increase production of his organic dairy products.

loans.name: Amanhan

texts.en: Amanhan is 33 years old. He lives with his wife and 2 children in a small house in the Bayan-Olgii province of Mongolia. He has been working as an assistant in a private construction company for years now. His wife gave birth to their son and stays home with the young child. His older son, Daurjan, is 5 years old and goes to kindergarten. Amanhan is now planning to open a butcher shop because at this time of year the price of cattle and meat products is lowest. So he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to purchase cattle from herders and sell the meat to customers at a retail counter which he has already ordered in the local market. He has been helping his parents to breed cattle since he was a child, so he knows lot about cattle and meat production. He is a hardworking, honest man.

loans.use: to purchase cattle from herders

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en: Aquilina is 64 years old and married with three children. She works very hard running a general store in the Philippines to provide for them. She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as bread, curls, detergents and other grocery items.  She has requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. In the future, Aquilina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina, 59 years old, is from the small village of Zestaponi district. She lives with her husband and two grandchildren (12 and 15 years old). Nina and her husband are provided with a retirement pension. Her grandchildren go to school. They are orphans and are provided with an orphan pension from the local government. The family lives in poverty. The family's only income is from agricultural activities. In particular, Nina has two milk cows and four sheep, whose milk is used in cheese production. In addition, she owns 0.5 hectare land and grows different kinds of vegetables. Nina sells the harvested products and cheese locally in an open market. She works hard to insure good harvest. 
Nina requested a loan for purchasing building materials to build a new house. Their existing house is wooden and is much damaged. It’s impossible for family members to spend winter months in such conditions as they can’t install any kind of heating system. Nina wants to create a warm and comfortable environment for the family. She needs building materials for continuing the building process as the foundation of the house is already laid. After the house is built, the family will be able to live in a more comfortable environment and warmly spend the winter. Nina and her orphans await your support.

loans.use: to purchase building materilas and build a new house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy a buffalo for their livestock business.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu, 32, lives with her life partner and their children. She sells fruits and vegetables: lettuce, tomatoes, chiles, carrots, kale, cucumbers, cabbages, oranges, and other produce. She has been a merchant for nine months and has gained the sales experience necessary to increase her profits. Her shop is in her home and serves her neighborhood. She has regular customers because she is well-known. People prefer to shop with her because she always has what they need, her quality is good, her prices are affordable, and her service is excellent.

Saumu is active, dedicated to her work, and has many goals. She works very hard each day to reach these goals and, thus, to achieve success. Like every good merchant, she wants to grow her business and make new investments. She needs capital to do so and has applied for a loan with Yehu to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbages, bananas, and kale, amongst other produce.

loans.use: to buy wholesale fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, cabbages, bananas, and kale, amongst other produce.

loans.name: Osman Calla's Group

texts.en: Teachers of the AL-Harrkan Islamic Secondary School are very grateful to Kiva lenders for the loan they received. With the help of that loan, some of the teachers were able to pay school fees for their children. Others invested the loan in petty businesses and some bought pieces of land/house building materials. Having repaid that loan successfully, they are requesting a new loan in order to further improve their lives. Henry this time is the leader of this group. Born 46 years ago in Makeni city, Henry is married to a housewife and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. Henry has been in the teaching profession for many years now. He has requested this loan to buy house-building materials like bags of cement, for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials like bags of cements, for the construction of a family dwelling house.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Bernardita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and farming rice business. Bernardita is borrowing 29000 PHP through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and fertilizers for her farm.

Bernardita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle and fertilizers for her farm.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura  tiene 42 años está casada con David, con quien tiene 5 hijos cuyas edades oscilan entre 20 y 1 año. Laura y su familia viven bajo un techo propio en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Laura es laboriosa. Las actividades de Laura son varias, atiende su hogar y familia para que ellos también inicien sus actividades diarias. Al culminar sus labores del hogar, se dedica al cuidado de sus terrenos de cultivos.
Actualmente cuenta con 3 lotes de tierras fértiles, en ellas siembra achiote, coco, café, y cítricos como tanyelos y naranjas. 
En estos días el precio de sus productos es bajo. Por ello se esmera en el cultivo de otras plantas que sembró hace poco.
Gracias a su esfuerzo puede asegurar el alimento, vestido y educación de sus hijos. Sus metas más cercanas son ampliar sus terrenos de cultivos y mejorar su producción, para eso deberá invertir en la compra de terrenos y abonos. Ahora piensa adquirir fertilizantes para sus cultivos de achiote, café y cítricos, que piensa cosechar el próximo año. Éste es su préstamo número 4 que obtiene de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales, como lo hizo antes. “Los productores Inchatingari” es el nombre de su banco comunal y se siente contenta de formar parte de un grupo sólido y trabajador.
Con los 1000 soles podrá adquirir de 15 bolsas de abono orgánico como el de guano de ave de corral para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Laura is 42 years old and is married to David, with whom he has five children aged between 20 and one year old. Laura and her family live under their own roof in a native community of the central jungle. Laura is laborious. The activities of Laura are varied, she takes care of her home and family so they can also begin their daily activities. 

When she finishes her chores, she takes care of her land. Currently, she has three lots of fertile land, where she grows achiote, coconut, coffee and citrus fruits such as tangelos and oranges. In these days, the price of her products is low. For this reason, she tries hard in growing other plants she recently planted. Thanks to her effort she can ensure food, clothing and education for her children.

Her short term goals are to expand her croplands and to improve her production. To do that, she needs to invest in the purchase of land and fertilizers. She now hopes to buy fertilizer for her crops of achiote, coffee and citrus plants, which she expects to harvest next year.

This is her loan number four from MFP. She promises to be punctual in paying her monthly installments, like before. Her communal bank is called "Los productores Inchatingari" and she is happy to be part of a solid and hard-working group. With the 1000 soles she will be able to buy 15 bags of compost such as poultry manure for her crops.

loans.use: to buy 15 bags of compost.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items like Nomi, wheat flour, sugar, wool and many other things

loans.name: Haykush

texts.en: Haykush is a 20-year-old woman who lives with her husband, Vilik, in Goris town. Both Haykush and her husband are involved in agriculture. They keep livestock: cows, a calf and oxen. With the help of the loan, Hayksuh is planning to increase the livestock by buying two more cows. She wants to purchase these cows for milking purposes. She hopes that the sales of milk will bring her high income and she will be able to cover her young family’s costs.

loans.use: to pay for two cows.

loans.name: Sarmen

texts.en: Sarmen is 25-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and two children in Tegh village of Syunik region. He works at one of the local military units as a storekeeper. Besides his work he also runs a farm. He keeps livestock and has a plot of land where he cultivates wheat and barley. The loan will help Sarmen to increase the livestock by purchasing eight calves. This will allow Sarmen to earn more income from cattle breeding and ensure a better life for his young family.

loans.use: to pay for eight calves.

loans.name: Virginie

texts.fr: Agée de 47ans, Virginie est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 22ans et 16ans. Elle a une grande boutique où elle vend des sacs de riz, des boîtes de conserve, de macaroni, des liqueurs et de divers depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier à Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Virginie, age 47, is married and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest and youngest children are 22 and 16 years old, respectively.

Virginie runs a large shop where she has been selling bags of rice, canned foods, macaroni and liquors for a few years.  She buys her goods from a market in Benin and a market in another country.

Eager to boost her purchasing power and to fulfill her customers' expectations, she has requested and obtained financial assistance from Finadev.  Her goal is to maximize her profits and to contribute to her children's education.

loans.use: to buy 12 bags of rice, 12 bottles of liquor, 1/2 box of macaroni and 2 boxes of canned food.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with five children, four of whom are attending school. She does not look after any other family members.

Syliva has been selling snacks in a retail shop for ten years, working six days a week. She has rental houses as another source of income. 

She has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock flour, cooking oil, baking powder and charcoal for making the snacks. Her challenges include thieves, seasonality and recovering money from clients who take the snacks on credit. Her dream is to be able to expand the business. Sylvia joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest charge on loans. She lives in her own house with access to electricity but no piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees.

loans.use: To buy more flour, cooking oil, baking powder and charcoal

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Madeleine est une femme de 48 ans mariée, mère de 7 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 et 21 ans tous vont à l'école. elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place ou elle vend des vivres frais (manioc, patate...) en fonction des saisons depuis 20 ans. iSon activité  fonctionne, sa clientèle s'accroit au fil du temps et elle n'arrive plus à la satisfaire à cause de la petitesse de son  capital. D'où l'importance de ce crédit en ce moment pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'augmenter les stocks de marchandises (sacs de manioc et patate). les bénéfices générés par ce crédit seront en partie réinvestis dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste l'aidera à subvenir aux beoins de sa famille dont elle en a la charge.
texts.en: Madeleine is a 48-year-old married mother of seven children between the ages of 9 and 21, all of whom are in school. She is a vendor in a marketplace and has sold seasonal fresh produce (cassava, potatoes, etc.,) for the last 20 years. As her clientele grows, she is no longer able to satisfy their growing demand with her current stock. Therefore, this loan is important as it will allow her to increase her stock of merchandise (bags of cassava and potatoes.) The profits generated by this loan will be in part reinvested to grow the business, and the rest will help her support the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy bags of cassava and potatoes

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 55 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 29,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store. Cecilia has been in this business for 37 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cathy

texts.en:
Cathy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who goes to school. Cathy takes care of one additional family member. 

To earn a living Cathy sells milk in a shop that she rents, on a retail basis. She has been in business for the last 3 years working six days a week.  

Cathy has requested a loan of UGX200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy more milk and bread for resale. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her goals and aspiration are to build her own house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more milk and bread for resale.

loans.name: Dianela

texts.en:
Dianela is 48 years old and married with one child. Dianela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dianela has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income as an Avon dealer and and from an eLoading business.

Dianela aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell at her store.

loans.name: Bisel

texts.es:
Bisel de 41 años, convive con Betty, con quien tiene 6 hijos. Ellos viven en una casa rústica ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Bisel se dedica a la agricultura, produce café, achiote, naranjas, y plátanos en 3 lotes de terrenos que su localidad les otorgó.
“Gracias al plátano podemos cubrir los gastos diarios. Cosechamos a la semana 70 kilos y lo vendemos a 80 céntimos cada uno”, comenta, afirmando la rentabilidad de este producto.
El café y el achiote son frutos que más satisfacciones le dan, por eso se esmera mucho en sus cuidados, para cosecharlos una vez al año.
Cuando sus cultivos están atendidos, él trabaja como jornalero en otras parcelas. 
Gracias al trabajo coordinado puede mantener a su numerosa familia brindándole los servicios básicos. Ahora quiere adquirir otros terrenos de cultivos para multiplicar su producción, pues les agrada el trabajo del campo, pero antes tiene pensado fertilizar sus cultivos para las cosechas del próximo año. Éste es su primer crédito con MFP. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Productores Inchatingari”, y le agrada trabajar con personas serias y responsables.
Con el dinero comprará bolsas de abono orgánico para sus cultivos de achiote y café.
texts.en:
Bisel for 41 years old, lives with Betty, with whom he has 6 children. They live in a rustic home located in a native community in the central jungle. 

Bisel makes a living from agriculture; produces coffee, annatto, oranges, and bananas in 3 lots of land that their locality gave them. 

"Thanks to the banana, we can cover the daily expenses. We reap 70 kilos a week, which we sell at 80 cents each," says, affirming the profitability of this product. The coffee and the annatto are the fruits that give him more satisfaction. This is why strives much in their care and harvest them once a year. 

When he has taken care of his crops, he works as a laborer on other plots. Thanks to this coordinated work, he can maintain his large family by providing the basic services. Because he likes the work of the field, now, he wants to acquire land for other crops to multiply his production but before he plans to fertilize his crops for next year's harvest. 

This is his first loan with MFP. He gives his word that he will pay punctually all his payments. He belongs to the communal bank "Los Productores Inchatingari", and he likes to work with serious and responsible people.
 
With the money will buy organic fertilizer for his crops of annatto and coffee.

loans.use: buy organic fertilizer for his crops of annatto and coffee

loans.name: Munhktsetseg

texts.en:
Munkhtsetseg is 37 years old and lives with her two children in their wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital in Mongolia. Her home is located in a boundary area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity. Munkhtsetseg bought the house a couple of months ago. Even though her house is located far from the downtown, she loves it so much. Her children attend a public school. 

Since March, Munkhtsetseg has been working as gas filler in a gas station. Her husband has worked as a contract worker in Korea since 2010, and every month he sends $250 to his family in Mongolia. Every day, Munkhtsetseg and her children ride two types of bus to reach their school and work; they spend three hours a day just on the way. Sometimes they need to wait for the right bus for an hour. She doesn’t want her children to stand waiting for a bus when the outside temperature reaches -20°C so Munkhtsetseg is asking for a 4,000,000 MNT loan to buy a used car that runs on gas. By buying a car, she can take her children to their school and home. Two months ago she received a driver's license.

loans.use: to buy a used-car

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is an enterprising woman with a desire to get ahead. She's always on the lookout for new opportunities that can allow her to achieve success.

Eunice operates a food stall. She is currently asking for a new loan to expand on this business so she will record more profits. She intends to buy ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, vegetables, and meat. 

Eunice has a good payment history and is morally beyond reproach. She assures us that she will be able to pay off the loan and is confident that it will bring greater economic stability to her home. She is happy for the support she is receiving from Yehu and Kiva. 

Her previous loan enabled her to have improvements in her business and also her home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like wheat flour, sugar, vegetables, and meat.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP13,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. 

NWTF is relisting Estelita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Syuzanna

texts.en:
Syuzanna is 34-year-old and lives in Tsav village of Kapan region. She is a mother to 2 children. Her husband, Hunan, works at the local village village-hall as a gatekeeper. 

The couple is involved in agriculture. They keep cows and a calf and they sell the produced milk and meat to the local market traders.  With the requested loan amount Syuzanna is planning to build a greenhouse where she will grow fruits and vegetables. 

This is important for Syuzanna to earn agricultural income during winter, too, and save for implementation of her future plans. Syuzanna wants to found her own store where she will sell fruits and vegetables from her own greenhouse.

loans.use: to pay for greenhouse construction.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of them attend school. She is not looking after any other family members.

Jeniffer has been selling charcoal and nets from home at retail for the last two years, working six and a half days a week. She has rental houses to earn additional income. She has requested for a loan of 600,000 UGX from MCDT- SACCO to enable her to stock more sacks of charcoal and nets to sell. Her challenges include seasonality. Her dream is to expand her businesses and accumulate profits that will enable her acquire land. 

Jeniffer joined MCDT because there is no relative who can lend her money like MCDT does. She rents a house without access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and nets to sell

loans.name: Rima

texts.en:
Rima is 46 years old. She lives in Meghri town with her husband and son. Her son works at a local military union and is the only worker in the family. Rima and her husband, Libik, are involved in agriculture; they keep a cow and an ox. 

Because of not having sufficient funds for expanding the number of livestock, Rima has applied for this loan. With the requested amount, she is planning to improve the herd with special milk cows. Rima hopes that she will gather more milk and will be able to sell it to local market traders. The loan is very important for Rima and her family to cover basic needs and live in more prosperous living conditions.

loans.use: to improve the herd with special milk cows.

loans.name: Hotamaly

texts.ru: Хотамали в нашей организации кредитуется второй цикл. Он добросовестный, целеустремлённый и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Его сыновья работают в России, но не имеют постоянное место работы, поэтому Хотамали не надеется на денежные переводы сыновей и сам занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхоз культур, так как имеет достаточный опыт по скотоводству и земледелием. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень. В ведении данного бизнеса ему помогает жена. Хотамали на полученный урожай покупает скот из базара на низкие цены, его жена на определённое время откармливает скот и перепродают по высокой цене. На полученный доход от бизнеса Хотамали улучшил условию своего домохозяйство. В этом году Хотамали посеял на 2 гектара земли ячменя, однако из-за неблагополучной погоды Хотамали не смог получить ожидаемый урожай. Поэтому он обращался в нашу организацию с целью получения займа для покупки скота и расширить свой бизнес по животноводству. Скот держит за счёт кормов произведённых его самым. Хотамали надеется на Вашу благотворительность.
texts.en:
This is Hotamaly's second loan in our organization. He's a very honest, dedicated and hardworking person. He was born in a country area which is well known for its agrarian industries. His sons work in Russia, however, they don't have stable employment so Hotamaly can't rely on them fully for support. Therefore, he makes a living by growing crops ad raising animals, areas in which he has significant experience. Mainly, he grows wheat and barley.  His wife helps him run his business. 

He uses profits from the crops to purchase cattle for cheap on the market, after which his wife fattens the cattle for a period of time and then they sell it for a high price. Hotamaly spends his income on his household in order to improve his living conditions.

This year, he planted two hectares of land with barley, but was unable to reap a good harvest due to poor weather. Therefore, he approached our organization requesting a loan to buy some cattle and expand his animal raising business. He feeds his cattle with fodder from his fields. 
Hotamaly hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes de 27 años está casada con Elvis con quien tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 4 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en un anexo rural. Lourdes es una madre trabajadora. Desde los 19 años viene laborando para apoyar en la mantención de su familia. Desde entonces se dedica a la agricultura y la ganadería. Principalmente cultiva papas, avena, habas y maca. Pero a veces la siembra le traía problemas, llegando incluso a perder 2 cultivos, producto de las heladas. Por ello decidió empezar con la crianza de animales. Actualmente cuenta con cuyes, ovejas, vacas y toros, los que engorda en un cierto tiempo y después negocia en su misma ciudad. “El ganado vacuno lo llevo hasta Chupaca (ciudad ubicada a 250 Km. de distancia), porque los precios son mejores”, comenta. Realiza este viaje cada 20 días, por ello confirma la rentabilidad de su negocio.
Este mes tiene pensado adquirir 2 vacas, las que engordará para luego venderlas. Solicita de su apoyo por eso. Mientras tanto se dedica a la agricultura y al cuidado de sus animales menores. Ésta es la tercera vez que ella recibe un crédito de MFP, por ello se compromete a pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales, como lo hizo anteriormente. Con el dinero podrá adquirir 2 vacas, a las que engordará para su posterior venta.
texts.en:
Lourdes, who is 27 years old, is married to Elvis with whom she has two children aged nine and four years old. They live in their own house located in a rural annex. Lourdes is a working mother. 

From the age of 19, she has been working to support the maintenance of her family. Since then, she is engaged in farming and ranching. She mainly grows potatoes, oatmeal, beans and maca. But sometimes growing brought her problems, even leading to the lost of two crops due to frosts. For this reason, she decided to start raising animals. Currently, she has guinea pigs, sheep, cows and bulls, which she fattens for a while and then sells in her city.

"I take the cattle to Chupaca (city located 250 km away), because the prices are better", she says. She makes this trip every 20 days, confirming the profitability of her business. This month she plans to buy two cows, which she will fatten and then sell. She is requesting your support to do it.

Meanwhile, she is devoted to farming and to take care of her small animals. This is the third time she receives a loan from MFP. She agrees to pay her monthly installments on time, like before. With the money, she will be able to buy two cows, which she will fatten for resale.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 58 years old and lives in Getap village with his wife and 26-year-old son. The family is involved in agriculture and they keep cows, chickens and oxen. Samvel also has an orchard where he grows apples, pears, peaches, apricots and nut trees with great love and care.
 
Samvel applied for this loan as he wants to increase his livestock by purchasing a calf, cow and feed. He hopes that by improving his herd with special milk cows he will be able to increase sales of milk and meat and earn more income.

loans.use: to pay for a calf, a cow and their feed.

location.town: Getap village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de venta de comida,la socia vende ceviche que es un plato a base de pescado con limon que lleva camote,la socia vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La solicita el credito para comprar pescado,limon y camote.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Delfina continues to make her living selling food, namely selling ceviche which is a marinated seafood dish made with fish, lemon and sweet potatoes. She sells in the street from 8 am to 6 pm, which she has been doing this business for 5 years and it is going very well for her. Delfina's dream is to have a restaurant. She is seeking this loan to buy fish, lemon and sweet potatoes. Delfina is pleased about the loan and promises to meet the loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy fish, lemon and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar de 26 años es un joven independiente y muy trabajador, aún sin una familia propia ha logrado forjarse un futuro de trabajo y muchos objetivos por cumplir, producto de ello es propietario de su casa hecha a base de madera.
