Dzame was introduced to Milango by her friends and is applying for a loan of 10,700 KES to purchase more coconut leaves and threads. Her main challenges are high inflation, which has reduced the purchasing power of most customers, and lack of reliable customers. Dzame will save the additional income from this loan and use it to provide for her family.

loans.use: To purchase more coconut leaves and threads.

loans.name: Malonza

texts.en:
Malonza is a resident of Kongowea, Kenya. He sells fruit, a business he began using the savings he had made and has been running it for the last three years. Malonza is a married father of one child. He is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase fruit and groceries to sell. 

The main challenge he faces is bad debts and lack of capital for expansion, a problem he sees partly sorted by this loan. He intends to sell fruit wholesale in future. Malonza will use the extra income from the business to improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To purchase fruit and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Con 35 años de edad doña Maxima comparte una relación conyugal con Filemón , complementan así mismo la alegría del hogar sus tres hijas Leonela , Ruth e Inés quienes niñas aun brindan esa motivación que todo padre necesita para salir adelante, habitan actualmente en una vivienda hecha a base de material noble en calidad de alquiler. Tiene como iniciativa comercial el de no dejar el tiempo pasar, es por ello que desde hace 2 meses logró con tanto esfuerzo iniciarse comercialmente con su tienda de abarrotes  con ayuda de Filemón y el de sus hijas. El motivo principal fue que en el campo ocasionalmente no se requiere la mano de obra permanente, pues paralelo a su negocio desempeña actividades agrícolas mientras sus hijas se encargan de la administración de su negocio en la ciudad.
Es una buena manera de manejar la economía familiar ya que los vecinos y amigos de la zona concurren constantemente  generándole buenos ingresos hasta el momento.
Al tener una buena acogida inicial tiene planeado realizar la compra de más mercadería invirtiendo así de tal manera que a futuro pueda consolidarlo al punto de ser un buen sostén para el sustento familiar.
Dentro de sus objetivos a largo plazo esta el de adquirir un vehiculo de carga para en transporte de mercadería del campo a la ciudad con el cual disminuiría el precio de producción final que invierte, logrando así obtener una mejor ganancia por sus productos. Este viene a ser su cuarto crédito con MFP, muy contenta con lo logrado hasta el momento gracias al préstamo espera seguir creciendo para beneficio de su comunidad. Le agrada mucho ser parte de su banco comunal ya que en su conjunto son personas que ella conoce desde hace mucho, inspirándole una buena confianza. Loa 3,500 nuevos soles los invertirá íntegramente en la compra de mercadería para su negocio , dentro de los cuales están los productos de primera necesidad y bebidas gaseosas al por mayor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maxima, 35, is married to Filemón. Their three small daughters Leonela, Ruth and Inés bring additional joy to their home and represent the motivation that every parent needs in order to get ahead in life.

They currently live in a solid material house, which is rented. Her commercial strategy is to take advantage of rising opportunities and this is why two months ago she opened a grocery store with her effort and with Filemón’s and their daughters' help.

She also works in the agricultural sector, but since there is no constant demand for labor, she thought of making the most out of this situation. Her daughters take care of the store when she is working. This is a good way of taking care of the family’s economy, since neighbors and friends visit the store regularly, which has resulted so far in good income. Given the good acceptance, she plans to buy more merchandise. By investing, she will be able to strengthen the store’s position in the future and turn it into a good source of income for her family.

She plans, in the long term, to buy a vehicle in which she can transport the merchandise from the country side into the city and in that way reduce the final cost. This will result in better profits. This will be her fourth credit with MFP. She feels satisfied with what she has achieved so far, and with the loan, she expects to keep growing, for the community’s sake. She enjoys being part of the communal bank, because her group is composed of old acquaintances, which makes her feel confident.

She will use the 3500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy merchandise for her store, like essential supplies and beverages in bulk.

loans.use: to buy essential supplies and beverages.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa, 48, is a widow with two children and lives at West Point. Hawa has been managing her business for the past fifteen years in order to sustain herself. Her children are between the ages of 20 and 28 and are independent. Only one of them is currently in school.

Hawa has a table in the market where she sells lappers (a traditional country cloth). Because of the quality lappers that she sells, she makes a profit every day. With the profit she buys more goods and improves her life.

She is requesting her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more lappers for the business. Her plan is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (traditional country cloth) for the business

loans.name: Maa Bimala Group

texts.en:
Maa Bimala, a Joint Liability Group, is located in Chhatapipal, a rural village of Bolangir district of Odisha, India. This group consists of five women members who belong to the BPL (below poverty line) category. People from the BPL category live on less than one dollar a day.  

Padmini, sitting with raised hand, is one of them. She is 24 years of age and lives with her husband and one son, age 2 months, and one daughter, age 5 years, who has just started schooling in the village school.

Padmini is running a photo studio in a very small room in her house with the help of her husband. She has a computer system, a digital still photo camera and a normal video camera for her business. Her husband mainly manages the photo studio. In the absence of her husband, Padmini also takes photographs. Apart from in door service, her husband also attends calls and orders at various social festivals, government programmes and other functions as a photographer. She also gives the video camera on hire basis at a cost of 1,000 INR per day. 

In normal season (from June to September) Padmini earns 5,000 INR per month, and in festive season (from October to May) she earns 8,000 to 10,000 INR per month. 

The locality of Padmini has a great potential for her business but, due to shortage of space, she is not able to expand it as she would like. By using the present loan, Padmini is planning to purchase an advance digital camera for her business. From the extra income, she has a plan to construct a separate photo studio on her plot, which she wants to materialize very soon. 

The other four members of her group are Santoshini, Pankajini, Tikini and Surangi, who are doing milk businesses.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing of a digital camera.

loans.name: Stanley

texts.en:
Stanley is a water vendor in Mombasa, Kenya. He supplies water to his local neighborhoods. The idea for this business came from the fact that there is a challenge of water delivery in the area. The business has been running for three years. Stanley and his wife have one child.
 
A loan of 83450 Kenya shillings will help Stanley buy a water tank and open an outlet in another centre. The challenge has been the high cost of living all over, which has reduced the disposable income of many small business customers.

He believes the income from the business will improve the quality of life of his family and enable the payment of school fees.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 47 years old and married. She is from Poblacion, Plaridel. She has three grown children who have helped her in taking care of their bananas and vegetables. They have been in this work for 5 years and earn 3,000 a month. 

Recently, Lourdes joined GDMPC. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and to expand her cultivated area.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and for weeding costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy green and yellow bananas to offer for sale

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is from Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Merlita is married and has 2 children. 

To make a living, Merlita cultivates coconuts for sale. Merlita has been in this business for 5 years and earns 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Merlita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Recently, Merlita joined GDMPC. She plans to save the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance on his motorbike.

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, 34, lives at West Point with her husband and three children, who are between the ages of 2 and 18. They attend school. 

For the past five years, she has been selling used clothes, like children's socks, children's underwear and pillow cases. Because of the good location of her business, she makes a profit when she sells. With the profit, she buys more goods and helps her husband with the home  

She has requested a loan to purchase more children's socks, underwear and pillow cases for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more children's socks, underwear and pillow cases for the  business.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
For over two years in Poblacion, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental, Maricar, a 51-year-old married mother of three children, has made a living through the operation of a retail business selling a variety of food products in the community. She earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities. 

Recently, Maricar joined GDMPC. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase new items such as candies, chips, biscuits, etc. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, chips, biscuits, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more green bananas to resell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 45-year old resident of Poblacion, Plaridel. She provides for the needs of her three children from her piggery business.

For five years she has supplemented her family's income.

This year she became a member of GDMPC, and applied for a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy feed for her pigs.  Rose wants to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods,snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods,snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Reste

texts.en:
Reste, age 38, operates a fishing business. She has run her business for 11 years. She and her husband have five children, four of whom are enrolled in school. Reste is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Reste has requested a PhP 16000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing nets and other necessary equipment.

In the future, Reste would like to save enough money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other necessary equipment

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is from Bhodaha V.D.C in the Bara district. For the past year, she has invested in, and been operating, a small shop that sells food materials to the local community. She has demonstrated good entrepreneurship and built a good relationship with her community. Her shop is doing well. 

She is requesting a loan of 40,000 NPR to purchase additional inventory for her grocery shop. She wants to provide superior and quality products to her community.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory for her store.

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie, age 51, operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

Connie lives in Payatas, Philippines, with her husband Diosdado, who works as a maintenance staff person, and their children. She and Diosdado manage their household while operating the business. Connie works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Connie hopes to give her children a good, high-quality education and dreams of offering her family a good life through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and household products to offer for sale

loans.name: Maa Laxmi Group

texts.en:
This group is called "Maa Laxmi," a Joint Liability Group that was formed in the year 2009 by five poor rural women of village Kurebhana who belong to the below poverty line category. Kurebhana is a remote village in the district of Bolangir in Odisha, India. The majority of the resident of this village depend upon cultivation. 

Nepura, second from right in the photo with raised hand, is one of the members of this group. She is 33 years old, living with her husband, and two daughters, age 8 and 4, in a small hut. 

The prime work of Nepura is farming, from which she gets a very low income with which it is very difficult to maintain her family. So she started a milk business with the help of her husband in the year 2009 by purchasing a cow through a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Now she has two cows producing eight liters of milk per day. Nepura supplies this milk to a traditional milk-processing unit of her village at 20 INR per liter. She gets the price of milk in every 10 days. 

During off season of farming, her husband does labour work and Nepura looks after the dairy farm.

As there is growing demand for milk in the locality, Nepura has planned to use the present loan to purchase another cow of improved variety.  The future plan of Nepura is to save some money for construction of a house.

The other four members of the group are Shanti, Sukanti, Kuni and Payasini who are also doing similar milk businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 42 and single, with three children who are between the ages of 5 and 19 and are currently in school. 

Theresa has been selling on the open market for the past six years. She sells imported men's slippers and ladies' slippers.

One difficulty she faces is the low sales during the raining season. She make a profit when she sells, and with the profit generated from the business, she buys more goods and pays the educational expenses of her children.  

She has requested her third loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more men's slippers and ladies' slippers for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more men's slippers, and ladies' slippers for the business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen; she previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts, accessories and to maintain her pedicab. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and for their personal, house hold and business expenses. 

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy spare parts and to maintain her pedicab. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her family's daily needs and cover the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Helen hopes to expand her business in the coming years and dreams to give her children a good and quality education. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of her sidecar unit.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 45 years old and married with seven children.  One of her children is in school and works very hard to provide for all of them.

Tessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Tessie has been in this business for eleven years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future Tessie plans to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Clemencia

texts.en:
Clemencia is from Cabgan, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 59 years old. Clemencia is married and has four children. 

To make a living, Clemencia has raised fish in her pond for 18 years, and she earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Clemencia is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy young fish and twine to expand her business.  In 2008, Clemencia joined GDMPC. 

She plans to use the income generated to expand her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to buy young fish and twine.

loans.name: Edgardo

texts.en:
Edgardo is 47 years old and married with three children. He is from Margos, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Edgardo provides transportation services to earn a living. He has been in business for two years and earns 6,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Edgardo joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. 

He plans to use the additional revenue generated with his loan to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida, age 40, operates a furniture shop business. She has been engaged in this work for 10 years. She and her husband have seven children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Armida has requested a PhP 20000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase furniture supplies.

In the future, Armida would like to save enough to support the financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase furniture supplies

loans.name: Maa Santoshi Group

texts.en:
This group is called "Maa Santoshi." It was formed in the year 2009. All the four members of this group are women from the village Kurebhana and belong to the below poverty line category. Kurebhana is a remote village in the district of Bolangir of Odisha, one of the poorest districts in India. A majority of the inhabitants of this village depend upon cultivation. In this village, almost all families are in the milk business. 

Dukha is one of the members of Maa Santoshi group who has raised her hand second from right in the photo. She is 43 years old and is a straightforward lady, living with her husband, three sons age 24, 22 and 18 and one daughter, age 20. All her children have dropped out of school after secondary education and are helping their parents in farming. 

The primary work of Dukha is farming from which she gets a low return with which it is very difficult to maintain her family. So she started a milk business for extra income with the help of her husband in the year 2009 by purchasing a cow from a loan availed from Mahashakti Foundation. Now she has three cows producing 10 liters of milk per day. 

Dukha supplies this milk to a milk-processing unit of her village at 20 INR per liter. She gets the price of milk in every 10 days. As there is growing demand for milk in the locality, Dukha has planned to use the present loan for purchasing another cow of improved variety. Dukha has a dream to save some money for the marriages of her children and construct a house.

The other three members, Bilasini, Nalini and Anandini, are doing milk, vegetable and grocery store businesses. Since inception Dukha has been managing the group with utmost sincerity with good name and fame in her locality.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Rose Marie

texts.en:
Rose Marie is 27 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Rose Marie has a fishing business in the Philippines, and requests a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.  She has been in business for eight years. 

In the future, Rose Marie would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felecitas, a 63-year-old woman from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur., is a widow with two children. 

To earn a living, Felecitas runs a general store. She has been in her business for 12 years and earns 4,600 PHP per month. 

Felecitas requests a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase new items so that she can expand her product offerings. In 2008, Felecitas joined GDMPC. 

She plans to save additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase new items.

loans.name: Sarsatiya

texts.en:
Sarsatiya is from Bhodaha V.D.C of Bara District.  She has three daughters and two sons. 

Sarsatiya and her husband have learned a great deal about the buffalo business. They have been buying and selling various kinds of buffaloes in the neighboring villages for ten years. 

They used their first loan from NUBL, of Rs.30,000, to invest in a buffalo.  After rearing and growing it they were able to sell it for Rs.39,000. Their buffalo business has helped them buy a small piece of land and to grow vegetables and feed their family. 

Sarsatiya requested a loan of Rs 40,000 to expand their buffalo business.

loans.use: to help buy buffaloes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more perfumes from Avon to offer for sale

loans.name: Selca

texts.en:
Selca operates a hardware business. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. She lives in Binalbagan with her husband and children, and she works hard to support her family. 

Selca has requested a PhP 18000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional supplies for her hardware business.
 
In the future, Selca would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional supplies for her hardware store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more yellow bananas to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Bernalyn

texts.en:
Bernalyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a trisikad transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Bernalyn requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy an additional trisikad.

In the future, Bernalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy an additional trisikad.

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 60 years old and married with five children. 

Anecita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell to customers. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from a carinderia (local eatery) business. Anecita has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. Anecita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of rice to resell

loans.name: Neneta

texts.en:
Neneta is a fish vendor. She is a return borrower through NWTF and is a hard-working entrepreneur.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 15000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to offer for sale in her food stall.

NWTF is relisting Neneta's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to offer for sale in her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Mwange Group

texts.fr:
Innocent fait partie du groupe  Mwange  et habite à Bujumbura. C' est un célibataire de 27 ans.

Il fait le commerce de l’huile de palme  depuis 3 ans. 

Il  est à son deuxième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter  quinze bidons supplémentaires de l’huile de palme;toute la quantité sera revendue, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il  voudrait acheter une parcelle et construire  sa propre  maison.
texts.en:
Innocent lives in Bujumbura and is a member of the Mwange group. He is 27 years old and single.

He has been selling palm oil for three years now.

He is on his second loan from Turame. With the KIVA loan that he obtains, he will increase his capital and buy 15 extra cans of palm oil, all of which he will resell in order to earn more money.

In the coming years, he would like to buy a parcel of land and build his own house.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy 15 extra cans of palm oil, all of which he will resell in order to earn more money.

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.en:
Gabriela is 41 years old and married with five children.

Gabriela works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries. She has been running the variety store for 6 years and also earns an income from food vending. Gabriela has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. Gabriela aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items like shampoo, snack foods and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making biko, including sticky rice, sugar, and cheese

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica, age 52 and widowed, runs a general store business. She has seven children and works very hard to provide for them. She has operated her business for six years. She sells a variety of items such as soap, soft drinks, and grocery items. 

Veronica has requested a PhP 19000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her store.

In the future, Veronica would like to save enough money to allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia de 40 años, convive con Rubén con quien tiene 2 hijos de 22 y 9 años. Ellos viven en una casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de la selva central. Silvia es una mujer que se esfuerza mucho por sus ideales. Cuando tenía 18 años inició sus labores en la agricultura. Al lado de su esposo han sabido labrar y cultivar la tierra, para producir. Los frutos que cuida son de café, kión, cítricos y frejol. “Me gusta producir de todo, así tengo ingresos para todo el año”, menciona.
Su centro de ventas se ubica a 20 minutos de su comunidad, por ello no tiene problemas en el traslado, más si es la inversión. Dice que los fertilizantes son lo más caro en su actividad, además del pago de la mano de obra, para los cultivos y cosechas. A pesar de todo ello, Silvia continúa firme en su actividad. Ahora piensa plantar más café, para ello ya tiene un vivero listo. Ella requiere de bolsas de abono orgánico para esta labor. Solicita de su apoyo. Éste es su préstamo número 6 con MFP. Se compromete en pagar con puntualidad las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi”, donde sus socios son personas solidarias y puntuales. Con el dinero podrá adquirir bolsas de abono orgánicos para sus cultivos de café y kión primordialmente.
texts.en:
40-year-old Silvia lives with her partner Rubén.  The couple have two children who are 22 and 9 years old.  They live in their own home which is located in an indigenous community in the central jungle.  Silvia is a woman who works hard to realize her dreams.  She started farming when she was 18 years old.  She and her husband have learned how to work the land and produce crops.  The crops they grow are coffee, ginger, citrus fruits and beans.  "I like to grow everything so that I have income year round", she says.

Silvia's sales center is located 20 minutes from her community and so she doesn't experience any problems in getting there.  She says that fertilizers are the most expensive part of her business, as well as paying workers to take care of and harvest her crops.  However, in spite of all this Silvia remains committed to her business.  She is currently planning to plant more coffee and already has a nursery ready for this.  She needs sacks of organic fertilizer for this work and is requesting your support.

This is Silvia's sixth loan from MFP and she pledges to make her monthly repayments on time.  She belongs to 'Los Clavelitos de Shankivironi' community bank whose members are all supportive and punctual.  She will use her loan money to buy sacks of organic fertilizer mainly for her coffee and ginger crops.

loans.use: to buy sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 32 es un hombre muy trabajador, eta casado con Karina de 24 años, aún sin hijos. Actualmente alquilan una vivienda hecha a base de madera esperando a futuro contar con una vivienda propia, hecha de material noble. Siempre pujante y laborioso buscaba diversas maneras de ganarse la vida de forma honrada iniciándose como vendedor ambulante de artefactos menores. Pero al hallar una oportunidad de ser propietario de unas parcelas no lo dudo y luego de 8 años se desempeña como productor de achiote y palillo, esto debido a la ubicación geográfica de sus parcelas ya que no posibilita el normal crecimiento de otros productos alternativos por hallarse en una altura considerable de la selva.
Tiene el apoyo integral de su pareja, quien a pesar de muchas adversidades lograron convertirse en una dupla perfecta  para el trabajo en el campo, pero en ocasiones contrata jornaleros para acortar el tiempo de trabajo empleado.
Requiere de un préstamo para adquirir diversos insumos y la contrata de mano de obra, esto con el fin de mantener siempre en constante actividad sus parcelas.
Dentro de sus planes a futuro desea aperturar un negocio dedicado a la venta de productos como cereales y otros al por mayor ya que considera es bueno tener dos ingresos económicos diversos para garantizar una sólida economía familiar. Éste es su primer crédito otorgado por MFP, por lo que lo derivará en la compra de abono para la producción de achiote y palillo así como contratar jornaleros para las labores agrícolas.
texts.en:
Cesar is 32 years old and is a very hardworking man. He has been married to Karina for 24 years; they have no children. At present they rent a home made of wood. In the future, they are hoping to own their own home made of respectable materials.

Always strong and industrious, he sought various ways to earn a living honestly. He started as a street vendor of small items, but found an opportunity to own a few plots of land. After 8 years, he serves as a producer of achiote and palillo. This is due to the geographical location of their plots since normal growth of other products was not a possibility at the considerable height of the jungle.

He has full support of his partner, who despite many adversities, managed to become a perfect pair for work in the field. He sometimes hires day laborers to shorten the work time.

He requires a loan to acquire various supplies and to hire day laborers in order to maintain constant activity in their plots. Their plans for the future include wanting to open a business devoted to the sale of wholesale products like cereal and others because he believes it is good to have two different economic incomes to ensure a solid family economy. This is his first loan granted by MFP; it will be used to purchase fertilizer for the production of annatto and palillo as well as hiring day laborers for farm work.

loans.use: to buy bags of fertilizer and to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Moda Y  Lujo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario esta conformado por dos amas de casa muy emprendedoras que vieron la oportunidad de crecer y ayudar a su familia y brindarles de todo lo que necesitan a sus hijos, por medio de la venta de ropa. Es asi que la Sr Blanca como presidenta de esta grupo a sabido ponerle mucho fe y trabajo demostrando valores como muy arraigados como la tranquilidad, honestidad, de un caracter muy amable y de mucha fortaleza sacando a su familia de la pobreza.

El sueño que Blanca tiene es tener un local comercial grande, donde ella misma confeccione y venda la ropa, y asi poder seguir ayudando en la casa y junto a su esposo lograr darle el mejor estudio a sus hijos para que logren ser profesionales.

El prestamo que solicitaron a Fodemi es para poder seguir comprando mas mercaderia (Ropa), ya que en estas fechas de navidad se vende mucho y asi podemos seguir creciendo como microempresarias.
texts.en:
The solidarity group is made up of two very enterprising homemakers who saw the opportunity to grow, help their families and provide their children with everything that they need by means of clothing sales.  Blanca, as president of this group, is known for her great faith and work.  She demonstrates deeply-rooted values such as tranquility, honesty, a very friendly nature and a great deal of strength by getting her family out of poverty.

Blanca’s dream is to have a large business premises where she herself makes and sells clothing and is thus able to continue helping in the house and together with her husband manage to give the best education to her children so that they become professionals.

The loan requested from Fodemi is to be able to continue buying more clothing merchandise since in these days of the Christmas season they sell a lot and thus they can continue growing as small businesswomen.

loans.use: to purchase clothing (blouses, t-shirts, pants, jeans and sports clothing for women, men and children) to sell in the city.

loans.name: Ella

texts.en:
This is Ella, 41, resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arnel, a businessman, and the mother of seven children. She and her children manage their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses and her children’s studies. 

Ella operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy different toy products from wholesalers. She repacks them and sells them for a little profit. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and people from the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of toy products to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Ella hopes to grow her business soon. She dreams of giving her children a good and quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. This is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed for her toy store

loans.name: Africana

texts.en:
As the married mother of four children, Africana works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Africana is borrowing 23,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Africana has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 45 years old and married with two children.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari, or general store, in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

Jenelyn has borrowed and paid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from raising livestock.

Jenelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucia is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle.

loans.name: Maria Luna

texts.en:
Maria Luna is 39 years old and married with two children.  She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Maria Luna requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Maria Luna has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maria Luna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Sim, age 47, is a weaver. She has been married to her husband Sarin, age 48, since 1996. They have one young daughter. The family lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh.

Sim's husband supports the family by farming crops and raising cows at home. The irrigation pipe used on his farmland is broken and requires replacement, so Sim is applying for a loan in the amount of $200 in order to buy a new one. 

With the new pipe, Sarin will be able to spray his farm.

loans.use: to buy a new irrigation pipe for the family farm

loans.name: Araceli

texts.en: Araceli is a 52-year-old resident of Nailon, Tudela. She has helped her family for the last seven years by earning PHP 4,000 a month from a gardening business. This year she became a member of GDMPC, and is requesting a loan for PHP 5,500 to buy additional seeds, seedlings and young plants to raise. Her goal is to one day expand her business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.ru: Санавбар очень выносливая, трудолюбивая женщина, она разведенная. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Условия жизни у нее были очень тяжелые. После того как развилась, она стала заниматься животноводством и работала в пожарном участке, диспетчером. Чтобы прокормить семью Санавбар уехала в  Россию на заработки. Приехав на Родину, он начала заниматься скотоводством. Уже более 10-и лет она занимается этим бизнесом. Санавбар хочет купить уголь, муку масло для зимовки. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони. Она очень надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку.
texts.en: Sanavbar is a very resilient and hard-working woman. She is divorced and has young children. Her living conditions were very hard. After the divorce, she began to raise cattle and also to work as a dispatcher for the fire department. She had to leave for Russia to earn enough money to feed her family. Once she returned home, she began to raise cattle, and has been doing this for over ten years. Sanavbar is now seeking a loan of 3,500 Tajikistan Somoni to buy coal, flour, and oil for winter use. She is really hoping for your assistance and support.

loans.use: To buy coal, flour, oil for winter use

loans.name: Catherine Sandy

texts.es:
Catherine es una mujer de 22 años, vive en la ciudad de Pisco con sus padres y una tía, a quienes ama y agradece todo su apoyo brindado, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente Catherine no ha podido estudiar un carrera profesional, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo para poder ser una gran empresaria.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, día a día Catherine trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella trabajad desde tempranas horas de la mañana, Catherine cuenta con un pequeño espacio en su hogar donde realiza sus ventas, ella puede trabajar un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por la variedad de productos y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Catherine se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería para su negocio, tales como maquillaje, cremas, cosméticos, talcos, entre otros productos de belleza; de esta manera Catherine tendrá su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para poco a poco poder ampliar su negocio y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Catherine is a 22-year-old woman who lives in the city of Pisco together with her parents and an aunt.  She loves her family and is grateful for all the support they have given her.  Catherine is a very kind, keen, hard-working person who has a great desire to do well in life.  Unfortunately, Catherine was not able to study for a degree but she would have very much liked to have done so, so that she could become a successful businessperson.

On her own initiative and with a lot of hard work and dedication, Catherine works in her small business every day selling beauty products.  She works from early in the morning.  Catherine has a small space in her home where she makes her sales.  She can work approximately eight hours a day and believes that her business is doing well because she has a good range of products and treats her customers in a friendly manner.

Catherine is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, she will be able to buy merchandise for her business such as makeup, creams, cosmetics, talcum powder and other beauty products.  This will enable her to have a better-stocked business and she hopes thereby to increase her sales and her income.  This will be very helpful to her in gradually expanding her business and making progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en: Marjorie works hard to support her family. Marjorie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,500 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store. She has been in her business for 2 years. In the future, Marjorie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is married and the mother of five children. She is 57 years old and lives in Nailon, Tudela, Misamis Occidental, where she earns a living by running and managing a general store. She has been in this business for six years and earns about PHP 7,000 a month from her work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,500 to buy new items to sell to her customers, including candies, beverage mix, shampoo and soaps. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2007 and hopes to expand her business in the future so that she can meet the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as candies, beverage mixes, shampoo and soaps.

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.ru: Файзигул проживает в городе Дангара. Ей 21 год. Она не замужем. Файзигул занимается торговлей. На сегодняшний день она открыла парфюмерный магазин. Торговлей она занимается более пяти лет. В торговле ей помогает ее мать. Файзигул берет кредит для приобретения новых парфюмерных наборов, праздничных коробок, пакетов и хозяйственных товаров.
texts.en:
Fayzigul lives in the city of Dangara. She is 21 years old and single. Fayzigul has been a retailer for over five years and presently operates a perfume shop. Her mother helps her with the business. 

Fayzigul is taking this loan to purchase new cosmetics kits, gift boxes and bags, as well as household goods.

loans.use: to purchase new cosmetics kits, gift boxes and bags, as well as household goods.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Человек с огромным сердцем доброты и прекрасной душой, который живет среди высоких Таджикских гор, нуждается вашей поддержки, так как последние время у нее проблемы с финансами. Ее зовут Махбуба. Ей  49 лет, замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Более 10  лет она занимается скотоводством. На рынке у нее много клиентов. Ее 2 старших сыновья уехали в Россию для заработки и Махбуба одна справляется с хозяйством и содержанием семьи. Она хочет развивать свой бизнес, но не имеет достаточного средства для этого. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  2500  сомони для покупки скота, чтобы развевать бизнес. С полученного  дохода она собирается обеспечить своих детей хорошим образованием и современными технологиями. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Mahbuba lives amid the high mountains of Tajikistan. She has a big heart and a wonderful soul and she needs your assistance, because, recently, she has experienced financial troubles. She's forty-nine years old, married and has four children. For the last ten years, she's made a living by breeding cattle and has many customers on the market. Her two oldest sons have left to find work in Russia and Mahbuba takes care of her family and business all by herself.
She would like to expand her business, but doesn't have enough capital. Therefore, she's asking for a loan of 2500 somoni to purchase some cattle. She hopes to use the profits from this loan to provide her children with a good education and some new high-tech devices. She hopes for your help.

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy de 34 años se caracteriza por ser una persona muy alegre y trabajadora, lleva una vida independiente, es madre soltera de dos hijas que son su razón de ser. Asimismo tiene el orgullo de haber logrado desde muy joven la construcción de su vivienda a base de material noble. Se inició el las actividades agropecuarias, específicamente en la producción cacao y café, actividads que tambien ejercia los padres,  posteriormente heredó las parcelas en donde siempre apoyaba a sus progenitores, pues gracias a ello inicio a forjar una vida independiente en beneficio de sus hijas desde hace 20 años.
Le agrada desempeñarse en el trabajo de campo ya que de hacer una buena labor  en la temporada correspondiente y el producto adecuado termina por dejar una buena ganancia como es el caso del cacao orgánico. No obstante el tema del transporte consistente en los sacos de cacao seco listos para su distribución es un tema que aun no termina de resolver de manera adecuada, es por ello que a futuro espera seguir trabajando y  lograr adquirir una unidad de carga para el transporte de la pesada mercadería.
Con motivo del inicio de la temporada de mantenimiento cacaotero desea realizar la compra de plantas de almácigo para injerto y sembrado así como la de sacos de abono orgánico consistente en guano de isla y compost, muy esencial para aportar la garantía de tener un buen producto al finalizar la temporada de mantenimiento. Por otro lado debe es necesario contar con dinero adicional para la contrata de jornaleros quienes desempeñaran las tareas necesarias por un pago de jornal adelantado. Tiene la satisfacción de lograr contar nuevamente con la oportunidad que MFP le otorga, siendo este su octavo préstamo. Es una socia muy activa y participativa en los distintos temas que en ocasiones debaten en beneficio de su banco comunal.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles realizará la compra de abono orgánico consistente en guano de isla y compost reservando parte de su capital para la contrata de jornaleros.
texts.en:
Nancy is 34 years old and is characterized by being a very cheerful and hardworking person. She lives an independent life and is a single mother of two daughters who are her reason for living. She is also proud of having achieved the construction of her own home of good materials from a young age. Her first agricultural activities, specifically the production of cocoa and coffee, were done with her parents. Later, she inherited plots that had always supported her ancestors. Thanks to this, for the last 20 years, she has been able to forge an independent life for the sake of her daughters.

She likes to work in the field since doing good work during the season results in the corresponding product leaving a good profit, as in the case of organic cocoa. However the issue of transportation of the sacks of dry cocoa ready for distribution has not been resolved properly. For this reason, she hopes to continue working and manage to acquire a unit for the transport of heavy goods in the future.

At the start of the cocoa maintenance season, she wants to purchase seedling plants to graft as well as sacks of organic fertilizer consisting of island guano and compost, which is very essential to guarantee a good product and the end of the season. On the other hand, it is necessary to have additional money to hire laborers that require advanced payment.

She again has the satisfaction of achieving opportunity that MFP gives her, this being her eighth loan. She is very active and participatory in the various topics sometimes discussed for the benefit of her previous group loan.

With the new 2,000 soles she will purchase organic fertilizer consisting of island guano and compost, reserving part of her capital to hire day laborers.

loans.use: to buy bags of organic fertilizer and compost, and also to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
Silvia es una persona felíz, muy dedicada a su trabajo, responable para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Silvia vive en Otavalo con su esposo y sus hijos.

Silvia se dedica a confeccionar prendas de vestir en tela térmica, este negocio lo heredó de su madre, al momento le está yendo muy bien ya que está distribuyendo a algunas tiendas de ropa, Silvia no quiere que su negocio se detenga, busca un mejor futuro es por eso que desea invertir en  la compra de tela térmica y una máquina para contratar a una persona que le ayude, inversión que le permitirá incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.

Silvia sueña en tener un taller más grande que le permita contratar a más personal y convertirse en una empresa grande y distribuir al por mayor en todo el país.
texts.en:
Silvia is a happy person who is very dedicated to her work. She is responsible for improving her family's quality of life. Silvia lives in Otavalo with her husband and children. 

Silvia works making clothing out of fleece. She inherited this business from her mother. At this time it is going well for her since she is distributing to some clothing stores. Silvia does not want her business to stop. She is seeking a better future and that is why she wants to invest in buying fleece fabric and a seing machine to hire a person to assist her. This investment will allow her to increase her sales and income. 

Silvia dreams of having a bigger workshop that will allow her to hire more personnel and become a big business and distribute wholesale throughout the country.

loans.use: to buy fleece fabric and a sewing machine to hire someone to assist her.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is married, 37 years old and lives in Segatic Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the last 11 years, she has earned a living by running a general store where she sells a variety of products such as shampoo, napkins and many other items. Each month, she earns about PHP 8,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy new items to sell. She has been a member of GDMPC since 2009 and her future goals are to build a house and pay for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Harley May

texts.en:
Harley May's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice and bananas for sale. She is 28 years old, single. She is from Tudela, Misamis Occidental and been 5 years in farming, earning an amount of 10,000 PHP a month. In this year, Harley May joined GDMPC.

 Harley May is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Laurencia

texts.en:
Laurencia is 57 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Laurencia has a fishing business in the Philippines. Laurencia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

Laurencia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Laurencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Cerelyn

texts.en:
Cerelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making and selling native bags in the Philippines.

Cerelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her native bags. She has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Cerelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native bags.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making and selling bags  in the Philippines.

Josie requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business. She has been in this business for 26 years.

In the future, Josie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Lalina

texts.en:
Lalina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making and selling native mats in the Philippines.

Lalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her native mats. She has been in this business for ten years.

In the future, Lalina would like to save enough to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her native mats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the stock of white wine.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es:
Wilfredo es un agricultor muy esforzado que lleva mas de un año vendiendo chile picante en las ferias locales. dentro de sus metas esta el mejorar año con año la calidad de su producto, asi como aumentar la produccion año con año. es por eso que el necesita de un prestamo de un millon cuarenta mil colones (1.040.000) para poder comprar equipo e insumos agricolas que le permitan cumplir con este objetivo. 
para el esta es una oportunidad de mejorar los ingresos y la calidad de vida, asi como una superacion personal y familiar.
texts.en: Wilfredo is a very hardworking farmer who has been selling hot chiles for more than a year in the local markets. Among his goals is to improve the quality of his product year to year, as well as increase his production. That is why he needs a loan of one million forty-thousand colones (1.040.000) to be able to buy agricultural materials that will allow him to reach this goal.  For him, this is an opportunity to improve his income and quality of life and help him get ahead personally and with his family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and materials to plant.

loans.name: Hortencia

texts.es:
Doña Hortencia es una señora de 43 años de edad y ella esta casada y vive en Sololá. Ella tiene cinco hijos de ellos tres mujeres y dos varones. Dos de ellos estudian en una escuela de su comunidad.
Ella actualmente tiene una tienda de abarrotes en el lugar de su vivienda, la cual es una fuente ingresos económicos para su familia. Cuenta que inicio esta actividad hace ocho años, viendo la necesidad de  su familia y la de sus  vecinos de  tener una tienda de abarrotes en la comunidad para facilitar el acceso a productos de primera necesidad para toda la gente de su comunidad.
Ella  ha visto que las ventas se han mantenido ahora por la temporada del año la demanda en algunos productos aumentan es por eso ella quiere invertir mas capital en efectivo siendo así ella solicita un préstamo de Q 6,000.00 para comprar mas productos y ampliar su tienda de abarrotes de este modo ella puede brindarles un  mejor servicio a sus clientes y obtener mejores ganancias para mantener a su familia.
Entre sus sueños ella quiere tener otro negocio que le genere mejores ganancias así ella lograra  ver a  sus dos hijos que estudian graduarse de una carrera académica profesional que seria su mayor satisfacción.
texts.en:
Hortencia is 43 years old, married, and lives in Sololá.  She has five children: three daughters and two sons.  Two of her children are attending a school in their community.

Hortencia currently has a grocery store in her home which is a source of income for her family.  She says that she started this business eight years ago when she saw the need that her own family and her neighbors had for a grocery store which would give all the members of their community easier access to basic household supplies.

Hortencia has noted that her sales remain steady but, during this season of the year, demand for some of her products increases.  This is why she would like to invest more cash in the business.  She is requesting a loan for 6,000 quetzales to buy more products and expand her grocery store.  This will enable her to provide her customers with a better service and make better profits with which to support her family.  One of her dreams is to have another business that will make her better profits so that she can see her two children who are still in school study for a degree.  This will be her greatest satisfaction.

loans.use: to buy groceries to expand her grocery store

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisais is 58 years old, married and the mother of six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who runs a motorcycle transportation service in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 20,000 to buy spare parts for her business. She has been in this line of work for six years and would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her transportation business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila is 50 years old and married with two children. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Precila requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Precila has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Precila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло молодая девушка, мать одного ребенка.  К сожалению по стечению обстоятельств она  развелась  с мужем.  Она живет с матерью и работает  официанткой в доме отдыха.   В нашу организацию обратилась за кредитом, когда имела небольшую торговую точку около районной больницы, она продавала продукты посетителям и больным.  Шахло сейчас перешла на новую работу тоже связанное с торговлей и доход очень хороший.   Сейчас она   запрашивает кредит  на ремонт своей квартиры так как квартира нуждается в ремонте.   Шахло планирует купить строительные материалы.    Кредиты Арванд  ей очень помогли и она очень благодарит за финансовую поддержку .
texts.en:
Shahlo is a young mother with one child. Due to unfortunate circumstances, she divorced her husband. Currently, Shahlo lives with her mother and works as a waitress at a resort. 

Shahlo first turned to MDO Arvand, LLC for a loan when she operated a small retail stall near a regional hospital, selling food to the hospital's visitors and patients. Since then, Shahlo has found another job, also related to retail, and now earns a very good income. She is requesting this loan to repair her apartment, which is in need of a renovation. Shahlo plans to use the loan to purchase building materials. 

Previous loans from MDO Arvand have been very helpful to Shahlo and she expresses her gratitude for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making "chicharon"

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Felix Pedro

texts.es: Félix de oficio agricultor se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas y tabaco, es cliente Kiva, su anterior préstamo le fu e de gran ayuda  porque pudo invertirlo en su siembra obteniendo mejor rendimiento y calidad en productos, incrementaron las ventas  generando a la vez mas ganancias. Él solicita el préstamo para pago de mano de obra y comprar  insumos para sembrar 1 manzana de tabaco. Esto le ayudara a darle un a mejorar asistencia a sus siembras y poder obtener una buena producción. Su deseo es ampliar su parcela y diversificarse en siembras de hortalizas.
texts.en:
Félix, a farmer by trade, works in growing vegetables and tobacco.  He is a client of Kiva, and his previous loan was of great help to him because he was able to invest it in his sowing, obtaining better yields and quality in the products.  The sales increased, generating more income.  

He requests the loan to pay the workforce and buy inputs to plant 1 block of tobacco.  This will help him take better care of his plants and be able to obtain a good output.  He would like to increase the size of his plot of land and diversify the vegetables that he plants.

loans.use:
para pago de mano de obra y comprar  insumos para sembrar 1 manzana de tabaco.
to pay the workforce and buy inputs to plant one block of tobacco.

loans.name: Sherali

texts.ru: Шерали родился в 1992 году в сельской местности.   Проживает с родителями, не женат.  Мать Шерали домохозяйка, отец подрабатывает таксистом.   Шерали помогает своим родителям , он также как и отец развозит людей по городу.  Занимается услугами такси.   В сзязи с тяжелым положением в семье в финансовой сфере он не пошел учиться,  так как денег на учебу нет.   Шерали берет кредит для ремонта своего такси купить покрышки  и подготовить машину в зимний период. Он и его семья благодарит ООО МДО "Арванд" за поддержку в трудную минуту.
texts.en:
Sherali was born in 1992 in the countryside. Currently, he is single and lives with his parents. Sherali's father works part-time as a taxi driver, while his mother takes care of the household. Sherali helps his parents - just like his father, he transports passengers around town in his taxi. He did not pursue post-secondary studies as he is unable to pay for college education due to the family's difficult financial situation.

Sherali is taking this loan to repair his taxi and also to purchase winter tires and get his car ready for the winter season. He and his family thank MDO Arvand, LLC for their support in a difficult time.

loans.use: to repair his taxi and buy winter tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahati est cliente du groupe Salama, entrepreneur très ambitieuse, âgée d'environ 45 ans, veuve et mère de 13 enfants. Cette cliente est vendeuse d'Oignons et Aies. Elle installe ses produits dans un entrepôt  agricole de Birere. Elle commença son affaire avec le  crédit de l'IMF Hekima, actuellement, elle vient de réaliser 10 cycles dans ce programme de microcrédit. Ce nouveau prêt va lui permettre de payer 6 sacs d'Oignons et Aies; le reste d'argent servira au payement de loyer de cet entrepôt. Son défi actuel c'est l'insécurité dans les villages et zones d'approvisionnement. Ainsi, elle salut l'initiative de Hekima pour son soutien aux démunis.
texts.en:
Bahati is a member of the Salama group and a very ambitious entrepreneur. She is about 45 years old, a widow, and a mother of 13 children. 

Bahati sells onions and garlic. She sells her goods in the Birere agricultural warehouse. She actually started her business with a loan from Hekima, and now she has just reached her 10th loan in this micro-lending program.

This new loan is going to allow her to buy six sacs of onions and garlic. The rest of the money will serve to pay for her place in the warehouse.

Her real challenge is the insecurity in the towns and supply areas. 

Bahati salutes Hekima's initiative to support the poor.

loans.use: to buy six sacs of onions and garlic, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Madina

texts.ru: Мадина студентка 2 курса. Она учится в Худжандкском  Государственном Университете в факультете Психология и Педагогика. Она учится отлично и активно участвует в общественной жизни университета. Мадина является одной из лучших студентов, а также получает стипендию. В будущем она хочет стать педагогом. Недавно в семье они проводили мероприятие и затратили много денег и поэтому ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за годовой договор. Ее мать является клиентом нашей организации и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора в 2012-2013 учебного года.  Вы являетесь единственными людьми, кто может подержать ее. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Madina is a second year student at the Khujand State University studying in the department of Psychology and Education. She has exemplary grades and is very active in student life. She's one of the best students and receives a stipend. She wants to be a teacher.
Recently, her family ran into some financial expenses and they're unable to pay for her yearly tuition. Her mother is a client of our organization and has a good credit history.
Madina is asking for a loan in order to pay for her 2012-2013 tuition. You're the only ones who can provide some assistance and she hopes for your help.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition

loans.name: Carlos Jose

texts.es:
Carlos,32 años de edad, casado, padre de 2 hijos entre las edades de 4 y 10 años de edad respectivamente, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de tomate, chiltoma y maíz, el tiene 20 años de experiencia, con pocos conocimientos académico. El empezó a trabajar  con su padre a la edad de 12 años en la siembra de hortalizas quien le enseño a sembrar tomate, chiltoma, y maíz, y  con ayuda de su mama la cual  tiene un pedazo de tierra en donde cultivan su siembra la cual ha sido una buena tierra para cultivar sus hortalizas ya que pasan sembrando todo el año, de esta manera obtienen  una mejor producción en su cosecha. Le gustaría comercializar sus productos en los  Municipios aledaños a la ciudad de Boaco  y Juigalpa, en  donde el negocio genera mayores ingresos en las ventas.  
Sus expectativas es seguir trabajando para hacer crecer su negocio, ya que es algo que le gusta hacer y ha podido salir adelante con el gasto de su familia. El solicita el crédito para pagar mano de obra, comprar abono, fertilizante  etc.  Esto le ayudara darle mantenimiento a sus tierras  para la cosecha. Su plan futuro es reparar su casa y poder aumentar su  producción, su meta próxima es ahorrar y poder tener mayor producción en su siembra  mas,  asi poder pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Carlos, 32 years of age, is married and the father of two children between 4 and 10 years old. He is a farmer and plants tomatoes, sweet peppers and corn. He has had 20 years of experience but has had little academic training. He began working with his father cultivating vegetables when he was 12 years old. His father taught him to grow tomatoes, sweet peppers and corn and with the help of his mother who owns a piece of land where they do their planting and which is good land for growing vegetables, they are able to farm all year. In this way they have a better yield when they harvest. He would like to sell his crops in neighboring towns and in the cities of Boaco and Juigalpa where his business generates more income on sales.

Carlos expects to continue working to make his business grow because it is something that he enjoys doing and he has been able to get ahead in meeting household expenses. He is requesting a loan to pay for day laborers, purchase compost, fertilizer, etc. This will help him maintain his fields for the harvest. His future plan is to repair his house and to expand production. His next goal is to save money and to have his fields produce more  so that he can pay for the loan.

loans.use: to pay for a workforce and purchase compost, fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan originario de la Comarca  los Restrojos, Santa lucia, Boaco, 36 años de edad, padre de 5 hijos entre las edades de 12, 14, 16,18 y 19 años de edad, de oficio agricultor. El se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijoles, tiene  5 años de experiencia, sin ningún conocimiento académico. Empezó a trabajar en las tierras de su  papa a la edad de 12 años, fue allí que  adquirió experiencia, ya que el tenia que independizarse de sus padres y tenia que buscar el sustento de la alimentación para su familia. Actualmente cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, de esta manera el comercializa su producto en la misma comarca donde habita. Sus expectativas es ampliar su producción para tener mejores condiciones de vida para  su familia.
Juan solicita el crédito para una para utilizar para comprar una vaca y la otra parte  restante para comprar  insumos  como abono, fertilizante. Esto le ayudara al  mantenimiento de su cosecha y mejorar la producción de su siembra, y ofrecer un producto de calidad  a sus clientes a un buen precio.
texts.en:
Juan comes from the rural district of Los Restrojos, Santa Lucia, Boaco. He's 36 years old and has five children aged 12, 14, 16, 18 and 19 years. He's a farmer by trade and grows corn and beans. He has gotten five years' worth of experience without any academic knowledge. He first started working on his father's land at age 12. That's how he acquired experience, since he needed to become independent from his parents and look for a way to provide food for his family. He currently gets help from his children and he sells his produce in the same district where he lives. His expectation is to increase production so that he can improve his family's living conditions.
Juan requests the loan in order to purchase a cow and the rest of it is for purchasing supplies such as compost and fertilizer. That will help him to maintain his crop and increase its production, so he can offer his customers high quality produce at good prices.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and supplies such as compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Hrachik

texts.ru:
Грачик (Hrachik) занимается предпринимательской деятельностью более 22 лет. Он начинал свой бизнес с мясной лавки, а сейчас у него собственная шашлычная, которую он открыл во дворе своего собственного дома. Грачик построил небольшую постройку в своем дворе: на втором этаже располагается открытое помещение шашлычной, а во дворе несколько беседок. Шашлычная Грачика находится рядом с трассой Капан-Каджаран, поэтому основными посетителями шашлычной Грачика являются дальнобойщики, а также жители города Капана.
На первом этаже постройки Грачик хочет обустроить закрытое помещение для обслуживания посетителей в холодное время года, что позволит ему увеличить доход своей семьи. 
Грачик получал кредит от Нор Оризон четырежды, и на этот раз ему необходим кредит в размере $ 1.600 для обустройства закрытого помещения шашлычной: ремонта первого этажа постройки, покупки и установки в нем столов и стульев, а также покупки новой посуды для шашлычной. 
Грачику 57 лет, по специальности он повар. Грачик женат, и у него двое детей: сын и дочь. Жена Грачика домохозяйка и помогает мужу в шашлычной, дочь замужем и живет отдельно от родителей, сын Грачика работает в полиции, он женат, у него двое детей. Сын с семье живет вместе с Грачиком.
texts.en:
Hrachik has been an entrepreneur for over 22 years. He started his business activity by running a butcher shop, but now operates his own kebab cafe in his yard. For this, Hrachik has constructed a few buildings in his yard: the open-air cafe is located on the second floor, with several small gazebos placed around it on the ground. The cafe is located near the Kapan-Kadzharan highway, and so Hrachik's main customers are truck drivers, as well as Kapan's residents. Hrachik would like to use the building's main floor, which is protected from the elements, to serve his customers in wintertime, thereby increasing his family's income.

Hrachik has received four loans from Nor Horizon. This time, he is asking for a loan of $1,600 to open the cafe's main floor for business: perform necessary repairs and purchase new tables, chairs, and tableware.

Hrachik is 57 years old and he is a professional cook. He is married and has two children: a son and a daughter. Hrachik's wife takes care of the household and helps her husband in the kebab cafe. Their daughter is married and lives with her husband. Hrachik's son works in the police, is married, and has two children. He and his family live together with Hrachik.

loans.use: To repair the enclosed space of his kebab cafe, and buy tables, chairs and tableware to open it for business

loans.name: Marlon Jose

texts.es: El señor Marlon, merece le apoyen con financiamiento,  para solucionar  la necesidad inmediata de construir un cuarto y sumidero para tener mejores condiciones y nivel de vida, es casado, labora en un centro de salud de la comunidad, también ejerce su profesión de técnico en telecomunicación, actividades que le han permitido desarrollar su familia  y crearle un ambiente más saludable, agradeciéndole a ceprodel por la oportunidad de realizar su sueño.
texts.en:
Marlon is deserving of being helped with a loan.  The loan will solve the immediate need to build a room and a sewer in order to have better living conditions and a better standard of living.  

He is married, and he works at the community health center.  He also practices his profession as a telecommunication technician.  These business activities have allowed him to progress with his family and to create a healthier atmosphere.

He is grateful to Ceprodel for the opportunity to fulfill his dream.

loans.use: to buy construction materials and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Panfilo

texts.es:
Pánfilo originario de la Comarca  San Jerónimo, Teustepe, Municipio Boaco , casado, padre de 8 hijos entre las edades de 14,17,21,23,25, 28,30 y 32 años de edad respectivamente, de oficio agricultor. El se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol, el cual tiene 35 años de experiencia. El inicio trabajando con su papa desde muy pequeño, ya que solo se cultivaba  para el consumo de la familia, pero hoy en día hay grandes oportunidades de cosechar sus granos básicos para la venta y asi incrementar sus ganancias en sus cultivos   y tener mejor ingresos para la economía de su hogar. El junto con sus hijos  en las siembras de granos básicos, este ha sido su único negocio. 
Le gustaría comercializar sus productos en la misma comarca donde habita para evitar mayores gastos. Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio para obtener mejores ganancias y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes. Don Pánfilo solicita el financiamiento para comprar abono, fertilizante, etc. Para el mantenimiento de su cosecha y que le permita ofrecer un buen producto de calidad a sus clientes, sus planes futuro es poder comprar tierra para ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Pánfilo comes from the rural district of San Jerónimo, Teustepe, in the town of Boaco. He's married and has eight children aged 14, 17, 21, 23, 25, 28, 30 and 32 years. He's a farmer by trade. He grows corn and beans and has 35 years' worth of experience. He first started working with his father when he was very young. They used to grow the crops only for the family's consumption, but nowadays there are great opportunities in harvesting basic grains for selling. That way he can increase the earnings he gets from his crops and obtain better profits for his household's finances. He sows basic grains alongside his children and this has been his only business.
He would like to sell his produce in the same district where he lives so that he could avoid the added expenses. His expectation is to have his business grow in order to improve his earnings and meet his customers' needs.
