She likes working in with agricultural products because they are sought after by the whole sale buyers. Even though she works on rented parcels, they still result in good earnings for her and her family. This despite that fact that sometimes rain and sudden changes in the weather force them to stop working, which puts them back considerably. 

As with all farmers, she needs sufficient capital to cover the entire growing season until the harvest, processing, and sale of the product.  On her list of requirements is sacks of manure and money to pay her workers. 

She hopes to keep working at the same rhythm so that she can, in the future, buy her own parcel and continue working in this business. This is her first loan with Microfinzas Prisma. She is already grateful for the trust that has been shown her and she pledges to make her repayments punctually. She feels very comfortable with the way her communal bank works and promotes teamwork.

The 500.00 PEN (Peruvian nuevos soles) will compliment her working capital so she can buy inputs such as manure and also hire laborers.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure and hire laborers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Betzabe

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SR DE LOS TEMBLORES III,la socia continua con su negocio de venta de artesania como carteras de cuero,chompas,polos ,collares,artes entre otros,la socia lleva años en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,la socia a la vez es administradora de hoteles ,aun no ejerce su carrera ya que esta mas dedicada a su negocio pero no descarta en el futuro trabajar en algun hotel por otro lado aun esta viendo la apertura de su nuevo negocio con su hermano siendo esto  un proyecto a futuro,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.

La socia solicita el credito para al compra de chompas de alpaca para su negocio .

La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "Señor de los Temblores III" communal bank. She is still running her handicrafts business, selling leather purses, sweaters, t-shirts, necklaces, and art, among other things. She has been in this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. 

The member is also a hotel administrator; she is not currently working in her field since she is more dedicated to her business, but she doesn't rule out working in a hotel in the future. On the other hand, she is also looking at opening a new business with her brother as a future project. She is a responsible person, which is how she gets ahead. 

The member is requesting a loan to buy alpaca sweaters for her business. She feels grateful for the loan granted, and she promises to repay her loan according to the terms established.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters for her business.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SR DE LOS TEMBLORES III,el socio continua trabajando reparando y dando mantenimiento a computadoras,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia ,el socio desea en el futuro poder tener su propio local donde pueda brindar sus servicios,el socio es una persona responsable siendo asi que el socio sale adelante.
EL socio solicita el credito para la compra de herramientas para su trabajo como aerosoles en spray y para algunos gastos personales.
EL socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the SR DE LOS TEMBLORES III Communal Bank. He continues to work repairing and maintaining computers. He has been doing this work for quite some time and is doing well thanks to the effort he puts into it each day. He hopes in the future to be able to have his own premises from which to offer his services. He is a responsible person which is why he does well.
The member is requesting a loan to buy tools for his work, such as spray aerosols, and for some personal expenses.
He is grateful for the loan granted and is committed to making the agreed payments.

loans.use: to buy tools for his work, such as spray aerosols, and for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is from Cabungaan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 25 years old. Marife is married and has two children. To make a living, Marife cultivates coconuts to sell. She has been in this business for 7 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2009, Marife joined GDMPC. Marife is requesting a loan of 7,500 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase her crop yield. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Amilcar Andres

texts.es: Amílcar Andrés  de 35 anos de edad de la localidad Chinandega, casado, sin hijos, tiene por actividad económica el servicio de levantado de texto, escaneo, copias entre otros. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación tiene ocho anos de tener el negocio. El negocio surgió como iniciativa propia para mejorar los ingresos del hogar.  Amílcar ya ha trabajo con fundación y ha demostrado su responsabilidad de pago en tiempo y forma. El financiamiento lo necesita  para invertir en capital de trabajo y darle mantenimiento a las maquinas. Amílcar agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Amilcar Andrés, 35, is from the town of Chinandega. He is married with no children. He has a business offering raised texts, scanning and copying, among other services. His business, which he has run for the past eight years, is located in his home. He started the business on his own initiative in order to improve his household's income.

Amilcar has already worked with Fundación León and has demonstrated his commitment to making his payments on time. He needs funding to invest in working capital and to do maintenance on his machines. He is grateful for the help that Kiva lenders have given to people with scarce resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can provide sources of worthwhile work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to maintain his cyber machines.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en: Elina is requesting a new loan to buy more milk to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers and increase her sales. Elina also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase gallons of milk for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making breads and pastries

loans.name: Cindy Marely

texts.es:
doña Cindy tiene un local de comideria, negocio que tiene un año de estar funcionando, ofreciendo una variedad de comidas típicas nicaragüenses.

Ella trabajo antes de poner su negocio, en una comideria donde aprendió a cocinar y la administración de este local, por lo que cuenta con experiencia en el manejo de un restaurante.

Sin embargo a pesar de ser joven, tiene la iniciativa de crear su propio negocio donde ha tenido una gran aceptación en el servicio brindado, ella tiene el arte de poder hacer, tacos, que es una comida muy conocida en la zona de San Rafael, el taco consiste en la preparación de carne desmenuzada y luego rellena la tortilla con esta carne y la hecha a freí en aceite.

Necesita efectivo para comprar algunos materiales de construcción para construir su vivienda con el préstamo y unos ahorros que tenia con el apoyo económico de su pareja.
texts.en:
Cindy has an eatery, a business she started a year ago, which offers a variety of traditional Nicaraguan dishes. Before she opened her own business, she worked in an eatery where she learned how to cook and manage a place so she has had experience running a restaurant.

Nevertheless, despite being young, she has the initiative to create her own business where the service she offers has been well received. She has a gift for making tacos, which is a well-known food in the area of San Rafael. The taco consists of preparing ground meat and then filling the tortilla with the meat before frying it in oil. 

Cindy needs cash in order to purchase construction materials to build her house. She will use the loan and some savings she had along with financial help from her partner.

loans.use: to buy constructions materials such as sand, cement, stone, etc.

loans.name: Migdalia De Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Migdalia es una microempresaria que tiene por negocio brindar servicio de venta de comida fritas tales como tacos, enchilada, carne asada, entre otras comida típicas de Nicaragua.

Su negocio lo empieza con ahorros propios, dinero que obtuvo por trabajar como vendedora de granos básicos en una distribuidora de la ciudad de san Rafael del sur.

La idea de tener su propio negocio nace a raíz de quedar en el desempleo, sin embargo fue una oportunidad que se le presento para tener su propia actividad de negocio.

En estos momentos necesita un financiamiento para comprar frutas, verduras, aceite, esto con el objetivo de brindar una atención oportuna y permitirle mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
Su estado civil es acompañada y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Migdalia is a small business owner who sells fried food such as tacos, enchiladas, grilled meat and other typical Nicaraguan dishes.

She started her business with her own savings, using money she earned working selling staple foods for a distribution company in the city of San Rafael del sur.

The idea of having her own business came about when she lost her job, but it became an opportunity to start her own business.

At the moment she needs some funding to buy fruit, vegetables and oil with the aim of providing a good service and improving her family's conditions.
She lives with her partner and has three school-age children.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat and oil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her computer shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en: Mrs. Nabila is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She has been in business selling home products for the last twelve years. She purchases bed sheets and towels, etc. from the market in Taxila at wholesale rates and sells them in her community from her home. Her husband is a government employee, but his income is not sufficient to meet all the expenses so she is doing her business fairly.  She has a major contribution in meeting household expenses. Three years ago, she availed a loan from Kashf and increased her profit from the business. Now, she wants to invest more to purchase more items such as bed sheets and towels in various colors and designs. She hopes to earn more income through her large sales.  She dreams of providing good and quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more items such as bed sheets and towels in various colors and designs.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
From Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Rosalinda is 31 years old, married, and has five children. To make a living, Rosalinda manages a banana and coconut production business. Engaged in her venture for five years, she earns 3,000 PHP a month.

A member of GDMPC since 2007, Rosalinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Antonia es una  microempresaria que tiene como negocio la venta de productos de consumo humano como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, maíz aceite entre otros, su negocio lo empezó por iniciativa propia.

Su actividad comercial ha mejorado gracias al entusiasmo de salir adelante, por lo que ella necesita la colaboración de kiva y Ceprodel,  para obtener fondos para diversificar su negocio con productos de coca cola y de pepsi,  productos de los cuales tiene una gran demanda en su establecimiento.

Su casa la construyo de las ganancias generadas de su negocio y necesita el apoyo económico para ampliar su mercado.

Su estado civil es soltero, y ella está a cargo de su mama, y de los gastos de su hogar.
texts.en:
Antonia is a small business owner who sells foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, beans, corn and oil, among other things. She started her business on her own initiative.

Her business has improved thanks to her enthusiasm for getting ahead. As such she needs the collaboration of Kiva and Ceprodel to obtain funds to diversify her business with Coca-Cola and Pepsi products.

She built her house with the proceeds of her business, and she needs financial support to widen her market.

She is single and looks after her mother and the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soda drinks

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora catalina a la edad de treinta y siete años se desempeña de maestra de educación primaria en zonas rurales de san Rafael del sur. 

 Ejerciendo dicha labor tiene más de quince años con lo cual ha logrado ganar la confianza de alumnos y padre de familia que tienen a su hijos en el centro escolar donde ella labora. 

Solicita crédito para compra de cemento, arena y bloques los que utilizara para algunas mejoras en su hogar.

 actualmente es madre soltera de dos hijos los cuales les ha dado la educación de acuerdo a sus ingreso.
texts.en:
Señora Catalina, at 37 years old, works as a primary school teacher in the rural areas of San Rafael Del Sur. 

She has been working as a teacher for more than fifteen years.  During that time she has earned the trust of the students and the parents who send their children to the school she works at.

Señora Catalina is requesting the loan to purchase cement, sand and blocks, which she will use to make some improvements to her home.

Right now, señora Catalina is a single mother of two children.  She has given them the education that her income has allowed.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like sand, cement, blocks, iron and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her shop.

loans.name: Jazmín Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Jazmín a sus treinta y nueve años es una persona emprendedora y con muchos deseos de superación.

 Actualmente administra un negocio de ventas de abarrotes en donde vende productos de consumo básico para sus clientes tales como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, productos lácteos, entre otros.

Es importante mencionar que además de su negocio de abarrote, también tiene un punto de venta de comidas rápidas en donde percibe otros ingresos para mejorar las condiciones de su familia.

Solicita crédito para capital de trabajo el cual le dará la opción de aumentar la cantidad de productos ofertados como granos básicos, gaseosas, aceite, jabón entre otros.asi mejorara su negocio lo que dará una mejor satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jazmín is 39 and is an enterprising person with a great desire to improve her circumstances.

She currently runs a small grocery business where she sells to her customers basic consumer products such as rice, sugar, beans and dairy products, among other things.

It is important to note that as well as her grocery store she also has a fast food post, from which she derives another income to improve her family's circumstances.

She is requesting a loan as working capital, which will give her the option of increasing the amount of products she offers, such as staple grains, sodas, oil and soap. This will improve her business and provide more satisfaction for her customers.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sodas, oil, soap and other products.

loans.name: Sharon Fe

texts.en:
Sharon Fe is married with one child. She is 40 years old and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Sharon Fe owns and operates a service-based business providing transportation to earn a living. She's been in this business for three years. Each month, she earns 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from this business. 

Sharon Fe requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. She has been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as foodstuffs, cleaning products, medicines and beverages, to restock and diversify her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as foodstuffs, cleaning products, medicines and beverages, to resell in her store.

loans.name: Telma

texts.en:
This is Telma, 37, a resident of GMA, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo and is a mother to her children. She manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Telma operates a LPG business. What she basically does is buy liquefied petroleum gas tanks from wholesalers and sells them, per tank, with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tanks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Telma is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more stocks of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Telma hopes her business will grow in the coming years and dreams of giving a good future to her family through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members* to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of LPG tanks to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Gazelle

texts.en: Gazelle is married with two children. She is 27 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Gazelle owns and operates a plot of farm land, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 5 years and earns 3,000 PHP each month. She requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Gazelle been a member of Kiva's partner GDMPC since 2008. In the future, Gazelle's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Ms. Robina is a 30-year-old married woman. She is very talented and excels in work in the beauty parlor. She has gotten a lot of appreciation from her community. She has one daughter and two sons. Her husband is a builder and makes small buildings. His income is not enough to cover family expenditures. 

Robina wants to support her family by using her great talent. She requested a loan of 20,000 Rs (Pakistan rupees) to buy more packs of makeup kits, whitening products and a new steamer. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard slog in her business.

loans.use: To buy more packs of makeup kits, whitening products and a new steamer.

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en: Scholastica is requesting a new loan to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as hair extension tools, cosmetic products and nail polish, among other chemicals. Scholastica's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a better income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will help her increase the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase sales. She hopes that the loan will permit her to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon, such as hair extension tools, cosmetic products and nail polish, among other chemicals

loans.name: Herling Danilo

texts.es:
El señor Herling tiene treinta años de edad trabaja para una estación de servicios.

 Solicita crédito para comprar arena, cemento y piedras cantera los que utilizará para mejoras en su hogar.
Es una persona emprendedora y de buena costumbre de pago.

 Los días libres los aprovecha para conducir una moto taxis la cual es propiedad de un hermano de él con lo cual lleva más ingresos a la unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Señor Herling is thirty years old and works for a service station. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase sand, cement and quarry rocks, which he will use to make improvements to his home.  

He is an enterprising person who re-pays his loans on time. 

On his days off, Señor Herling likes to take advantage of the time to drive a moto taxi, which belongs to his brother.  Doing so, he brings additional income to the family unit.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials like sand, cement and blocks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Banco Mujer Kaneblapa Group

texts.es:
Doña Marla es la presidenta de un grupo nuevo en la zona de Bambú en Talamanca, ella tiene 36 años,  y es una mujer sola, con 6 hijos, 2 mayores de edad, y 4 menores  estudiantes. Ella es muy trabajadora, y entregada a sus hijos, desea salir adelante llevar el sustento a su hogar y sueña con darles los estudios a sus hijos. Marla se dedica a la porcicultura, cría de cerdos y también vende carne de cerdo. El crédito le va a permitir comprar cerdos pequeños para proceso de engorde y venta, este es su primer crédito y está convncida que bien invertido será de mucha ayuda para hacer crecer su negocio. 
Junto a Marla están 7 socias más que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Doña Marla is the president of a new communal bank in the Bambú area of Talamanca.  She is 36 years old, single and has six children, two of whom are grown and 4 who are school-aged.  She is very hard-working and giving to her children.  She wants to get ahead, support her household and dreams of giving her children an education.  Marla makes her living raising pigs.  She raises the pigs and also sells the pork.  The loan will allow her to purchase small pigs to fatten and sell.  This is Marla's first loan, and she is convinced that well invested, the loan will be a great help in growing her business. 
Together with Marla are seven more members who are also going to invest in pig raising businesses.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, animal feed and other items.

loans.name: Felipa Anastasia

texts.es:
La Señora Felipa Anastasia, tiene un negocio de  venta de refrescos naturales, gaseosas y agua heladas, inicia a preparar sus refresco desde las 8:00 am a las 9:30 am posteriormente sale a venderlo de forma ambulante por las calle de la ciudad  León Nicaragua, realiza este trabajo  desde hace veintiún años para ayudar a sus esposo a mantener el hogar.
 
La Señora  está solicitando un crédito el cual utilizará  para  comprar naranjas, piñas,  semilla de jícaros, cacao pallana, azúcar, gaseosas, agua,  para la elaboración de sus deliciosos refrescos naturales que son un manjar para el deleite de su clientela además ofrece, gaseosas y aguas heladas y reposterías.

Doña Felipa Anastasia   ha mejorado su   nivel de vida y de su familia ya que con los ingresos obtenido producto de los créditos brindado por Ceprodel ha remodelado su humilde vivienda dándole más comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Felipa Anastasia has a business selling natural sodas, and cold sodas and water. She starts preparing her sodas from 8:00 a.m. to 9:30 a.m., after which she leaves to sell them on foot in the streets of the city of León, Nicaragua.

She has been doing this work for 21 years to help her husband support the household. She is requesting a loan which she will use to buy oranges, pineapples, gourd seeds, harvested cacao, sugar, soft drinks, water and cinnamon for the production of her delicious natural sodas which are a delicacy to delight her customers with. She also offers cold soft drinks and waters, and pastries.

Felipa Anastasia has improved her quality of life and that of her family since, with the income she obtained from the loans she was offered by Ceprodel, she was able to remodel her humble home, making it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to buy oranges, pineapples, gourd seeds, harvested cacao, sugar, soft drinks, water and cinnamon

loans.name: Kelly

texts.es:
Kelly, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además de ser alegre y cordial. Es conviviente con Gipson quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es  padre de sus 2 hijos, por quienes se esfuerza en trabajar. Juntos están cómodamente instalados en su propia casa que compró con el fruto de sus esfuerzos.
La actividad que realiza Kelly es la venta de comidas como “juanes” que consiste en arroz envuelto en hojas, caldos de gallina, pescados asados y otros, los cuales prepara en su casa y los lleva a vender en la vía pública en una mesa que instala en una vereda cerca a su casa, y por tanto sus clientes quedan satisfechos por la buena sazón y la excelente atención que les brinda.
Se inició hace más de 3 años con un préstamo particular y hasta el momento cuenta con la ayuda de su pareja en el traslado de su comida. Tiene planes de abrir en un futuro un restaurante en algún local alquilado de una zona comercial de la ciudad. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, y con el monto de 1200 nuevos soles que lo solicita, lo invertirá comprando ingredientes para la preparación de comidas como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceites y otros en mayores cantidades y a precios más bajos, para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Kelly, 24 years old, is a hardworking woman who is determined to improve her lot in life. She is also cheerful and polite. She lives with her partner, Gipon, who is in construction and works hard to support his two children. They are comfortably installed in a house they built with the fruits of their own labors.
Kelly makes a living by selling food such as "juanes" (rice wrapped in leaves), chicken soup, grilled fish, etc., which she prepares at home and then sells at a table she sets up on a sidewalk near her home. Her customers love the delicious flavors and excellent service she offers.
Three years ago she took out a personal loan, and her partner helps her transport her food. She plans to open a restaurant in the future in a rented space in one of the city's commercial areas. This is her third loan with MFP, and she will use the 1,200 nuevos soles to buy ingredients for preparing her foods--such as rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, and so on--in greater quantities and at lower prices, which will allow her to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, and so on.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is taking out a new loan to make a new investment. She is asking for a loan in the amount of Ksh 50,000 to expand her existing business. Fatuma will be able to buy bales of flour, detergents, cooking oils, and other basic products.
Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and will help her improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy bales of flour, detergents, cooking oils, and other basic products.

loans.name: Gabin Odjoulayé

texts.fr: Gabin Odjoulayé est âgé de 32 ans et vit au Bénin. Gabin Odjoulayé est marié à Augustine, une marchande. Le couple a deux enfants, dont aucun scolarisé et tous à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins du ménage. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Gabin Odjoulayé mène comme activité, depuis sept ans, l’électricité bâtiment dans sa région. Secondairement à cette activité, Gabin Odjoulayé vend des matériels électriques. Gabin Odjoulayé s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, et d’accroître son revenu, Gabin Odjoulayé désire un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Pour ce faire, Gabin Odjoulayé sollicite pour la troisième fois, un crédit. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Gabin Odjoulayé is 32 years old and lives in Benin.  He is married to Augustine, a seller, with whom he has two children.  The children do not go to school and they are both in the couple's care.  In addition to their own children, Gabin Odjoulayé and Augustine have another child in their care.  They live with their children and jointly take care of the needs of the household.

To provide for his family, Gabin Odjoulayé has been working as a construction electrician, in his region, for the past seven years.  In addition to this activity, he also sells electric supplies, buying his goods in Nigeria.

In order to meet his customers' demand, and to boost his income, he is requesting a loan from ALIDé, for the third time.  This loan will surely help him to raise his level of activity and to make more profits.  His previous loans were duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy electric supplies.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Don Luis es una persona de avanzada edad pero sigue con esa misma fortaleza de emprendimiento, trabajo, humildad, que lo a caracterizado toda su vida, brindando los mejores años de su vida al cuidado de su familia.

El credito solicitado a fodemi es para comprar mesas sillas manteles y arreglar su cochesito donde vende unas ricas hamburguesas, hot dogs, salchipapa, lo importante para don luis es dar la mejor atencion a su cliente, es por ello solicita el credito para mejorar por sus clientes.

El sueño de don Luis es el tener varios carritos de venta de hamburguesas en toda la ciudad, y ser conocido como el señor de las hamburguesas, y con estos ingresos economicos comprar alimento y muchas cosas para su esposa y su familia que tanto les hace falta.
texts.en: Don Luis is a man of many years, but he goes on with the same entrepreneurial skill, hard work, and humility that have characterized his whole life, dedicating the best years of his life to taking care of his family. The loan he is seeking from FODEMI [Kiva field partner] is to buy tables and fold-up chairs and to fix up his cart, where he sells delicious hamburgers, hot dogs, and french fries. What matters most to Don Luis is providing the best service possible to his customers. He's requested the loan to make improvements for his clients. Don Luis's dream is to have several hamburger carts all around the city and to be known as the hamburger man. With the income he would buy food and the many other things his wife and family are in such need of.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs and make repairs for his hamburger cart business.

loans.name: Amelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Amelia, es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a vender ropa nueva y ropa usada, su forma de venta es ambulante de casa en casa en el municipio donde vive.

Tiene experiencia con este tipo de trabajo, prueba de esto es que actualmente necesita mayor capital de trabajo para comprar una variedad de ropa que sus clientes le están solicitando.

Ella inicio su negocio por la necesidad de darle a sus hijos una mejor condición de vida, su pareja emigro a otro país en busca de trabajo, sin embargo no le fue tan bien y  por iniciativa propia empieza a tener su propia actividad comercial donde obtiene ingresos para mantener su hogar.

Su capital inicial fue del dinero que su esposo obtuvo del trabajo realizado en otro país, y en vez de gastarlo decide en invertirlo para obtener ganancias.
texts.en:
Doña Amelia is a small retailer who makes her living selling new and used clothing.  She sells her products door to door in her municipality. 

She has experience in this type of work, proof of which is that she currently needs more capital to purchase the variety of clothing that her customers are requesting. 

Doña Amelia started her business because she needed to give her children a better quality of life.  Her partner emigrated to another country to look for work.  Even so, the family wasn't doing very well.  By her own initiative, Doña Amelia started her own business to earn money to support her home. 

Her start-up capital came from the money that her husband made working in another country.  Instead of spending the money, Doña Amelia decided to invest it in earning a better income.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of clothing.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is married and a mother of two dependent children. She is 48 years old and lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Susana makes and sells manufactured items, such as baskets, to earn a living. She has had this business for five years. She earns PHP 3,000 each month doing this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,500 from GDMPC, to purchase raw materials to make into baskets and other items. Susana joined GDMPC this year. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her manufactured products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell.

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
Salama is 40 years old and lives with her life partner and six school-aged children. She is a responsible and hardworking mother who works long days. She has one great dream of providing her family with the necessities of life. Salama makes a living selling clothes. She sells her products by going door-to-door in various neighborhoods. To make the most of her week, she visits a different neighborhood each day to gain more customers.

Salama is requesting a loan from Yehu that will allow her to buy a bigger variety of clothing and styles so that she will be able to fill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: to buy a bigger variety of clothing and styles

loans.name: Assogba

texts.fr: Assogba est âgé de 50 ans et vit au Bénin. Assogba est marié à Kossi, une marchande. Le couple a six enfants, dont certains scolarisés et un reste à leur charge. Le couple vit ensemble avec les enfants et assure ensemble les divers besoins besoins du ménage.Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Assogba mène comme activité depuis dix huit années, l'agriculture dans sa région. Parallèlement à cette activité, Assogba vend des boissons. Assogba s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Afin de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, et d’accroître son revenu, Assogba désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Assogba sollicite pour la première fois, un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce prêt lui permettra certainement de rehausser le niveau de son activité et de se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
Assogba is 50 years old and lives in Benin.  He is married to Kossi, a seller, with whom he has six children.  Some of the couple's children are in school, the others are still in their care.  Assogba and his wife live with their children and jointly take care of the various needs of the household.

To provide for his family, Assogba has been working as a farmer in his region, for the past eighteen years.  In addition to this activity, he also sells drinks, buying his goods from a town in Benin.

In order to meet his customers' demand and to boost his income, he would like to increase his stock of goods.  To do so, he is requesting a loan from ALIDé for the first time.  This loan will surely help him to raise the level of his activity and to make more profits.

loans.use: to buy drinks.

loans.name: Fulgencia Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Fulgencia Mercedes, trabaja en un centro hospitalario  desde hace  25 años, es madre soltera de tres hijos de edades 28,25 y 19 años.

La señora Fulgencia Mercedes  sale de su casa a las 6:40 am inicia sus labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 3:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

La señora Fulgencia Mercedes  es el segundo crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel para cubrir gastos Médicos ya necesita hacerse una cirugía en una de su rodilla para evitar complicaciones futuras que le perjudiquen su salud.
texts.en: Ms. Fulgencia Mercedes has worked at a medical center for 25 years and is a single mother of three children, ages 28, 25, and 19. Fulgencia Mercedes leaves her house at 6:40 in the morning and starts her work at 7:00, finishing at 3:00 pm. She has the same schedule Monday through Friday. Fulgencia Mercedes is one her second loan with Ceprodel [Kiva Field Partner] to pay the medical expenses she faces for a surgery she needs for one of her knees. She needs this surgery to avoid further complications that could harm her health.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses for her surgery.

loans.name: Vilyat

texts.en:
Vilyat is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two sons aged 5 and 6. He has been running a butcher shop for 7 years. He purchases livestock from local herders and sells the meat at the local central bazaar. 

Vilyat does not just purchase and sell livestock, he also breeds the sheep to make them bigger and then sells them to retailers. He alone supports his family, and he wishes to increase his working capital and income to cover his family expenses and children's upbringing. Vilyat is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase a 1 year old sheep. He is a hardworking, responsible man who believes that if a person works hard, life treats him better.

loans.use: to purchase a 1 year old sheep.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of beverages to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira is 52 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband is a taxi driver. For the last 19 years, Tahira has been working in trade at the local bazaar. She mainly sells women's clothing. She started her business with capital of 200 AZN, and over time, she has increased it to 2400 AZN. Tahira has a hearty character and is a responsible woman. For all these years, she has been helping her husband to support their family. Tahira is seeking a loan to buy men's underwear to resell.

loans.use: To buy men's underwear to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to resell

loans.name: Nicolaska Lissette

texts.es:
La Joven Nicolaska Lissette, trabaja en un centro hospitalario,  desempeñándose como secretaria  desde hace  5 años, es madre soltera de un hijo de edad 12 años.

La Joven Nicolaska Lissette  sale se sus casa a las 6:30 am y llega  a sus centro de labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 3:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

La joven Nicolaska Lissette  es el tercer crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel para cubrir gastos de cancelación de aranceles del año escolar, ya que sus sueños son la preparación de su pequeño  hijo.
texts.en: Young Nicolaska Lissette has worked in a medial center as a secretary for 5 years. She's a single mother of one 12-year-old son. The young lady leaves her house at 6:30 in the morning and finishes her work at 3:00 pm, working the same schedule Monday through Friday. Nicolaska is on her third loan with Ceprodel [Kiva Field Partner] to pay for her son's school expenses. Her hopes are set on her little boy's education.

loans.use: to pay her son's school expenses.

loans.name: Brenda Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Cecilia, trabaja en un centro estatal de León  desempeñándose como Responsable de Oficina   desde hace  25 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos de edades 19 y 12 años.

La señora Brenda Cecilia  sale se sus casa a las 6:20 am inicia sus  labores  a las  7:00 am finalizando a las 5:00 pm  con este mismo horario de lunes a viernes.

Brenda Cecilia  es el primer crédito que solicita  a Ceprodel para cubrir gastos de graduación de uno de su pequeño hijo y cancelación de aranceles del año escolar de ambos,  sus sueños que logren coronar una carrera profesional  sus hijos y realizar mejora en su vivienda para darle una mejor comodidad a su linda familia.
texts.en: Ms. Brenda Cecilia has worked as an office manage at a government office for 25 years. She's a single mother of two children, ages 19 and 12. Brenda Cecilia leaves her house at 6:20 in the morning and gets to work at 7:00. She works until 5:00 pm every day Monday through Friday. Brenda Cecilia is seeking her first loan with Ceprodel [Kiva Field Partner] to pay the school expenses of her two sons and to pay for her eldest's graduation. She hopes her boys will succeed in making professional careers and wants to make improvements to her home to make life more comfortable for her beautiful family.

loans.use: to pay her sons' school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.en:
Cipriana is married, 55 years of age, and lives in Gala, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental together with her two kids. 

Cipriana buys and sells bamboo trees to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years and she earns 6,000 PHP ( Philippines pesos) every month. She is requesting a loan of 9,500 PHP to purchase equipment for bamboo cleaning. She joined GDMPC in 2007. In the future, Cipriana will use her income to support her kids in their studies until they finish college, and in their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for bamboo cleaning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for maintenance of the motorcycle.

loans.name: Suraya

texts.en:
Suraya is a 31-year-old married woman. She is a mother of three children. 

Suraya has a business making garlands with artificial flowers and glittering papers. She is passionate about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is a government servant of grade 7, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. 

Suraya's garlands are very popular on her street, and she is the best earning resource in her household. She wants to grow her business and requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy raw materials such as glittering papers and packs of pearls, sequins, and ribbons in various colors for embellishment. In this way she will be able to meet the orders on time and inflate her sales to the local market. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to purchase glittering papers and packs of pearls, sequins, and ribbons in various colors for embellishment.

loans.name: Rosa Concepción

texts.es:
doña Rosa es una pequeña comerciante que se dedica a vender frutas, verduras y granos básicos desde hace ocho años.

Su actividad comercial la empezó con poco dinero, vendiendo plátanos, tomates y cebolla, y poco a poco gracias a la perseverancia que mostró en el desempeño de su trabajo su negocio ha mejorado.

Sin embargo la demanda ha crecido y de igual forma el número de sus clientes, por lo que en estos momentos ella necesita capital de trabajo para brindar a sus clientes una variedad de productos como;granos básicos, como arroz, frijoles, Maíz 

Es una persona que sabe lo que hace, le gusta su trabajo, maneja muy bien a sus clientes, y sus sueños es tener un establecimiento en el que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos, y de esta forma contribuir al mejoramiento de las condiciones de sus familia, en brindarle una mejor alimentación y educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Doña Rosa is a small merchant who for eight years has sold fruit, vegetables, and basic grains. She started out with very little money selling plantains, tomatoes, and onions and little by little, thanks to her perseverance and dedication to her work, her business has improved. Nonetheless, higher demand means more customers and that's why she needs some capital right now to provide her customers with a wider variety of goods such as grains, rice, beans, corn, etc. She's a capable person who likes her work, handles her clients well, and dreams of having an establishment where her customers feel satisfied. That's the way she plans to improve her family's living conditions and provide the best food and education to her children.

loans.use: to buy basic grains like rice, beans, and corn.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia, de 52 años, es una mujer muy alegre, amable y emprendedora. Vive en una casa alquilada junto a su pareja Jorge que se dedica la extracción de madera. El trabajo de Virginia consiste en la preparación de comidas regionales, que son juanés, tacacho con cecina, patarashca, pescado ahumado; en tanto Jorge cuando está en la ciudad se dedica ayudarla en la compras que es cada mañana así como en la preparación. Por el momento realiza sus ventas en el frontis de la casa la cual alquilo. Lleva 6 años en este negocio, y hasta el momento le ha generado las ganancias de un 50% más y le da mucha satisfacción. Hace un tiempo sufrió un robo se llevaron casi todo lo que había conseguido con tanto esfuerzo y trabajo, ante eso tomó la decisión de empezar de nuevo y ahora le esta yendo muy bien, la clientela ha ido aumentando, y con ell está saliendo adelante. Tiene pensado acrecentar su negocio y conseguir un local propio, por tanto éste será su préstamo número 2 a la intitcuión, y espera conseguir 1000 soles, para que pueda comprar platos, cucharas, ollas, y víveres arroz, hojas de bijao, pescado, plátano, etc. Para preparar sus deliciosos  platos regionales.
texts.en: Virginia is 52 and is a very happy, friendly, and entrepreneurial woman.  She lives in a rented house with her husband, Jorge, who works extracting wood.  Virginia works making regional dishes, which are juanes [a tamale-like dish], tacacho con cecina [balls of dough made from plantains served with pork cracklings and chorizo], patarashca [fish wrapped in a bijao leaf and grilled], and smoked fish.  When Jorge is in the city, he helps her by shopping in the mornings as well as by helping her cook.  She currently makes her sales in front of her house.  She has had this business for 6 years, and she has earned 50% more profits, which gives her a lot of satisfaction.  Some time ago, she was robbed, and the thieves took almost everything that she had acquired with so much effort and work.  She decided to start again, and it is going well for her.  Her clientele has increased, and she is getting ahead.  She has thought about growing her business and acquiring her own location.  This is why she is requesting her second loan from the institution.  She hopes to receive 1,000 soles so she can buy plates, spoons, pots, supplies, rice, bijao leaves, fish, plantains, etc., to prepare her delicious regional dishes.

loans.use: to buy plates, spoons, pots, supplies, rice, bijao leaves, fish, and plantains.

loans.name: Parukh

texts.en:
Parukh lives in the small village of Bonisi District. He is married and lives with his wife Samira and mother. Samira is a housewife. Parukh is at the moment unemployed. The only source of income for the family is the monthly pension of Parukh’s mother and a small income from a family owned dairy farm of two milk cows, whose milk is used in dairy products that are sold locally. 

Parukh requested credit to start his own business and increase the monthly income for his family. His loan request was approved in the frame of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and restartup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

With the received credit Parukh will purchase a mini-bus, which will be used for selling fruits and vegetables. He will purchase products from farmers at wholesale prices and sell them in nearby towns for a higher price. The income of the family will increase and they will be able to improve the living conditions of the family. Along with the above mentioned, the family will have enough income to access regular credit products available in the country’s capital market, if needed.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for trade business (fruits & vegetables).

loans.name: Futuro Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Futuro” está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; servicio colectivo (medio de transporte), almacén, amasandería, venta de completos, venta de ropa, feriantes, repostería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Mauricio, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentado en primera fila, ocupando el segundo lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste jeans, camisa blanca y chaqueta de color negro, en su cabeza lleva puesto un gorro de lana.
El se dedica  al rubro de mueblería realiza varios tipos de muebles para el hogar, desde hace 5 años. Trabaja de lunes a viernes en un taller que adapto para la instalación de su mueblería, además ofrece sus servicios por una página en internet.
La mercadería y materiales que va necesitando los compra en grandes distribuidoras que se especializan en vender todo tipo de maderas a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará madera, melanina blanca para hacer muebles de cocina.
Una de las metas de Mauricio es crecer y seguir con las ventas y satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes, ya que a veces trabaja con muebles a pedidos específicos de la clientela, y a la vez generar mayores ingresos para optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Mauricio vive solo. Sus sueños a nivel laboral es lograr ser independiente y seguir creando muebles para el hogar.
El se siente muy contento y agradecido de la oportunidad  brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le abrió una puerta laboral y le permitirá invertir en su negocio y también para su desarrollo personal, ya que ha aprendido a organizar y distribuir de mejor manera sus ingresos e inversiones.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "Futuro” (Future).  It is made up of eighteen entrepreneurs who make their livings in different areas, including "colectivo" service (a transportation service), small groceries, bakeries, hotdog sales, clothing sales, handicrafts, confectionery and other services.  All of them live in the city of Valparaíso.
Mauricio, a member of the communal bank, is seated in the first row in the above picture.  He is second from the right and wearing jeans, a white shirt and a black jacket.  He has a wool hat on his head. 
Mauricio makes his living in furniture making.  He has been making various types of household furniture for the last five years.  He works form Monday to Friday in a workshop that he adapted for furniture making.  In addition, he advertises his services on the Internet. 
He buys his merchandise and materials from a large distribution center that specializes in selling all kinds of wood at low cost, which is financially advisable. 
With the loan, Mauricio will purchase wood and white melanin to make kitchen furniture. 
One of Mauricio's goals is to grow his business and keep up with the sales and meeting his customers' needs.  Sometimes he works with special orders, which gives him better earnings and allows him a better quality of life. 
Mauricio lives alone.  His professional dreams are to become independent and to keep making household furniture. 
He feels very happy about and thankful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza, as it opened a door for him that allowed him to invest in his business and also his personal development.  He has learned a better way of organizing and distributing his income and investments. 
Valparaíso is situated 120 km. to the northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also the legislative seat of the country.  Valparaíso was the country's first port and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque areas, for example, Nobel Prize winning Pablo Neruda's home.

loans.use: to purchase wood and white melanin to make kitchen furniture.

loans.name: Martha Lorena

texts.es:
La señora Martha Lorena es comerciante de uno de los Mercados de la ciudad de León, Sale de su casa de habitación a las 6:00 am para iniciar sus labores a las 7:00am finalizándolas a las 5:00 pm en este mismo horario de lunes a sábado, viaja a Managua dos veces  por semana a comprar  su mercadería, Ella realiza este trabajo para el sustento de su dos hijos ya que es madre soltera. 

El crédito que solicita a Ceprodel lo utilizara para la compra de nuevos productos que estén a la moda tales como: shampoo, crema, vanidad, pintura de uñas y de labios, perfume, diadema, piraña, cola, aretes y bolsos Permitiéndole atraer más clientela e incrementando las ventas y ganancias para el sustento de su familia.

Los sueños de la señora es lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales coronando una carrera en un futuro.
texts.en:
Martha Lorena is a merchant at one of the markets of the city of León. She leaves her home at 6:00 a.m. to start her work at 7:00 a.m., finishing up at 5:00 p.m. She follows this same schedule from Monday through Saturday. She travels to Managua twice a week to buy her merchandise. She does this work to support her two children, since she is a single mother. 

She will use the loan she is requesting from Ceprodel to buy new products which are in fashion, such as shampoo, creams, beauty items, nail polish, lipstick, perfumes, headbands, hair clips, ponytail holders and purses. This will allow her to attract more customers and increase her sales and earnings to support her family. 

Her dream is to see that her children earn degrees and become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, creams, beauty items, nail polish, lipstick, perfumes, headbands, hair clips, ponytail holders and purses.

loans.name: Vidzo

texts.en:
Vidzo is 35 years old and lives in a house he owns with his family: his wife and three children. His wife is a teacher by profession. Together they contribute to the welfare of their children. 

Two years ago, he opened a video showroom in the town of Kaloleni, and he has been able to have a number of customers, especially youths. He spends his time working in this business, with which he is able to support his family.

The loan that he is requesting is for the purchase of more videodisc movies of various kinds.

loans.use: to purchase  more videodisc movies of various kinds.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Elizabeth es casada tiene una hija menor de edad,su actividad comercial es venta de fritanga como: gallo pinto, enchiladas, tacos, tajadas de plátanos verde, torta de papas, pollo frito, estos son algunos  de los platos típicos de Nicaragua. Realiza estas comidas todos los días de lunes a domingo.

Este negocio lo inicio con capital propio y la ayuda de su mama. 

Solicita un financiamiento para mejora del local y compra de mesas y sillas plásticas. Para que le de mayor presentación al local y tener más clientela para obtener más ganancias.
texts.en: Señora Elizabeth is married and has one daughter, who is a minor.  She sells food such as gallo pinto [a rice and bean dish], enchiladas, tacos, fried plantain slices, potato cakes, and fried chicken.  These are some of Nicaragua's typical dishes.  She makes these dishes every day, Monday through Sunday.  She started her business with her own capital and help from her mother.  She is requesting financing to improve her location and to buy plastic tables and chairs so her business will have the best appearance and she can attract more customers to make more profits.

loans.use: to improve her location and to buy tables and chairs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anatoliy

texts.ru:
Анатолий  - фермер. С 1998 года занимается выращиванием зерновых культур таких как: зерно, ячмень, подсолнух.
Справляться по хозяйству ему помогает жена и двое старших детей.
Развитие деятельности начиналось с покупки пяти коров, которые давали молоко.
Анатолий с супругой решил приобрести дисковую борону к трактору, для вспашки и обработки своего земельного участка.
В планах на будущие:  приобрести трактор.
В личных планах: Анатолий мечтает заняться животноводством.
Нуждается в вашей помощи для финансирования дисковой бороны для трактора.
texts.en: Anatoliy works as a farmer. Since 1998, he's grown various cereal crops, such as wheat, barley and sunflowers. His wife and two oldest children assist him with running the business. Their first business expansion consisted of buying five milking cows. They're asking for a loan because now they want to buy a harrow with a pulverizer to plow and cultivate their field. In the future, they plan to purchase a tractor. Anatoliy also wants to start raising cattle.

loans.use: To purchase farming equipment.

loans.name: Miuston Yesenia

texts.es:
En el municipio del Sauce un bello y encantador pueblo donde está ubicada a 90 Km del departamento de león, existe diversas actividades, tanto como comerciales y ganadero. 

Miuston Yesenia se Llama la Joven de 30 años, cuenta con dos hijos a su cargo, da todo por ver a sus hijos vivan en mejores condiciones,  su esposo se dedica al comercio, con lo poco que ella gana se ayudan al sustento diario de su hogar mas los ingresos de su esposo, quien se dedica a la compra de cerdo, para luego destazarlo y poder vender la carne al mercado.  

Solicita a kiva y ceprodel que le financie un crédito, para la compra de Cemento, arena, ladrillo y pago de mano de Obra, esto sería de mucha importancia ya que sus principales sueño en su vida es obtener una mejor vivienda y esto solo se le puede cumplir  a través de un crédito que se le financie. 


sus sueños más grande es llegar a preparar a sus hijos, pero para esto ella tiene que contar con un buen desarrollo de vida, viviendo en mejores condiciones sus hijos crecerían saludable.
texts.en:
In the town of Sauce, a beautiful and charming town that is located 90 kilometers from the department of León, there are various activities, both commercial and livestock.

Miuston Yesenia is a young 30-year-old woman with two children in her care.  She gives everything to see that her children live in better conditions.  Her husband dedicates himself to business.  With the little that she earns she helps with the daily sustenance of their home with the income of her husband, who makes a living buying pigs to then butcher and sell the meat at market.

She is requesting that Kiva and Ceprodel finance a loan for the purchase of cement, sand and bricks and to pay for labor.  This would be of great importance since her main dream in life is to obtain better housing and this only can be carried out through a loan financed to her.

Her greatest dream is to prepare her children for life but in order to do this she has to have improvements, living in better conditions her children would grow healthy.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and bricks and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Union Y Fe Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Unión y Fe”  está conformado por 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; vitrofusión, mosaico, venta de productos secos, almacén, elaboración y venta de papas fritas, venta verduras, venta de articulos de belleza, servicios de coctelera, venta de queques y sándwich, recicladora de zapatillas, tejido en telares, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Valparaíso.
Johanna, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie en primera fila, ocupando el primer lugar de derecha a izquierda, viste un pantalón de color blanco, zapatillas, polera de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de peluquería y ventas de articulos y productos de temporada, desde hace 10 años. Comenta que trabaja de lunes a domingo, respecto a su peluquería se dirige a los domicilios de su clientela y a la vez ofrece sus joyas de acero quirúrgico, además realiza empanadas y pan de pascua para la temporada navideña.
La mercadería e insumos que va necesitando los compra en diferentes supermercados, carnicerías, distribuidoras que se especializan en vender productos para el cabello a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará articulos varios para la venta navideña, además frutas, harina, miel, frutos secos y confitados para hacer panes de pascua.
Una de la metas de Johanna es seguir creciendo dia a dia, y vender toda su mercadería para la temporada de navidad, así con esto generar mayores ingresos y buen pasar económico a su familia.
Johanna vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 4 y 13 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal y familiar es volver a construir su hogar después de la perdida que tuvo con el terremoto, y a nivel laboral tener bastante abastecido su negocio para no tener necesidades extremas.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad y apoyo brindado por Fondo Esperanza, además de la gran ayuda tras el terremoto con ayuda material, ahora podrá invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación y responsabilidad. Por otro lado las capacitaciones, le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Valparaíso está situado a 120 kilómetros al noroeste de Santiago. Es la capital regional y además sede del poder legislativo del país. Es el primer puerto de la nación y ofrece gran variedad de lugares hermosos y pintorescos, como por ejemplo la casa del poeta Pablo Neruda, ganador del Premio Nobel.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called, "Unión y Fe" [Union and Faith] and is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who make a living through various trades including: glass art, mosaics, selling dried products, a grocery store, making and selling french fries, selling vegetables, selling beauty products, selling cocktails, selling cakes, recycling shoes, weaving, etc.  All of the members are from Valparaíso.

Johanna is the group member who is standing up in the back row, the first from the right.  She is wearing white pants and shoes and a black shirt.  She has brown hair that is down. She is a hairdresser and sells seasonal products.  She has done this for 10 years.  She tells us that she works Mondays through Sundays.  She visits her customers' homes to do hairdressing while also selling her stainless steel jewelry.  She also makes empanadas and bread for the Christmas season.

She buys the merchandise and supplies that she needs from different supermarkets, butcher shops, and distributors that specialize in selling hair products at a low price since this is what best for her economically.

She will use this loan to buy items to sell for Christmas as well as fruit, flour, honey, dried fruits, and candy to make Christmas bread.  One of Johanna's goals is to keep growing every day and to sell all of her Christmas merchandise.  This is how she will generate better income and have her family do well economically.

Johanna lives with her husband and two children, who are 4 and 13.  Her personal dream and dream for her family is to construct a home after the loss that they had due to the earthquake.  For her business, she wants to keep it well supplied so she doesn't have any extreme needs.

She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity and support offered to her by Fondo Esperanza.  In addition to the great help after the earthquake, she is now able to invest in her business.  She says that there is very good communication and responsibility in her communal bank.  There are also trainings that have helped her learn new sales and accounting strategies.  Valparaíso is 120 kilometers northeast of Santiago.  It is the regional capital and also the legislative seat of the country.  It is the country's main port and offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, for example, the house of the poet Pablo Neruda, the winner of the Nobel prize.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell for Christmas as well as fruits, flour, honey, dried fruits, and candies to make Christmas bread.

loans.name: La Tablita Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario esta compuesto por tres personas, las cuales tienen una vision de crecimiento personal y de alcanzar muchas metas en su vida, creen mucho en si mismos y saben que con trabajo y sacrificio lo van a lograr.
El presidente de este grupo el Sr. Jonathan, un persona que se describe muy trabajadora, reservado, humilde, honrado y con todas las ganas de salir adelante, es por esto que sus companeros lo ven como un digno representante de su tierra y un ejemplo para los ninos que viven junto a el.
El credito solicitado a Fodemi, les va a servir a la compra de madera y de una moladora para la fabricacion de muebles, que es lo que mas esta solicitado en estos momentos, este credito va a ayudar a mejorar sus ingresos y al vez mejora la calidad de vida de su familia y lo mas importante la de sus pequenos hijos.
El sueño de Jonathan es tener un su propio taller de carpinteria, donde pueda fabricar todo tipo de muebles y ser reconocido en toda su ciudad por la calidad de su trabajo, y enseñar este oficio a sus hijos sin descuidar el estudio que es lo que mas quiere Jonathan para sus hijos.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is made up of three people who have a vision of personal growth and of achieving many life goals. They have faith in themselves and know that with work and sacrifice they are going to have success.

The president of this group is Jonathan, a person who is described as hardworking, reserved, humble, honest and above all has the desire to get ahead. This is why his companions see him as a dignified representative of his homeland and an example for the children living with him.

The requested loan through Fodemi will be used to buy wood and a grinder in order to make furniture, which is what is most sought after right now. The loan is going to help to improve earnings which betters the quality of life for his family and what is most important that of the two little children.

Jonathan’s dream is to have his own carpentry workshop where he can make all types of furniture and to be known throughout the city for the quality of his work, and to teach this craft to his children without neglecting their education which is what Jonathan wants most for his children.

loans.use: to buy wood and a grinder, which is needed to be able to make furniture which is what is most sought after right now

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
A master of his own deals, Muhammad, 22 years old, needs your help and support. He is single and lives with his parents. Muhammad has always wanted to provide a good quality of life for his family and so he began his own car repair business 2 years ago. He has own workshop where he works with one helper. Thanks to his good service, Muhammad has managed to gain many customers. Since he’s had his business, his family’s quality of life has been improving and their financial challenges are being solved little by little.

Muhammad is asking for a loan to buy equipment for repairing cars. This will give him the opportunity to provide better service and to increase his income, which will allow Muhammad to provide better financial opportunities for getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy equipment for repairing cars

loans.name: Dzendere

texts.en: Dzendere, 42, lives with her husband and eight children. She has a store at home, selling food items, snacks, cleaning supplies and other items. She also farms. Dzendere needs to restock her store but she does not have enough working capital. She is therefore asking Yehu for a loan to purchase more inventory such as foodstuffs, basic grains, detergents, medicines, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory such as foodstuffs, basic grains, detergents, medicines, etc.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en: Julita is a 51-year-old married woman from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. Julita is engaged in beauty and wellness services in her community, providing manicures, pedicures and foot reflexology to the people in her neighborhood. Julita works hard to support her husband in meeting the family's needs and the children's schooling. Julita is asking for a loan to buy more materials such as nail color, nail polish and other items for manicures and pedicures .

loans.use: to buy more materials for manicures and pedicures

loans.name: Safwan

texts.en:
Safwan is a 28-year-old single man who opened a grocery store in 2005 to make his own living and develop his own business.

Safwan is an energetic person with a good reputation; he has been working hard to improve his business and expand it as much as he can to make sure that his business will last and develop widely.

He applied for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business capital with special winter cereals and hot syrups that are highly requested in his region.

Safwan will also work hard on buying special offer products to make a good profit. He is working hard to open a supermarket in the future and hopes to be capable of starting a wholesale trade in the future.

loans.use: To increase his business capital with special winter cereals and hot syrups.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Sarith

texts.es: Sarith, de 23 años, es una mujer alegre y muy trabajadora. Vive junto a su pareja Jorge, quien es chofer de camiones. Tiene casa propia, imueble que heredó de su mamá, además  tiene 2 hijos y 2 hermanos a quienes educan con responsabilidad y dándoles ejemplo de salir adelante a pesar de la dificultades. El trabajo de Sarith consiste en la venta de mercadearía, específicamente en la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros. Ella realiza sus actividades en su casa duranre las mañanas y por las tardes sale a buscar a sus clientes, entre ellos están sus amigos, vecinos y algunos familiares. Lleva trabajando de esa manera por 4 años, y estando solo ha logrado establecerse en este negocio. Por otro lado, éste tipo de actividad le conviene, proque tiene tiempo para velar por sus hijos, cumplir con los gastos que demanda así como la de sus hermanos. Por eso desea consolidarse y ampliar la cantidad de mercadería que tiene. Por tanto, éste será su  préstamo numero 1 y con el monto que espera, desea invertirlo en la compra de ropa que lo conseguirá en la capital, entre la prendas están: polos, pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc.
texts.en: Sarith is 23 and is a happy and very hard-working woman.  She lives with her husband Jorge, who is a truck driver.  She has her own house, which she inherited from her mother.  She also has two boys and two brothers, whom she educates with responsibility, setting an example of getting ahead despite difficulties.  She sells merchandise, specifically men's and women's clothing.  She does her housework in the mornings, and in the afternoons, she goes out in search of her customers, who are friends, neighbors, and family members.  She has been doing this work for 4 years, and she has managed to stabilize her business.  She likes it because because she has time to care for her children and to pay for their expenses as well as those of her brothers.  She hopes to strengthen her business and to increase the quantity of merchandise that she has.  This is her first loan and with the money she is hoping for, she will invest in the purchase of clothing, which she get in the capital and will include:  polo shirts, pants, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.use: to buy polo shirts, pants, shirts, and blouses.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar tiene un negocio de pulpería venta de granos básicos como: arroz, aceite, azúcar, plátanos, productos lácteos como leche crema, mantequilla, refrescos gaseosas, jugos, gatorade entre otros, ubicado en su casa de habitación.

Antes de tener este negocio Julio era profesor de secundaria se jubilo y con ese dinero que le dieron de liquidación inicio su negocio luego solicito un financiamiento a ceprodel para ingresar más productos a su negocio.

Ahora el señor Julio ha observado que en este municipio no hay lugares que realicen comidas rápidas y a él le nació el deseo de poder tener un carro móvil para hacer comidas rápidas como: hot Dog, Hamburguesas, papas fritas.
Solicito un financiamiento para poder comprar este carro y obtener otros ingresos y así tener mejores condiciones de vida.

Es casado su esposa trabaja actualmente en un centro estatal tiene cuatro hijos tres de ellos mayores de edad tienen su propio trabajo y una menor en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar runs a small grocery store in his home where he sells staple foods such as: rice, oil, sugar, plantains, carbonated drinks, juices, Gatorade, and dairy products like milk, cream, and butter. 

Before he started his business, he was a secondary school teacher. He retired and with the money he received in his settlement, he started a business. Later, he requested a loan from Ceprodel to add more products to his store. 

Currently, Julio has noticed that there are not any places that make quick meals in his town. This inspired him to a dream of having a mobile food-cart to make meals such as: hot dogs, hamburgers, and french fries. 

He is requesting this loan to buy the cart thereby acquiring a source of income and a better quality of life. 

He is married; his wife currently works in a government center. They have four children, three of which are adults and have their own jobs and one who is still in school.

loans.use: to buy a cart to sell ready-made meals.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 25-year-old married man who has been working in printing for 12 years. Youssef was only 13 years old when he started working in order to help his parents make their living.

Youssef has been an Al Majmoua borrower for five consecutive cycles. His first loan helped him buy his partner's share which helped a lot to increase his capital and develop his business. Youssef is now applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua which will be invested in buying necessary cardboard and materials for his business development. He hopes to keep on improving and expanding his business in the future by increasing his employees from the current three to meet the extra requests he receives.

loans.use: to buy cardboard and materials necessary for his printing business.

loans.name: Altantulga

texts.en:
Altantulga, 43 years old, lives with his wife and 3 children in a house in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. His wife, Buyanhishig, 41, helps him with his retail shoe business. Altantulga's sons, Zolboohuu and Zoljargal, are university students and his daughter, Anhjargal, is a secondary school student.

Altantulga has been operating a retail shoe business at a rental counter in the local market since 2006. He has built close relationships with customers and has gained their trust. Altantulga is a friendly, welcoming and open-minded person who says, "I want to pay my sons' tuition fees". He is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to pay his sons' tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay his sons' tuition fees

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Rovshan, 33 years old, lives with his wife and little son. He raises dairy cows and has eleven years of experience in this field. Rovshan also uses his own car as a taxi service. He has applied for a loan to have a bathroom added to his house. This will provide improved comfort for his growing family.

loans.use: To have a bathroom added to his house.

loans.name: Haluma

texts.en:
Haluma, age 24, is a married mother. She lives with her family in the town of Kaloleni. Haluma is an enterprising woman with a great desire to keep working. Four years ago, she decided to open her own business, operating a small retail shop from her home.

Haluma is requesting her first loan of 30,000 KES. She will use it to buy more inventory such as flour, cooking fat, detergents, basic grains, etc, in order to increase her inventory and fill her customers' needs. Haluma's goal is to grow her business into greater heights.

loans.use: to buy more inventory such as flour, cooking fat, detergents, basic grains, etc.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is a 27-year-old single man who works in the construction business and specializes in decoration work (Gibson boards). Rabih is one of the Syrians who came to work in Lebanon in order to improve their living because of the lack of working opportunities available.

Rabih is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to renew his working tools because it is very necessary to keep them in very good condition to make sure that his work is accurate and perfectly done.

This is his first experience as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he hopes that the future experiences will be invested in increasing his tools and expanding his working zone through recruiting someone to help him reply to extra projects in the future.

loans.use: To renew his tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for workers to harvest his coffee.

loans.name: Betania Del Carmen

texts.es:
La actividad comercial de la Señora  Betania es de servicio, tiene un molino donde procesa el maíz para elaborar tortillas, nacatamales, cosas de horno(Rosquillas), todos estos productos fabricados del maíz y  popular en la comida de los nicaragüenses.
