Además tiene un camión donde vende materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, piedra y cemento, en donde obtiene otros ingresos para su economía familiar.

Ella vive en casa de su mama, sin embargo en vista que ya contrajo matrimonio y ha planificado independizarse, se ha proyectado junto con su esposo construir su propia vivienda para ofrecerle a su bebe su propio espacio familiar.

El crédito que solicita es para compra de materiales de construcción, para hacer realidad el sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Betania works in the service sector. She has a mill where she processes maize to make tortillas, nacatamales, and baked goods. All of these maize-made products are popular foods in Nicaragua. 

In addition, she has a truck with which she sells construction materials such as cement blocks, sand, aggregate, and cement. Through this job she earns other money for her family's finances. 

She lives in her mother's house, however, bearing in mind she was recently married, she plans to become independent. She and her husband have planned together to build their own home in order to give their baby its own room. 

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy construction materials so she can realize her dream of owning her own house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as sand, cement, iron, and gravel.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms. Rehana is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has been in the business of milk sales for eight years. She started this business with the motive of supporting her family. She is a very hardworking lady. Her husband has a donkey cart and also helps her sell milk door-to-door in her community. Her two children are studying in school. She wants to give them a quality education.

After starting her business, Ms. Rehana felt the need for some investment and contacted Kashf Foundation. She has been associated with Kashf Foundation for six years. She applied for a loan of 25,000 Pakistani rupees to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales. She is hoping to get an increase in her net income and wants to spend part of her profits on the improvement of her house.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her milk sales.

loans.name: Kurbonkhol

texts.en: Kurbonkhol is a widow who has 5 children. She has always wanted to provide them with a good education and, since her husband died, she became the sole breadwinner in the family. Kurbonkhol decided to start a new animal husbandry business in order to generate an income to contribute to her household’s finances.  Kurbonkhol took a course called ‘To get ahead’ from a women's organization, learning many business skills.  Her children will help her with the business. Kurbonkhol will be a very successful businesswoman as she is hardworking and smart. She is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy cattle to start her new business. She will get through, using the loan, and her business will become a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. Kurbonkhol awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy cattle to start her new business

loans.name: Nita

texts.es:
Nita, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer que le gusta el trabajo, también es amable y cordial en su trato con las personas. Es conviviente con Segundo quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es padre de sus 3 hijos. Vive cómodamente instalada en su propia casa en compañía de uno de sus hijos y pareja a quien quiere mucho. La actividad que realiza Nita en la venta de productos de belleza como esmaltes, cremas, labiales y otros.  Todos estos productos son adquiridos por catálogo y vendidos entre sus amistades, familiares, brindándoles una buena atención, luego ellos la recomiendan con otras personas que se vuelven en sus clientes habituales.
Se inició hace más de 10 años con un capital propio  vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades y luego fue creciendo poco a poco, hasta el momento lo viene realizando sola. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las ganancias que le deja, ya que es muy visitada por sus fieles clientes.
Se decidió en empezar con su negocio por el deseo de contar con una ocupación y un oficio para generarse sus propios ingresos y no depender totalmente de su pareja, además de querer ser una prospera empresaria.
Por tanto ahora viendo los buenos resultados, desea continuar con su negocio y aumentar su stock de mercaderías. Este será el préstamo número 18 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para concretar sus planes. Además comenta sentirse bien con banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 500 nuevos soles, los invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza para aumentar su stock  viendo crecer su negocio, esperando así aumentar su capital y tener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Nita, 33 years old, is a woman that likes to work. She is also friendly and cordial in her dealings with people. She lives with Segundo who works in construction and is the father of her three children. She lives comfortably in her own home with one of her children and her partner whom she loves a lot.

Nita sells beauty products such as fingernail polishes, creams, lipsticks and other items. All these products are purchased through catalogs and sold among her friends and family, giving them special attention, and so they then later recommend her to other people who become her regular clients.

She began more than ten years with her own capital selling in small quantities and later she grew little by little, and up until now she has been making it on her own. She considers her business profitable enough for the earnings it gives her and she is very popular with her loyal clients. She decided to begin her business by the desire to have an occupation and a profession to earn her own income and not depend totally on her partner, besides wanting to be a successful businesswoman.

So now that she is seeing good results, she wants to continue with her business and increase her stock of merchandise. This will be her 18th loan through MFP and she feels grateful knowing she has financial support to reach her goals.

She also comments that she is happy with the communal bank considering it a united and supportive group. With the requested amount of 500 soles she will invest in the purchase of beauty products to increase her stock to expand her business hoping to thus increase her capital and have higher profits.

loans.use: to buy a variety of cosmetics such as fingernail polishes, creams, and lipsticks which she sells through catalogs

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco, de 56 años, es un hombre bueno, amable y muy responsable, convive junto a su pareja y tiene 3 hijos, vive en su casa propia con su cónyuge y con una nieta de 17 años quienes son su principal motivo para salir adelante ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad e independientes. Él se dedica en el transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, trabaja dentro y fuera de la ciudad dependiendo del lugar hasta donde quieren dirigirse sus eventuales clientes. Lleva realizando este trabajo ya por 9 años. Cuando empezó a trabajar con su mototaxi le costó mucho esfuerzo pues no se acostumbraba a realizar esta actividad y adquirió algunas molestias renales, pero al pasar el tiempo ha ido acomodándose a ese ritmo de trabajo y ahora es todo un experto. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que le permite manejar su propio horario y descansar cuando siente necesita hacerlo, además su vehículo le sirve también como medio de transporte para su familia, no siente ninguna presión para poder realizar su trabajo, le va muy bien gracias a que su flota de mototaxis está creciendo y ahora tiene un vehículo más. Este es el préstamo número 13 con MFP, se siente contento y agradecido por el apoyo financiero que le brindan para continuar con su negocio, además se siente a gusto con el asesor de crédito y con los miembros de su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos y los considera personas responsables. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará piezas para el arreglo otro mototaxi, además pagará al mecánico que realizará tal servicio, también adquirirá su tarjeta de circulación para que pueda seguir trabajando con tranquilidad.
texts.en:
Francisco, 56, is a good, friendly, and responsible man. He lives with his wife they 3 children. In addition to his wife, he also lives with his granddaughter, 17. The two of them are his main reason for moving forward since his sons are independent adults. 

He makes his living transporting passengers with his mototaxi. He works in and around the city depending on the destination of his clients. He has been in this type of work for 9 years. When he began work with his mototaxi, it took a lot of effort. He was not accustomed to this kind of work and suffered from kidney problems, but over the years he has acclimated to the rhythm of this kind of work and now he is an expert. What he likes about this kind of work is it allows him to create his own schedule and to rest when he feels the need. 

The mototaxi also serves as a mode of transport for his family. He does not feel any pressure while working. It is going very well for him thanks to his increasing fleet of mototaxi; he now has one more. 

This is Francisco's 13th loan with MFP. He is happy and appreciates the financial support that it offers to continue his business. He also feels comfortable with the loan consultant and the other members of the communal bank. He knows that the majority of its members are his neighbors and considers them responsible. 

With the 1500 soles he is requesting, he will buy parts to fix his other mototaxi, as well as pay the mechanic to complete the repairs. He will also obtain his registration so he can continue working without any concerns.

loans.use: to buy parts for his motorcycle so he can repair it at the mechanic's shop and update his registration.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther, de 28 años, es una mujer joven, soñadora y muy amable, convive con su pareja con quien tiene dos hijos de 9 y 5 años. Ella tiene una casa propia en donde vive a lado de sus dos hijos y su pareja con quien trabaja mucho para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. El trabajo de Esther consiste en la venta de sandalias, zapatos, zapatillas y más. Ofrece todo tipo de calzados de los más variados colores, tallas y modelos para damas, caballeros y niños. Trabaja en forma ambulante en un mercado cerca de su casa, tiene además un puesto en donde atiende su pareja en algunas ocasiones, mientras ella sale a ofrecer su mercadería entre sus amigos, vecinos o clientes que ha logrado consolidar durante los años que lleva realizando este trabajo. Lleva en este negocio más de 7 años y por fortuna le va muy bien. Se siente muy a gusto haciendo su trabajo ya que su esfuerzo se retribuye con los buenos ingresos que recibe, pero ella necesita de alguna ayuda adicional ya que quiere incrementar sus productos debido a la temporada navideña que ya se aproxima, su principal objetivo es que su negocio prospere tanto en infraestructura como en cantidad de mercadería para que pueda ofrece mayor variedad de artículos a sus clientes. Este es el crédito numero 3 con MFP, por ello se siente agradecida con las personas que le brindan el financiamiento que necesita para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de manera puntual y espera continuar trabajando con su banco comunal por el compañerismo y la solidaridad que muestran entre ellos cada uno de sus integrantes.
Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería conformada sandalias y zapatos.
texts.en:
Esther, 28, is a young woman who is a dreamer and very friendly. She lives with her partner and has two children of 9 and 5 years. She has her own house where she lives with her two children and her partner, with whom she works to provide her children with a better quality of life. Esther's work consists of selling sandals, shoes, slippers, and more. She offers every type of footwear in many colors, sizes, and models for women, men, and children. She works as a traveling salesperson in a market near her house, and also has a stand that her partner attends to while she goes out to offer her merchandise. Between their friends, neighbors, and clients, she has managed to consolidate the business during the years she's worked. She has managed this business for more than seven years, and luckily it is going very well. She enjoys doing her work now that her effort has been rewarded with the good income she receives. Now she needs some additional help because she wants to increase products for the approaching Christmas season. Her biggest objective is that her businesses prospers in both the infrastructure and the quantity of merchandise so she can offer a wide variety of articles to her clients. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very grateful to the people who provide the financing she needs to make her plans concrete. On her side, she commits to complete the quota payments punctually and hopes to continue working with her communal bank for the friendship and solidarity she finds between every one of its participants.

With the 1500 soles she is requesting, she will buy a large quantity of comfortable sandals and shoes as merchandise.

loans.use: to buy sandals and shoes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase water tanks for irrigation.

loans.name: San  Roque Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN ROQUE”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Silvia Virginia ella es conviviente y tiene 35 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de panadería, la socia prepara diferentes panes y pasteles y luego lo distribuye a als diferentes pastelerías, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene en este negocio 7 años y le va muy bien, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de panadería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos para preparar panes como harina, mantequilla y huevos.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de artesanía y negocio de venta de animales.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partners belong to the communal bank "SAN ROQUE." This bank is located in the Cusco district of the Cusco providence, which is located in the Cusco department.

One partner is Silvia Virgina, who is 35 years old with two children. The partner works in her baking business, preparing different breads and cakes that she later distributes to various cake shops. She works from 8:00 am until 5:00 PM. She has worked in this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her. The business has moved her children ahead and her ahead. Her dream is to expand the baking business. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients to make bread, such as flour, butter, and eggs. The other partners dedicate themselves to the businesses of animal care, selling food, artensanry, and selling animals.

The partner is grateful to those who take part in this dream through these means and commits herself to completing her quota payments in the established time span.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread, such as flour, butter, and eggs.

loans.name: Gabriel Orlando

texts.es:
El Señor Gabriel tiene su actividad comercial que consiste en venta de productos agrícolas como semilla de hortalizas y granos básico para siembra e insumos para la preparación de la tierra y de la planta para que de buen fruto.

También vende comida balanceada para gallina de engorde, cerdo, perro y gato.

Inicio con este negocio una vez que se preparo como veterinario decidió poner su propio negocio en su casa de habitación después uno de sus hijos estudio veterinaria entonces el señor Gabriel decidió dejarle el negocio de su casa a su hijo y él lo estableció en el mercado municipal. 

El dinero lo solicita para compra de productos de veterinaria; como  alimento balanceado y medicamento para veterinaria.

Se siente muy bien trabajar con Ceprodel porque gracias a ellos ha crecido su negocio y su calidad de vida, a recibidos más ganancias su negocio esta mas grande con diferentes productos.
texts.en:
Gabriel works in commerce selling agricultural products like plant seeds and basic grains to grow as well as materials to prepare fruitful land and plants.

He also sells animal food for chicken fattening, as well as for pigs, dogs, and cats.

He is asking for this money to buy veterinary products like animal food and veterinary medicine.

He feels good working with Ceprodel because, thanks to them, his business and quality of life have improved. He has received more earnings and his business is bigger and has different products.

loans.use: to buy animal food and veterinary medicine.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta y elaboracion de panes,la socia los panes lo vende en la plaza de armes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.mla socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es tener un local para vender panes.La solicita el credito para comprar insumos para preparar pan como harina,mantequilla y azucar.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nelly continues making a living making and selling bread.  She sells her bread in the town square.  She works from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m., and has been in the business for six years.  Her dream is to have a place to sell bread.

She's requesting the loan to buy supplies to make bread, such as flour, butter, and sugar.

She's happy about the loan and pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, sugar, and ingredients to make bread

loans.name: Jessenia

texts.es:
Jessenia, de 23 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante, además es amable y sociable. Convive con Bill quien es empleado y padre de su único hijo. Juntos habitan cómodamente en la casa de su cuñada. La actividad que realiza Jessenia es la venta de bebidas gasificadas de varios sabores y diferentes marcas. Dicha venta lo realiza desde  su casa donde tiene una refrigeradora para guardar sus bebidas a temperatura helada al gusto de sus clientes y esto debido a la zona calurosa que se encuetra. 
Se inició hace más de 18 meses contando con un capital propio, comprando y vendiendo en pequeñas cantidades, luego fue aumentando sus compras conforme aumentaba la demanda, y hasta el momento su negocio se esta consolidando. Ella cometna que decidió por este negocio para darle utilidad a su refrigeradora, pues como madre ve las necesidades que tiene su hijo, y su pareja solo no se daba abasto. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 05 con la institución MFP. Está contenta y agradecida de saber que contará con un apoyo financiero para continuar con sus planes. Además se siente cómoda y le gusta el trabajo de su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de bebidas gasificadas en diversos sabores y marcas, y en mayor cantidad para tener un stock disponible para la venta, buscando precios bajos por sus compras, de esa manera obtendrá mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Jessenia, 23 years old, is a hard-working and determined woman who is eager to get ahead.  She is also friendly and sociable.  She lives together with Bill who is employed and is the father of her only child.  Together they live comfortably in the house of her sister-in-law.  Jessenia’s business is the sale of carbonated drinks of various flavors and different brands.  She makes these sales from her house where she has a refrigerator to keep her drinks at an icy temperature at the liking of her customers.  This is due to the warm area where she lives.

She started the business more than 18 months ago with her own capital, buying and selling in small quantities, then increasing her purchases as demand increased and so far her business has been strengthening.  She says that she decided on this business to make use of her refrigerator, as a mother she sees the needs that her child has and her partner alone can’t keep up.  Therefore this will be her fifth loan with the institution MFP.  She is happy and grateful to know that she will have financial support to continue with her plans.  She also feels comfortable with and likes the work of her communal bank as she knows the members and considers them to be responsible people.

With the requested total of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN), she will invest in the purchase of carbonated drinks in different flavors and brands and in greater quantity to have stock available for sale, looking for low prices for her purchases.  That way she will obtain higher profits.

loans.use: to buy carbonated drinks.

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Maribel ella es soltera y tiene 28 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de ferretería, la socia vende clavos, pinturas y herramientas, la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años y le va muy bien, en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta llevar al parque a jugar a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ferretería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería como clavos, pinturas y herramientas para su ferretería.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de cafetín, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de internet y negocio de venta de golosinas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Fuerza 2008", which is located in the district of Cusco, in the province and department of Cusco. 

Ruth Maribel is one of the members. She is single, 28 years old, and has one child. She has a hardware business, where she sells nails, paint, and tools. She works from 9:00am until 6:00pm. She has had the business for eight years and it is going very well. In her free time, she likes to take her child to the park to play. Her dream is to expand her hardware business. She is requesting the loan so she can buy merchandise for her hardware store, such as nails, paint, and tools. 

The other members make a living from a café business, a food-selling business, an Internet business, and a candy-selling business.

Ruth Maribel is grateful to those who are part of her dream through this site, and she is committed to making her loan repayments within the set period.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her hardware store, such as nails, paint, and tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry birds.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is a 37-year-old married woman. She has been providing laundry services at her home for 10 years. She is known in her community for providing quality services to her customers. She makes enough to lead a decent life. She is a responsible mother of  two daughters and three sons.Three children go to school. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing and health care. Her husband is employed in a small factory and his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. To help her run her operations, she requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to purchase packs of detergents, bleach and packing bags, etc. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers consistently. She expects a boost in her net income and wishes to expand her business for more earnings.

loans.use: to purchase packs of detergents, bleach and packing bags.

loans.name: Esperanza Divina Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESPERANZA DIVINA”  iniciará el ciclo primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal Juan Pablo II, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de peluches, repostería de queque, confección de ropa deportiva, venta de comida, costura de chamarras, venta de chompas.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una promotora de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de masitas; cuenta que este negocio lo emprendió hace años con la ayuda de su cuñada, la que le enseñó la técnica, posteriormente emprendió su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cremas pasteleras) que adquirirá de las tiendas de venta por mayor y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones de las asesoras de crédito.
texts.en:
The communal association "ESPERANZA DIVINA" (Divine Hope) will begin its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the focal point in Juan Pablo II. It is composed of 6 partners and is led by a directive board with Carmen as the president. The workers in the communal association have businesses which move them forward. There are a variety of businesses, including selling plush toys, making cakes, making sportswear, selling food, sewing jackets, and selling sweaters.

The loan they are taking out will benefit the small microfinances where Carmen works. She states that for a year she has been a part of Pro Mujer, entering through the invitation of a promoter in the institution. Now she has a business selling small cakes. She began this business years ago with the help of sister-in-law, who taught her the techniques, after which she began her own business.

The loan which she will receive is to increase capital (the purchase of icing) which she will acquire from bulk stores and later sell from her stand. This form of work permits her to generate income to support her home because she lives in a civil union with three children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says she likes the training by credit advisers.

loans.use: to buy icing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Hadjah

texts.en: Hadjah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, two in school. She has one additional family member (grandmother). She is a tailor who operates her business from a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy more rolls of clothing materials (African attire) and materials for making new clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. She generates additional income through selling firewood. Her goals and aspirations are to buy an electric sewing machine and also build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Yina Mercedes

texts.es: La Sra. Yina  tiene 20 años, ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace ya dos años en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la localidad de Puerto Rico, empezó a trabajar con su mama desde muy pequeña, este préstamo es su tercera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Yina va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, que le hace mucha falta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene que movilizarse de manera rápida a comprar sus insumos que algunas veces le hace falta y tiene que recorrer una distancia larga  como es del área rural las distancias entre localidades son muy largas y el camino no está en buenas condiciones para que entren movilidades por lo que una  motocicleta es de muy buena utilidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, la Sra. Yina  es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: Yina is 20 years old and has dedicated herself to the sale of food for the past two years in her stand in Puerto Rico, Bolivia. She began to work with her mother when she was little. This loan is her third in sequence from the institution. Yina is going to use this loan to buy a motorcycle, which she needs to do her work efficiently by moving rapidly to buy ingredients that she sometimes needs. She needs to run a long distances because she lives in a rural zone and the distance between locations is very large. The path is not in good condition so a motorcycle is very useful. She asks for this loan to continue improving her work. Yina is a hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity to be granted a loan given that this is her only activity which permits her to support herself.

loans.use: for the purchase of a car

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, de 65 años, es una buena mujer, amable y muy luchadora, es madre soltera de seis hijos quienes son independientes, tiene una casa propia en donde vive sola desde hace mucho tiempo, gracias a su trabajo pudo educar y alimentar a sus hijos quienes ahora ya son mayores  de edad y aportan con algunos gastos que ella necesita, pero aun así ella trabaja mucho para poder solventarse. El trabajo de Juana consiste principalmente en la venta de abarrotes, realiza las compras al por mayor y se encarga de vender al menudeo, de este negocio obtiene buenas ganancias que superan su inversión inicial. Atiende en su casa y trabaja en esta actividad por más de 10 años. Eventualmente genera sus ingresos trabajando como costurera ya sea reparando prendas de vestir o creando sus propios diseños, por otra parte también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos los cuales vende cuando ya tienen el peso ideal. En cuanto a la venta de abarrotes, le gusta este trabajo porque le permite estar en contacto con sus clientes y la tranquilidad con la que ejecuta esta función le permite distribuir su tiempo para realizar todas las demás actividades laborales que le permiten mantener su economía, espera seguir manteniendo de la misma forma su creciente trabajo e incrementar su espacio laboral. Este es el préstamo número 10 con MFP, está muy agradecida por la oportunidad crediticia que le brindan y por el respaldo financiero que necesita para seguir adelante. Se compromete a pagar sus cuotas mensuales de manera puntual y continuar trabajando con mucha responsabilidad junto a los miembros de su banco comunal. 
Con el monto solicitado 1,500 soles, comprará mercaderías para su tienda de abarrotes, además comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales y algunas vacunas y vitaminas que aplica a sus animales.
texts.en:
Juana is 65 years old. She is a good woman who is kind and determined. She is a single mother of six children who live independently of her. She has her own house where she has lived alone for a long time. Thanks to her work, she was able to educate and feed her children. Her children are now of legal age and help her with some of her expenses, but she still works a lot in order to pay her expenses. Juana's work mainly consists of selling groceries; she purchases wholesale and then sells at retail prices. She obtains good profits that surpass her original investment. The business is located in her house and she has been running it for more than ten years. Occasionally she generates income by working as a seamstress - repairing garments or creating her own designs. She also makes a living by breeding pigs and selling them when they reach the ideal weight.

She likes her grocery business because it allows her to be in contact with her customers and distribute her time so she can do all the other work that is necessary for maintaining her finances. She hopes to continue with her growing business in this way and expand her workspace.

This is her tenth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. She is very grateful for the opportunity they have given her and for the financial support, which she needs to get ahead. She is committed to making her monthly repayments on time and continuing to work responsibly alongside the members of her communal bank. With the requested amount of 1500 PEN, she will buy merchandise for her grocery store, in addition to balanced food, vaccines, and vitamins for her animals.

loans.use: to buy basic products for stocking her store, as well as balanced food and vitamins for her pigs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Hiladion

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SRDE LOS TEMBLORES III,el socio continua con su negocio de compra y venta de artesania como chompas,chalecos,chalinas,guantes,chuyos entre otros,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio ,esta mercaderia lo envia a su hermana quien lo vende a los turistas en Machupicchu,el socio a la vez continua trabajando en el area de logistica para una empresa estatal,siendo de esta forma que el socio sale adelante.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de chompas de alpaca para su negocio.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Hiladion belongs to the communal bank SR DE LOS TEMBLORES III. He still has his business buying and selling artisan crafts, like sweaters, jackets, scarves, gloves, and hats among other things. He has been in this business for awhile, and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into it every day. He sends this merchandise to his sister, who sells it to tourists in Machupicchu. At the same time, he works in logistics for a state business, and this is how he moves forward. He is applying for the loan to buy sweaters for his business. He is grateful for the loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy alpaca sweaters for his business

loans.name: Mirzovali

texts.ru: Мирзовали житель города Вахдат. Ему 36 лет. Он женат. У него трое детей. Мирзовали работает на рынке. Он арендует торговую точку, где продает DVD и MP3 диски. Торговлей Мирзовали занимается три года. Он берет кредит для приобретения новых DVD дисков с новинками фильмов.
texts.en: Mirzovali lives in Vahdat. He is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children. He works at the market where he rents retail space. He sells DVDs and MP3s. He has been working in retail for three years. Mirzovali is seeking a loan to buy DVDs with new movies.

loans.use: to buy new DVDs to sell

loans.name: Phineas

texts.en:
Phineas is a 22-year-old  farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for the past four years, producing beans, milk, peas and tea, which he sells to the people in his local area.

He is requesting a 40,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase materials for constructing a zero-grazing unit, which will help his dairy cows produce more milk and give him more income to be able to uplift his living standards. He plans to have increased his dairy cattle to four in number in the next five years.

The high cost of feeds is his major challenge in farming.

loans.use: To construct a zero-grazing unit to help his cows produce more milk.

loans.name: Rana

texts.en:
Rana is a 25-year-old single woman who has been working in a sweets shop since July 2008 to cover her education expenses and cover most of her needs.

Rana is a hard worker and a smart woman. She is working hard to finish her education and start working in her requested domain. She is applying for an educational loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua in order to pay her university tuition fees.

Rana hopes to open her own business in the future to make all her dreams come true and help her parents with their living expenses.

loans.use: To pay for her university tuition fees.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Ms. Zarina is a 42-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store in her community for the last three years. She offers various items and goods of daily use. She has good communication skills and has a good client list. 

Her husband is a laborer and earns insufficient income to support his family alone. She is a mother of five children. She is motivated to provide for her family. She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 20,000 PKR (Pakistan rupees) to buy a sack of rice, flour and other grocery items to meet the increasing demand at her store. She wishes to spend part of the revenues to deal with the expenses of her children’s education and to increase her business capital.

loans.use: To buy a sack of rice, flour and other grocery items.

loans.name: Albert

texts.en:
Albert is a 25-year-old farmer in Nkubu county in Kenya, where he has been practicing mixed farming for the past four years, producing peas, vegetables and milk, which he sells at the local market in his area.

He is requesting a 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase water pipes for irrigation that will help him better his production, and bring in more income which will help him in the future to uplift his living standards. He plans to have increased his farm by one acre in the next five years.

Inadequate rainfall is his major challenge in farming. Albert is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for giving him the loan.

loans.use: To purchase water pipes for irrigation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an electric shaver and detergents.

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
One of the greatest dreams of Dama is the desire to get ahead. She lives with her family in the town of Kaloleni. She operates a food stall where she sells foods and beverages. She is well-known in the business community in her hometown. She has many customers who like her food for the quality, for the delicious side dishes and, above all, for the great service. 

She is an active, enterprising woman who is dedicated to her business. She has a goal to succeed. She is working hard in order to have a prosperous future. She is happy with her business but realizes she needs to expand it in order to get out of poverty. In the last few weeks, she has had more customers. She would like to buy more supplies in order to make more prepared dishes. This is why she is asking for this loan. It will be used to buy basic grains, vegetables, meats, condiments, etc.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, vegetables, meats, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Doña Elizabeth es una persona trabajadora, amable y solidaria, valores que los inculco su madre y hoy ella hace lo mismo con sus pequeños hijos, Elizabeth cuenta con un pequeño taller de confeccion de camisetas el cual tiene hace algun tiempo, desidio emprender este negocio despues de ser despedida de una empresa, es ahi cuando comienza su emprendimeinto de ser una microempresaria y ser ella su propia jefe.
El credito solicitado a Fodemi servira para poder comprar mas cantidad de tela ( x rollos), ya que se acerca la temporada de navidad y para ella es una buena oportunidad de ganar mas clientes y de promocionar sus diseños de camisetas en toda la ciudad.
El sueño que la Sra. Elizabeth es el tener un gran taller de diseño y confeccion de ropa casual y deportiva y por medio de este generar trabajo para las personas de su barrio que lo necesitan, y ayudar economicamente en su hogar. logrando mejorar su calidad de vida y brindarles una buena educacion a sus dos pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking, friendly, and supportive person. Her values were instilled by her mother and today she does the same with her little children. She has a small shirt-sewing workshop which she has had for some time. She decided to start this business after being laid off by a business and that was when she began to be a micro-entrepreneur and became her own boss.

The loan she is asking for from Fodemi will allow her to buy a larger quantity of cloth (in rolls) now that the Christmas season is approaching. For her, this is a good opportunity to gain more clients and promote her shirt designs to the entire town.

Elizabeth's dream is to have a large designing and tailoring workshop for casual and athletic clothing so she could provide work for the people in her neighborhood who need it, as well as help her home economically. She also dreams of improving her quality of life and providing her two little children with a good education.

loans.use: to increase raw material, cloth for design and tailoring of casual and athletic shirts.

loans.name: Baldansuren

texts.en: Mr. Baldansuren is 52 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Bayanhoshuu district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife is retired and stays home taking care of him and his daughter. His daughter Otgonbileg, age 17 is a university student. Baldansuren has been running a business as a public transportation service provider since 2006. He is a very experienced driver. His income from the public transportation business is the only source of his family income. He spends his income to cover his daughter's tuition and other school related expenses and other family expenses too. His car needs some repairs to keep his business alive. So he is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to purchase spare parts and fix his minivan to run his business normally. He is an optimistic and hardworking man.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and fix his minivan to run his business normally

loans.name: Araza Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “ARAZA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urcos, perteneciente a la provincia de Urcos y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Brigida ella es conviviente y tiene 29 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de crianza de animales, la socia cría animales como pollos y chanchos, la socia los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes mercados y también lleva a diferentes lugares como Puerto Maldonado, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este negocio 5 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos y chanchos.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de tejidos de chompas, negocio de restaurant y negocio de venta de fruta.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The people pictured above are all member of the communal bank ARAZA. This bank is located in the Urcos district, in Urcos province, Cusco department.

Brigida, 29, lives with her partner and has five children. She works raising animals like chickens and pigs. She fattens them up and then sells them in different markets. She also takes them to different places like Puerto Maldonado. She works from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm. She has been working in this business for five years and it's going very well for here. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell the animals. She is applying for the loan to buy chickens and pigs. The other members have businesses selling animals, business with fabric for sweaters, a restaurant business, and a business selling fruit. Brigida is thankful for those who are contributing to her dream in this way and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase cloth and a sewing machine

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 34 years old, married and blessed with three children ages eight, five and two years old. She practices horticulture on their farm and has been in operation for a period of five years, earning an income of KES 40,000 monthly. 

She is receiving her first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD and wishes to use this amount to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.  The anticipated amount will be used to educate her school-aged children. She wishes to prosper.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seeds and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with six children and all of her children go to school. She has one additional family member (mother). She sells charcoal and green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She gets additional income from rental houses. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy bags of charcoal and green bananas. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to educate her children to a university level and also to build more rental houses. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal and bunches of green bananas to sell at the local market.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice, 31, lives in the town of Kloleni, with her three children. She is a divorced woman who is focused. A year and a half ago she started her own fast-food business aiming at earning income to support the family. The business is located in a busy trading center.

She is asking for her first loan for 20,000 KES to buy ingredients like beans, flour, vegetables, salt and others to make fast food with. This loan will help her capitalize and get the business going. Her goal is to increase sales and income to be able to help pay for her children’s schooling and to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like beans, flour, vegetables, salt and others to make fast food with.

loans.name: Zaibun

texts.en:
Ms. Zaibun is a 40-year-old married woman and mother of three. For many years, she has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was the only bread winner for her family. With the passage of time, her sales have increased and her income has also. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and has applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: To purchase another buffalo to expand her milk selling business.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children and three of her children go to school. She has two additional family members (cousin and sister). She sells vegetables and fruits at the market. She sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works six days a week.  

She has requested a loan of 500,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy watermelon, pineapples, passion fruit and cabbages. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a plot of land and also to open another branch selling fruit and vegetables in the same market. She lives in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy more watermelon, pineapples, passion fruit and cabbages to sell at the market.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Antequera, Bohol. Her husband works as a driver and laborer.
Cynthia works as a teacher in a day care center and at the same time she is engaged in a snack food vending business and a basket weaving venture. She is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, milk and materials for basket weaving.

In the future, Cynthia aims to make her business a success and save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and materials for basket weaving

loans.name: Nanah

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Naneh from Kandeh town Bo, in the southern area of Sierra Leone. She is widowed with 5 children between the ages of 15 and 29 years old.

To earn a living, she operates a food stand business, where she sells. She has been operating this business for the past 10 years. She works at the business every day, even at night -- when customers come to buy she will sell. She has also received income from her elder children. Her major challenge to her business is a transportation problem.

Naneh has requested a loan in order to buy similar goods like cooking oil, onions, peppers and fish for re-sale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and improve her standard of living. In the future, she plans to build a house. She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to buy similar goods like cooking oil, onions, peppers and fish for re-sale.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a 29-year-old single mother of two children. They are aged 3 and 7, and are currently in school. They live in Sinkor. Rose has been working very hard in managing her business in order to meet with the expenses of her children. For the past four years she has been selling imported children's and ladies' slippers in the open-square market. A difficulty she is faced with is low sales during the rainy season. She likes this kind of business because she makes a profit, and using that profit she buys more goods in order to increase her sales. She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers for her business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase children's and ladies' slippers for her resale business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, all of whom go to school. She has no additional family members. She sells Irish potatoes. She also gets an additional income from selling fruits at the market. She has been in this business for the past 6 years. She works six days a week. She has requested for a loan of Uganda Shillings 400,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of Irish potatoes to sell. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a delivery van to ease the transportation of the Irish potatoes, to buy a plot of land, and build a house. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and food.

loans.use: to buy more bags of Irish potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Tuvshinbayar

texts.en: Tuvshinbayar is 23 years old. He lives with his mother and two younger brothers in their wooden house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital. His brothers are students. For the last 5 years Tuvshinbayar has been managing a food store with his mother. Tuvshinbayar says he works hard and to show his devotion to his brothers he wants to be like a father to them. Tuvshinbayar has never studied at university. Despite not having a chance to study and improve his skills, Tuvshinbayar is a naturally talented artist. Besides managing their store, Tuvshinbayar creates paintings on cars. Before the winter, Tuvshinbayar wants to install an electric floor heating system in the house to replace the coal burning furnace, in order to cut the usage of coal which releases harmful chemicals into the atmosphere.

loans.use: to install an electric floor heating system.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es: El Sr. Elmer  tiene 34 años casado con dos hijos que tienen las edades de 5 y 6 años,  el tiene la actividad de soldador trabaja en un taller de la localidad de Junta Pirai,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Elmer va a utilizar este préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta, que le hace mucha falta ya que esto le permitirá realizar su trabajo de manera eficiente ya que tiene contratos que cumplir, y esto le permitirá movilizarse de manera rápida de su casa a su trabajo como también cuando realiza trabajos a domicilio ya que son distancias largas que tiene que recorrer,  como es del área rural las distancias entre localidades son muy largas y el camino no está en buenas condiciones para que entren movilidades por lo que una  motocicleta es de muy buena utilidad, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en trabajo, el  Sr. Elmer es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada  en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es su única  actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en:
Elmer, 34, is married with two children aged 5 and 6. He is a welder and works in a workshop in the town of Junta Pirai. This is his first cycle with the institution.

Elmer will use this loan to purchase a motorcycle, which he needs to be able to carry out his work efficiently and fulfill his contracts. The motorcycle will enable him to travel quickly between his home and his work, as he has a long distance to cover each day. He works in a rural area and the roads are in a poor condition for vehicles, therefore a motorcycle will be very useful. 

Elmer is applying for this loan to continue to improve in his work. He is a very hardworking person and is grateful for the opportunity to take a loan, as his job is his only livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to help travel to his work

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children, and she has one additional family member (her mother). All three of Sarah's children go to school. 

Sarah sells second-hand shoes at the market. She works six days a week and has been in business for the past six years. Sarah has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 300,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second-hand shoes. 

Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to open up another stall in a different market. She lives in her own house, and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy a bale of second-hand shoes.

loans.name: Tasleem

texts.en:
Tasleem is a 26-year-old married woman and a mother of two. She runs a small general store in her community with the support of her husband. The man shown in the photo is Tasleem’s husband. She offers various goods for daily use at reasonable prices. Her husband assists her by purchasing goods from the market at wholesale rates. They have attained regular customers who prefer to shop at their store on a daily basis. 

Tasleem is motivated to provide her children with the basic necessities of life. She wants to grow her business as she requested a loan of PKR 25000 to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.  She then would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She is in her 3rd loan cycle and has shown excellent repayment behavior. She wishes to utilize part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses and to increase business capital.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

loans.name: Gulnara

texts.en:
Gulnara is from Tkibuli district of West Georgia. She is 55 years old and lives with her husband, son and two grandchildren. Gulnara’s husband is provided with a retirement pension. The family is involved in an agricultural business. In particular, they run a small dairy farm with a calf and 3 milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. The cheese is sold at the local open market. In addition, Gulnara has a nut garden and a small plot of land, where different kinds of vegetables are grown. The harvested nuts are sold locally and the vegetables are used for family needs. Gulnara works hard to do her best for her family.

Gulnara wants to make some improvements and repairs to her old house, but the amount of money she has isn't enough, so she is requesting a loan to cover the costs of repairing the house such as changing windows, painting, etc. Taking this loan will create for Gulnara and her family suitable home conditions and enable them to enjoy living in their house.

loans.use: to renovate the house

loans.name: Jessy

texts.en: Jessy is requesting a new loan to buy ingredients to make good meals to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. In fact, she says that since the previous loan she hes been able to increase the number of customers, which forced her to hire an employee. She hopes that this loan will assist her in further increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and improving her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, sugar, beans, and other foods for her cafe.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SR DE LOS TEMBLORES III, la socia continua con su negocio de snack ella vende lo que son gaseosas,jugos,tortas,empanadas,frutas entre otros , su negocio esta ubicado por el centro de la ciudad ,ya es buen tiempo que la socia esta en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,la socia desea que su negocio cresca y terminar pronto su carrera,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta forma que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de gaseosas para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Miriam belongs to the Sr. de los Temblores III communal bank.  She continues with her snack business.  She sells soda, juice, sandwiches, "empanadas" [small pies], fruit, and other snacks.  Her business is located in the center of town.  She has been in this business for a long time and it's going well for her, thanks to the effort she makes every day.

She wants her business to grow and she wants to finish her academic program.  She's a responsible and hardworking person, this being how she gets ahead.

She's requesting the loan to buy soda for her business.  She's grateful for her loan and pledges to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy soda

loans.name: Monigo

texts.en: Monigo is 30 years old and lives in Sinkor, Liberia with her husband and two children, who are 4 and 10, and are in school. Monigo stopped her education in the 12th grade, and her husband is a business man. For the past twenty years she has been managing her mini provision shop, which she has in her community. She sells bread, mayonnaise, sardines, sugar, eggs, bath soap, biscuits, body cream, hair grease, soft drinks and many other items. Because she has what her customer’s need, they do not have to go a long distance to purchase what they want so Monigo is able to make a profit every day. She has requested her fourth loan from BRAC Liberia to purchase more sardines, bread, soft drinks, eggs, and body cream for her business. Her plan for the future is to become a successful business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more sardines, bread, soft drinks, eggs, and body cream for her shop.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 54-year-old married man, who has been working in manufacturing and selling handmade accessories and bags since 2002. Abdallah works with his wife to expand and improve their work environment.  They work from home to take care of their beloved children and at the same time save money to increase and expand their capital.
He is a loving father, he shares the responsibilities with his wife of taking care and raising her two children from a previous marriage as if they were his own kids, and at the same time their little daughter.  Abdallah is very strict about their products quality; they work so hard to please their customers in order to keep on expanding their business in a well-managed way.
Abdallah is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, it will be his ninth cycle as a Al Majmoua borrower with a perfect repayment history.  He is requesting this loan in order to buy necessary wool for his new handmade winter purse collection.  He hopes to expand their business in the future to make sure that their children will have a better life.

loans.use: to buy necessary wool for his new handmade winter purse collection.

loans.name: Gaudence

texts.en: Gaudence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with three children that all go to school. She has no additional family members to support. She sells milk in a shop that she rents. She also gets additional income from selling fruits and vegetables at the market.  She has been in this business for the last 2 years and works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 200,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy jerry cans of milk. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and to build rental houses. She lives in her own house and her family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more jerry cans of milk.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de artesania,la socia vende mantas y tejidos,al socia sigue teniendo un optica en el cusco,la socia la artesania lo vende en la plaza de armas,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 6 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de artesania.La socia solicita el credito para comprar mantas y tejidos.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member continues to be dedicated to the business of selling crafts. She sells blankets and woven items. She still has an opticians in Cusco. The member sells crafts in the Plaza de Armas. She sells from 8AM until 5PM. She already has six years experience and it's going very well. Her dream is to expand the crafts business. She is requesting the loan to buy blankets and woven items.

The member is thankful and wishes to express that she will make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy blankets and woven items.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y aceite.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member is still dedicated to the grocery store business. She sells rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8AM until 10PM. The member already has five years experience in this business and it's going very well. Through this business, the member is getting her children ahead. Her dream is to expand the grocery store business. The member is requesting the loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil.

The member is thankful and wishes to express that she will make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and oil.

loans.name: Gladys Elisa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de compra y venta de artesania,la socia vende mantas y lo lleva a diferentes ferias,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta als 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un locla donde pueda vender las mantas.La socia solicita el credito para comprar mantas.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member continues to be dedicated to the business of buying and selling crafts. The member sells blankets and takes them to different markets. She works from 8AM until 5PM. The member already has five years experience in this business and it is going very well. The member's dream is to have a shop where she can sell the blankets. The member is requesting the loan to buy blankets.

The member is thankful and wishes to express that she will make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy blankets.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 35-year-old married man, and father of four children. He has been a bus driver for four years.  In 2009 he bought his own bus.  Fadi works hard to provide a better life for his family.  In order to achieve their needs, he applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to carry out the necessary maintenance on his bus, which is his only source of income, and to repair his house since he has to replace floor tiles.
This is Fadi's fifth cycle with Al Majmoua, with a good standing repayment history.  His previous loans helped a lot in covering almost all of his family's needs.  Fadi has a very good reputation, and his customers are loyal to him. He hopes to open a transportation company in the future, to start tourist visits all over Lebanon and abroad.

loans.use: to carry out necessary maintenance on his bus and house.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales,ella vende quinua,tarwi,trigo y productos remojados,la socia lo vende en el mercado desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales.La socia solicita el credito para comprar tarwi,trigo y quinua.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Valeriana continues making a living in her business selling grains.  She sells quinoa, tarwi [a native Andean grain], wheat, and soaked grains.  She sells in the market from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has been in this business for five years and it's going well for her.  Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her grain.

She's requesting the loan to buy tarwi, wheat, and quinoa.

She's grateful and wants to make it known that she'll make her payments in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to buy wheat, quinoa, and tarwi

loans.name: Bertha Justina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de comida,ella prepara platos tipicos como cuy al horno,gallina al horno entre otros platos,la socia trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 8 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar productos para cocinar como arroz,pollo y carne.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member continues to be dedicated to the business of selling food. She prepares typical dishes like baked guinea pig, baked hen, among other dishes. The member works from 9AM until 5PM. She already has eight years experience in this business and it's going very well. The member's dream is to have a restaurant. She is requesting a loan to buy products to cook like rice, chicken and meat.

The member is thankful and wishes to express that she will make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy products to cook like rice, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en: Sylivia is lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with daughter that goes to school. She is also responsible for her mother.  She sells second hand clothes at the market. She has been in line of work for the last 3 years. She gets additional income from a food stall. She works six days a week.  She has requested for a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT – SACCO to buy a bale of second hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to buy a truck for transporting her stock to the shop. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: To buy a bale of second hand clothing.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annette lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children. Three of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of any additional family members. 

She sells passion fruit juice, sodas, and other soft drinks at the market on retail basis. She also gets additional income from selling snacks like cookies and cassava chips. She has been in this  business for the last 4 years.  She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of Uganda shillings 200,000 from MCDT – SACCO to buy crates of soda, passion fruit, and pineapples for making juice. Her major business challenges are transportation, and on and off seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to buy a big refrigerator so as to replace the smaller one she is using and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rental house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent, and food.

loans.use: to buy more  passion fruit, soda, pineapple and mineral water.

loans.name: Fe Romula

texts.en:
Fe Romula is a 49 year-old woman and a mother of four children from Antequera, Bohol, Philippines. Her husband drives a jeepney (public utility vehicle). She has engaged in basket weaving and a food vending business for several years now.  Fe Romula works hard to support her husband in helping to meet the needs of the family, especially the schooling of her children. She weaves baskets from bamboo and buri, a native palm, and sells it at the market.  She also sells home-cooked food.
This loan would allow her to buy more materials for basket weaving like bamboo, buri, straw and ingredients such as flour, sugar, and margarine  for her food vending business.  In the future, Fe Romula aims to expand her business to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more materials for basket weaving like bamboo, buri, and straw as well as ingredients such as flour, sugar, and margarine for her food vending business.

loans.name: Dionicia

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al ngeocio de compra y venta de artesania,la socia vende textiles y mantas,la socia lo vende a los diferentes tiendas que vende la artesania,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 5 años y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de artesania.La socis solicita el credito para comprar mantas y textiles.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagos de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member, Dionicia, continues to make a living in her business buying and selling textiles and blankets to the various stores that sell handicrafts.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She has had the business for five years and it's going well for her.  Her dream is to expand her handicraft business.

She's requesting the loan to buy blankets and textiles.

She's grateful and wants to make it known that she'll make her payments in a disciplined fashion.

loans.use: to buy blankets and textiles

loans.name: Mirian Iralda

texts.es:
Mirian es una mujer de 29 años divorciada que vive con su pequeño hijo de 3 años en la "Cooperativa 11 de Julio" de Santo Domingo que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador después de Guayaquil, Quito y Cuenca. Es la capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, una provincia de Ecuador que en los últimos años ha tenido un alto crecimiento sostenido. Su capital  es una ciudad en donde lo más atractivo y llamativo son sus deliciosas frutas, y la gastronomía que ofrecen en el lugar. También cuenta con un comercio considerable  ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio comercial entre las regiones Sierra y Costa del país. Además cuenta con varios atractivos turísticos que acompañados de su clima cálido son muy concurridos por turistas nacionales y extranjeros. Es por esto que la mayoría de sus habitantes han emprendido con alguna actividad comercial.

Mirian trabaja fabricando cepillos de plástico para uso doméstico desde hace 7 años. Aprendió a realizar esta actividad con su madre quien también se ganaba la vida de esta forma. Su jornada de trabajo diaria dura 8 o 10 horas y le ayuda una persona que ella contrató para poder cumplir con los pedidos que realizan sus clientes. Ella desea un crédito para poder invertir en materia prima y así lograr que su negocio crezca, Mirian ya ha solicitado créditos anteriormente en Fundación Alternativa y ahora requiere otro para invertir en su negocio. Ella ha realizado con puntualidad todos los pagos mensualmente.

A pesar de la materia prima ha subido de precio y de que hoy en día la situación económica del país se ha vuelto difícil, Mirian se esfuerza para que su negocio cada día crezca más ya que su meta es incrementar la producción y así tener mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mirian is a 29-year-old divorced woman who lives with her 3-year-old son in 'Cooperativa 11 de Julio' in Santo Domingo, the fourth most populous city in Ecuador after Guayaquil, Quito and Cuenca.  Santo Domingo is the capital of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas province, an Ecuadorean province which has experienced a high, sustained level of growth in recent years.  The capital is a city which offers attractive, colorful, delicious fruits and cuisine.  It also has a considerable amount of commerce as it has become a dry port where commercial exchange takes place between the country's mountainous and coastal regions.  For this reason, most of the city´s inhabitants have started up some commercial business or other.

Mirian has been making plastic brushes for domestic use for seven years.  She learned this trade from her mother who earned a living in the same way.  She works 8 or 10 hours a day and is helped by a person who she hired so that she could complete the orders that she receives from her customers.  She would like a loan to invest in raw materials so that she can grow her business.  Mirian has previously requested loans from Fundación Alternativa and now needs another one to invest in her business.  She has always made her previous monthly repayments on time.

In spite of the fact that the raw materials she uses have increased in price and the country's current financial situation has become difficult, Mirian works hard to keep growing her business every day as her goal is to increase her production and thereby make more income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make brushes for domestic use

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de agricultura,ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra maiz,papa y verduras como cebollas,zanahorias y luego lo vende en el mercado,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5.00 p.m y le va muy bien,la socia ya tiene 6 años en este negocio,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el terreno de cultivo.La socia solicita el credito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes.

La socia se encuentra agradecida y desea expresar que cumplirá de manera  disciplinadamente con los pagosde sus cuotas.
texts.en:
The member continues to be dedicated to the farming business. She has some farm land where she plants maize, potato and vegetables like onions, carrots and then sells them in the market. She works from 8AM until 5PM and it's going very well. The member already has six years experience in this business. Her dream is to expand the farm land. She is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

The member is thankful and wishes to express that she will make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Lutfy

texts.en:
Lutfy is 50 years old. She is a hardworking woman with a great desire to be a successful business lady. Her lifetime partner is a driver, and they have 2 children.

She is one of the successful business-women of her town. For more than 11 years she has been busy with selling industrial goods. She knows all aspects of her business very well. Her experiences and skills help her to develop her business and in this way improve her living conditions. She wants to develop the business further but her income is small and she needs to your help.

She is asking for a loan of 1500 TJS to buy industrial goods for widening the assortment of her inventory. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy industrial goods for widening the assortment of her inventory.

loans.name: Perveen

texts.en:
Perveen  is a 45-year-old married woman. For many years she has been hand-embroidering. She makes beautiful designs and patterns for the people living in her community. Her designs are much in demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the income of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of 15,000 PKR to buy reels of threads in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. In this way she would be able to cater to more customers consistently. She is hopeful to increase in her income by targeting more customers. She dreams for her children's bright future and desires to build her own house as she is living in a rented house with her in-laws.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 26-year-old farmer who grows potatoes, cow peas and vegetables. He is married and has one child. He has been farming for three years and also earns an income from selling shoes at a wholesale shop. He works very hard and thanks to Faulu Kenya he has learned how to save his money.
He aims to be a successful business man and buy a taxi in the future. He requires a loan of 20,857.50 KES to buy farm inputs and a knapsack sprayer for his farm.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and a knapsack sprayer.
